Reviews.Title: “Not at all what we thought it would be.”
Reviews.Author: khust11
Reviews.Content: If you want to stay in your grandparents retirement home, this is the place for you. Our "ocean view" was okay but our balcony was small and no room for chairs let alone standing room. Our room was decorated in a 1970's style. The bed was hard as concrete so we slept on the pull out sofa, not too much better. I will say the room was very clean, but overall the hotel staff had poor customer service skills. Housekeeping may or may not make it to your room before 5:00 pm. Everyday it's a surprise. The front desk appears to view the guests as an inconvenience. Oh and if you want to park, good luck with that. On average we were about 40 parking spots away from our building. The beach is great. The pool is filled with little children especially the hot tub. If you want to stay at an inferior resort, stay here. If not, spend a little more and go to the Sheraton.

Reviews.Title: “Poorest customer service we have ever experienced!”
Reviews.Author: shetab
Reviews.Content: We had booked a condo at Kaanapali Villas at appx 5 mo in advance and paid a deposit and when we went to check in, at 10PM we were told that we had been moved to another facility down the road. They sent us on our way to The Whaler with instructions for turns but failed to tell us how to get into the parking lot as there was a gate blocking it that required a code. We went to a neighboring hotel who told us how to use the gate. We loved the Whaler and would recommend it to all! When we checked out we were told to go back to the Villas to check out and get our paperwork and the desk clerk had no idea how to get us a receipt. This facility left us with a terrible perception and we would never recommend it to our friends.

Reviews.Title: “Priced right, fabulous staff, great location, decent rooms.”
Reviews.Author: firstreviewqwert
Reviews.Content: The positives outweigh the negatives, but first I will get the negatives out of the way - We stayed here with a wedding party and some people in our group were not given the rooms we originally requested and paid for in advance, so the management refunded us the difference, which is good but we were disappointed that they could not accommodate our requests which were made 5 months in advance. So if it is important to you to get a specific type of room, for example ocean view, then you should not stay here because they do not guarantee you will get that room. We even contacted the hotel in advance to confirm our room was ocean view and when we got there they apologized they didn't have any ocean view available. This happened to other guests in our party as well. The only other negative is each unit is owned individually and therefore you don't know what to expect because some have been updated with amazing upgrades and others are so outdated. We looked at 5 other rooms that our friends had and there was a wide variety of styles. On to the positive, which far outweigh the above complaints. The people who work at this resort are amazing. Some of them have been there for decades. My favorite was Joe... he is so friendly and nice. The cost of this resort is very fair and reasonable. The location is excellent - lots to do and see within 20 minutes driving. The resort is clean, comfortable, and spacious. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great place- so glad I ignored tepid reviews”
Reviews.Author: Mandys1411
Reviews.Content: We had a fabulous stay at the Kaanapali Villas- the hotel was exactly what we wanted- right on the beach, next to nice, newer, mega resorts but for half the cost. The room decor was average- nothing special but not a turn off. We had a full kitchen and the room walked out to a beautiful view of the "quiet pool". The bed was comfortable and in general the place was very clean. Every morning we walked/ran on the beach walk and had breakfast at the Castaway Cafe restaurant. The food was pretty good and prices very reasonable (very much like the midwest). There is supposed to be a trolley that comes by the hotel on the hour, but we never used it. The hotel is just one mile from Whaler's Village and we walked there every day. From there, you can take a bus into Lahaina, so we never needed a rental car. We only stayed for 5 nights but if our stay would've been much longer I think we would have needed a car. Most of the other guests were over 40. In fact, 60 may have been the median age. The pool was never crowded, it was always nice and quiet, you could always get a lounge chair or a spot in the hot tub and everything was very mellow. This made for an incredibly relaxing vacation. That's a long way of saying if you're looking for nightlife or looking to meet young singles this is definitely not the place for you. For us, the price was right, the hotel was just nice enough and we'd return in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “If you want more, you got to pay more...”
Reviews.Author: JennyistReiselustig
Reviews.Content: This was our first visit to Kaanapali Villas. We came here with our Kids and my Parents. My Parents have been to this resort 10 times and absolutely love it!!! This is why we decided to join them. All in all its it nice, the gardens and pools are beautiful and the rooms are spacious. It is an ownership resort, so not all rooms look the same. Ours was nice, a little dated but nice. It could have been a bit cleaner. I don't think they cleaned under the bed once while we were there. The bedding was not great, I asked for an extra blanket and the blanket they brought me belongs in the garbage, it had so many holes in it. I found the Gym a bit dirty as well, but thankfully there is a great beach walk there that lasted for some nice runs along the ocean. The location of the place is nice, that beach is a bit steep, but 100 m down in front of the West Inn is a great place to snorkel. The beach rental place has all you need to go snorkel, Kayak or Paddle board. Its great to have the free Trolley to drive you to whalers village every hour, its about a 20 min walk to get there. The little beach restaurant has awesome breakfast, but the wednesday night pasta dinner was a bit disappointing. All in all we got what we expected, we booked at a 3 star resort and got a 3 star experience. It was a nice family vacation with the Kids and my Parents.

Reviews.Title: “The quality of the rooms is average but the location is great”
Reviews.Author: das_ubersoldat
Reviews.Content: The rooms are dated and the furniture is... hmm... not my style :-) anyways these are condos, so you have a full kitchen included. problem is each of them is different but not only in terms of furniture style but also quality. ours for example had a sacking bed (really sacking). so we asked the front desk what they can do about it and they immediately offered us to change the room (they couldn't replace the mattress as it was 11pm). so we saw some other rooms and it kind of shocked me that you basically can get an awesome room or an ugly one. as i understand each of them is owned by a different person and aston is only administrating them. although the location is great i would probably not book it again. one very positive point: in the main building you had really thick walls (concrete) to your neighbours. so you couldn't hear them and it was therefore very quiet. definitely a big plus as most of the hotels in the US have "paper" walls.

Reviews.Title: “No guarantee”
Reviews.Author: sewsforfun
Reviews.Content: We requested a studio, garden view, with two beds. We were told when we checked in that all the two beds were gone and we would have to accept a King. They said you can only request a category and not beds. If I had know this we would not have booked this hotel/condo. They did bring in a roll a way for us. The room itself was very big and great. The garden view was of the street and to see the garden we had to go outside. Just be aware that you probably won't get what you want unless you want a king size bed as they only have 4 studio garden view rooms available.

Reviews.Title: “Not as good as in the past but still enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: rjmggftmac
Reviews.Content: This was our fourth stay at MKV (and my sixth stay) and while it wasn't our best experience, we still feel it is a great choice. The best thing about this resort is its beach (gorgeous, less crowded) and the location - in the center of Kannapali Beach and within easy walking distance of all the resorts on the beach and Whaler's Village, and a short drive to Lahanina area. The property grounds are beautiful and we felt that the landscaping was the best we've seen it. The disappointment is with some of the rooms which require updating. We were assigned a lovely room (514 I think) at first, but it had two single beds instead of the king bed we had booked. We were then assigned room 404 which was very small with very dated and dusty/dirty decor and furnishings, and backing onto the parking lot with not much of a balcony. We stayed one night in 404 and were then lucky to get room 114 which was bigger, nicer decor, and with a nice patio area. The main issue with 114 is that the bed was very uncomfortable and the 4 pillows provided were very old, worn out and flat. Also the refridgerator froze everything, the AC unit was very noisy, the sliding door to the patio was very difficult (and noisy) to open and close, and the patio and patio furniture were very dirty. While these are all just little annoyances, we feel that some of the rooms could use a spruce-up. Usually the desk staff are excellent, but this visit we kept encountering the same grouchy desk clerk. We also usually love Castaways restaurant but had one disappointing breakfast so didn't go back this trip. The best thing about Castaways is not necessarily their food, but rather the gorgeous view from the tables located along the beach. All in all, we still love most things about the MKV, but we will pay more next time for what will hopefully be a better maintained room. We stayed in one of the rooms in the Dolphin building the time before (Feb 2011) that backed onto the pool area -- we were going to try and book this same room again directly through the owner, but were concerned about having to sleep for a week on the somewhat uncomfortable "Murphy" wall bed located in that room. In hindsight, that "Murphy" bed was much better than the bed we had in 114.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: chezmelbourne
Reviews.Content: We absolutely loved this hotel. We had a studio apartment with partial water views. It was spacious and beautifully presented. The gardens are wonderful and the beach is private and not crowded like other resorts. If you are going to Maui stay here. Great cocktails by the pool.

Reviews.Title: “Kaanapali Villas Na ka oi!”
Reviews.Author: craigsf
Reviews.Content: The Kaanapali Villas is and always will be the place to stay in a world of mega resorts as far as I concerned in Maui. Its a beautiful property,perfectly located and a staff that is amazing assuring my family felt comfortable and special. Crowds are omnipresent in Maui and an the K. Villas is an oasis with great grounds, great location. You feel part of the Maui culture ie. Aloha spirit. Liked the Mai tai hour in the lobby and certainly added to its value... The room was perfect and recently updated. We plan to return in soon and no doubt it will be the Kaanapali Villas. Thanks to Pat the new GM and his staff for paradise dreamed becoming reality!!! Mahalo and aloha!

Reviews.Title: “If you like sharing a room with Family Roach....”
Reviews.Author: cococure
Reviews.Content: Overall- it was 'okay'- but next time I would go somewhere else. Maui is soo beautiful and there is so much to see, that its not necessary to stay in a beachfront hotel-- we only went to the hotel beach twice. The rooms appeared clean- but were not properly cleaned on a daily basis. The sheets were not changed everyday- which I thought was not acceptable. My child ate chocolate and left a stain on her sheets- and it took 2 days for them to actually change it. On 3 consecutive days we had ROACHES in the room- a small roach initially- we thought okay..lets not be one of those tourists that complain all the time. We killed it and it was fine. The next day however, there was a big roach-very disgusting..we caught it, killed it and had the room service remove it. Then on day 3 there was another roach running through the room ( my child screamed like somebody was about to kill her) and that was it for us..we were so disgusted- we had to change the room right away. We were on the first floor initially ( the room was actually very nice- except of the roaches) and we were then upgraded to an ocean view room on the top floor. The room was old and run down compared to our room on the 1st floor- but since it was our last night, we didn't care and just wanted to leave this Hotel. The staff/ receptionists were very helpful and nice- we didn't have to pay the extra hotel fee for the last 4 nights---but that still doesn't change the fact that there were roaches in the room. I would have been more satisfied if I got a refund for the last 4 hotel nights we spent ..all together we were there for 2 weeks. If it wasn't for the roaches, I would recommend this hotel-- but I'm sorry, I can't. And its not needed because when you're in Maui- there is so much to see, so many nice beaches, that it would make more sense to get a very cheap -BUT CLEAN place. And NO- please don't use the excuse that this is tropical and roaches aren't a big deal... I'm sorry but I've been to many many tropical places in this world ( Maledive Islands, Egypt, Sri Lanka, Thailand, Brazil, Mexico, Colombia, Venezuela, Barbados, Bahamas, Dominican Republic, Aruba....and I can go on and on with my list of places I've visited)-----BUT NEVER ,never , never HAD ROACHES IN MY ROOM! And the hotels I've been to were all between 2-4 stars hotels. I loved Maui-I will definitely come back to this amazing, magical island---but I will not come to this Hotel anymore. As I said- the Hotel itself, isn't bad, perfect location,the rooms are average, nice people, nice beach, good price----------but the room service (maids) and ROACHES IS AN ABSOLUTE NO NO!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: calgarytrigirl
Reviews.Content: Our family of four adults recently stayed in unit 515 and absolutely loved our stay. We were pleasantly surprised to be upgraded to an ocean view when we arrived. This unit is a one bedroom, one bathroom with 2 queen beds and a spectacular view of the ocean. It is a very modern unit with lovely island themed decor. We used the kitchen to cook most of our own meals and found it was well stocked with everything we needed. Daily maid service was great. The resort itself is gorgeous, with 2 lovely pools and gardens throughout and shuffleboard by the beach. Castaway restaurant has great views and has good food for a reasonable price. We enjoyed the free coffee served in the lobby every morning and there is a free mai tai party on thurs afternoons. The beach can't be beat; we saw whales almost every morning right from the beach in front of the hotel. When you walk along the boardwalk through many of the other resorts in Kaanapali you quickly realize what a gem MKV is, many of the other resorts are crowded and packed but as soon as you walk into the courtyard at MKV it has a quiet relaxed feel to it. It always felt like coming home after a busy day exploring the island. We had an amazing vacation here and can't wait to return; when we do Maui Kaanapali Villas will be our first choice.

Reviews.Title: “Celebrating our 50th Wedding Anniversary with our Family”
Reviews.Author: JanDuff5
Reviews.Content: We gave back to our children by offering a 50th Wedding Anniversary family vacation. All 19 who attended said it was the best vacation they have ever experienced! The Kaanapali Villas was the perfect location, everything you need within walking distance or by trolley. The staff was so accommodating, the villas met every expectations plus, plus, plus! Even though it was the holiday season and the area had many visitors...at the Kaanapali Villas there was plenty of outside space on the grounds and beach you never felt crowded... unlike the other near by high rise big change hotels. There were many family memories made and we plan to return in Dec. to make many more memories!

Reviews.Title: “Great Vacation spot”
Reviews.Author: bcd12
Reviews.Content: Love the place. Pool is a little cold in December.

Reviews.Title: “Not what I expected.”
Reviews.Author: evbnmkjh
Reviews.Content: Room didn't look at all like the brochure. Old decor. Furniture was old and somewhat run down. Dishwasher kept leaking. Hide away bed kept popping springs out onto the floor. Management staff didn't seem up to par or professional.

Reviews.Title: “We really enjoyed our stay here”
Reviews.Author: KSG123
Reviews.Content: We spent a week here in December in a studio with a full kitchen. The studio was very large and spacious with sliding glass doors out on to a large balcony with a nice table and chairs. The kitchen was very nicely equipped; new and modern; with granite countertops. It had everything we needed, for the most part, to make most meals (if we chose). Also had a new, modern, walk-in, tiled shower that was very attractive. King sized bed was very comfy. Flat screen TV on the wall. Pull out sofa. Small desk. Lovely dinette set for meals indoors, if desired. Very quiet; well kept space and grounds. We had no complaints.

Reviews.Title: “It's getting there”
Reviews.Author: Kevin W
Reviews.Content: When we first arrived and were assigned a room we were disappointed. The room was dated and the bathroom was unacceptable. They kitchen was perfect and had recently been renovated. It just seemed like a typica hotel room that was going to be remodelled any day. A lot of what you assumed would be a quick fix was not done. I spoke to the front desk and they were unable to give us an updated room until the following day. Once we checked into the new room we were extremely pleased. If this would have been our oringal room this would definitely be a 5 rating. This would be the only reason we would be hesitant to return is the fact that we don't know which room we would get. If we knew we could get an updated room we would definitely come back. As others had mentioned the location is great and the staff is very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable stay”
Reviews.Author: Ryan C
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a 8 day stay here with my family. The rooms were clean with the exception of the hide a bed sheets were not changed. They did change them the next day after I slept the night on the couch. The swimming pool was nicely built but the water was very cold. Everyone that was trying to swim agreed it could have been 10 degrees warmer. The location was great and the place was quiet. The hot tub was perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Happy, but could've been happier.”
Reviews.Author: Mel S
Reviews.Content: The room was spacious and clean, although it was not exactly what we expected. We were a bit disappointed when we first got into the room since we expected something more like what they are showing on their website's virtual tours of a one-bedroom Ocean View. In our opinion, it was a bit misleading. Although we did get an ocean-view room as booked, we were not too thrilled with the parking/driveway view. We just felt that we could've gotten a better unit. The dishwasher in our unit was really old and needed an upgrade. The fitness room looked a bit run down, although the equipments were still in good working order. On positive notes, the maid service was great. In fact, the staffs were all great, no exception!! We visited our friends who were staying at the Westin right across from our property, and their room was smaller compared to ours (also a one-bedroom ocean view). So overall, we had a pleasant stay and would come back again.

Reviews.Title: “Everything we wanted!”
Reviews.Author: phpr
Reviews.Content: Our group of 5 spent two weeks at MKV in late November and couldnâ€™t be more pleased with our choice. We had researched a number of properties along Kaanapali, and picked MKV from photos and reviews (thanks TA!) and were not disappointed. We had wanted a low-rise property, not too large or over-populated â€“ MKV fulfilled all of our wishes. We arrived very late on a Saturday night and were initially unhappy at being placed in the tower building on the 5th floor. However first thing next morning we spoke with front desk and were re-located to two one bedrooms, side-by-side on the second floor of the tower, along with a studio suite on same floor. The apartments were huge, with the added bonus of sizeable lanais that were great for dining and lazing about. (NB â€“ lanais on upper tower floors are narrow and not equipped with chairs or tables). All apartments had kitchen upgrades and were well decorated, although the kitchens could do with more supplies (not enough pots, pans, serving dishes, and the knives were hopelessly blunt!). The staff was exceptionally helpful â€“ always available to assist with any concerns or provide tips on places to see and things to do. Kudos especially to concierge Dawn who helped organize some golf, snorkeling, and destination trips. We used both the main pool and the smaller garden pool, the latter being our favorite as it was well protected from the wind and fewer children. Happy hour at the Castaway always enjoyable and a great spot to watch the sunset. Highly recommend Third Heaven Massage which operates out of the spa facility â€“ great value for the price. All in all a great property â€¦ we all hope to come back again!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect vacation”
Reviews.Author: Gbergby
Reviews.Content: This is the place to go if you have a family. I will break down this review into the following sections: Location, Accommodations, Beach Quality and Price. Location: It does not get any better. Close to Whalers Village, Black Rock, Napili Bay and Front street in Lahaina. In addition, the grounds are situated right on the beach and far enough away from the road to avoid noise. Accommodations: We stayed in the ground floor of the coconut room facing the smaller pool. Great Lanai open to perfectly manicured grass and the pool. The room was recently remodeled and the furniture and fixture were awesome. Love to stay in the emerald building next time. Castaway Cafe is a great restaurant for Breakfast and you are right on the beach and next to the larger pool. Housekeeping was fantastic, the resort was quite but you didnâ€™t feel it was deserted. It might have helped that we stayed from Dec 1st-8th which I was told was the slowest time of the year. Beach: If you have kids and want to spend time on the beach and ocean there might not be a better beach. Much of Kaanapali has a slight downhill into the water. Right in front of the resort is some of the least decline that we found in Maui. There is pretty good snorkeling right off the shore and there are great long walks to be had. If you want really good snorkeling you can walk the short distance to Black Rock. Price: Our trip was booked through travelocity as a package and we felt the price was a great deal. We had a room with a King, Hideaway bed (never used) and a kitchen. I thought we had a ton of value for what we paid. Overall, I would not stay at another resort other than this one when we go back to Maui. There are a few tricks to make sure you get a good room but it was easy to do. The staff at the resort were super nice (especially Joe). Joe was just a really happy person that took care of us anytime he helped us. This place felt like a home away from home. Perfect for families!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Stuff”
Reviews.Author: KatRossaNYC
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my family. Our 'apartment' suite was very specious! We had a huge bedroom with 2 double beds, huge living room, fully equipped kitchen and a huge bathroom. The furniture and rooms itself were a little out dated but as long as they stayed clean, it did not bother us the least in this paradise. The grounds were beautiful and so was the beach. The highlight of our stay though was the very friendly stuff that honored all of our requests and were doing everything to please us as guests. I would stay here again - awesome value!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, comfortable room, excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: Bruno G
Reviews.Content: First vacation in seven years for us was a hit - thoroughly enjoyed the facilities. Room (#320) was very clean with daily housekeeping (they even did the dishes a couple of times!) Peekaboo view of the ocean and great view of the grounds. Impressive grounds-keeping crew made it possible to walk barefoot pretty much everywhere. Direct access to beach and short walk to reef with multitudes of fish available for your snorkeling activities. Did not use the restaurant due to abundance of fresh fruit and seafood that we prepared in our kitchen. Only a couple of items stops us from giving an excellent rating: Depending on the wind, the traffic noise could be significant due to nearby highway (not enough to keep us awake though) and the niggling issue that there is supposed to be a free Mai Tai night that was promised when we checked in but which was cancelled without warning (it fell on Thanksgiving day). Otherwise, we feel that the Villas provide very good value - we will definitely consider it for our next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Gem”
Reviews.Author: mrsbubbawa
Reviews.Content: We stayed here over the Thanksgiving holiday for 12 nights and were absolutely delighted. We stayed in the Banyan in Room 225. The room was immaculate, the housekeeping excellent, and the front desk friendly and helpful. The grounds are beautiful and thoroughly enjoyed the quietness of the small pool and the Castaway restaurant. The location is gorgeous and easy to get to. It was our third time to stay at this property and were not disappointed and will stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing, relaxing and even more relaxing!”
Reviews.Author: Lori F
Reviews.Content: We had a villa on the ground floor that backed on to the back pool and it was heaven waking up every morning and eating breakfast on the terrace. The villa was clean and homey with a full service kitchen. Most nights we cooked our own meals and when we wanted to go out for supper we could just walk down to the Castaway Cafe on the beach for supper or a super delicious dessert and night cap. All the staff were friendly and helpful as well as our 'neighbours' in the surrounding villas. We made some great friends! The whole experience was like being at home but with beautiful weather and beaches. When we come back to Maui this is where we will being staying for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and room”
Reviews.Author: amelie J
Reviews.Content: We really enjoy it : the room is clean with a beautiful view on the sea, even if it is only a standard room (hotel room named) We have a balcony where we can take a drink. Some room have a kitchen. There is a nice garden inside the complex with a nice swimming pool and a small restaurant, not too expensive. We are very close to the beach. And it is one of the most beautiful. With my husband we like walking in the sidewalk, front to the beach, and that leads to Whale village, plenty of restaurants and shops. Then people at the reception are nice and helpful when the door remained unfortunately locked one night. The only bad point (but not for us) could be the decoration, that is a new but not modern. And also the fitness center with old engines. I really don't see why people take a four star hotel here. Sorry if my English is not perfect I m from Europe

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home”
Reviews.Author: teelpea
Reviews.Content: This review relates to a stay in April so sorry for the delay but such a nice place felt I needed to add a review - we booked a 1 bdm suite overlooking the pool (on the 4th floor) which suited us as we travelled with 2 kids 10yr and 8 mth old - this unit was a well cared for by its owners (timeshare?) they even had a guest book for your feedback and family photos so it was like staying in someones private unit. We stayed for 10 nights here and the kitchen was well appointed so once stocked up from the local supermarket managing meals was easy, especially with the little one. we had a couple of meals from the onsite restaurant they were OK and well priced for what you get. If you are looking for a self contained accm, travelling with kids, on the beach and close to shops but not right next to them then this is a good one to go with.

Reviews.Title: “Great Honeymoon Location”
Reviews.Author: flyzapper
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for two weeks while on our honeymoon, and we loved every minute of it. We wanted a larger condo-style room with a kitchen, not a standard hotel with nowhere to cook. Our room in the Banyan building was perfect for what we needed. It was a large (1100 square feet) two-story condo with a kitchen, dining room, living room, bedroom loft, and two bathrooms. It was a little awkward that the bedroom loft only had a small bathroom with a toilet and sink attached, and that the main bathroom suite was downstairs. Our unit was outfitted with modern kitchen appliances, two flat-screen TVs, and nice furniture. It was cleaned every day by the staff. The hotel grounds are amazing and are maintained very well. The hotel is right on the beach with easy access. There are two pools, each with a separate jacuzzi. The main pool near the beach is quite large, and has a bridge over it with a waterfall. There can be quite a few children in this pool. The smaller pool next to the Banyan building typically used by adults and quieter than the main pool. The Castaway Cafe is the hotel's restaurant, and is located next to the main pool. The prices vary, but tend to be on the expensive side. Once a week, all pasta is half off. The chefs are great, and even substituted Mahi Mahi for shrimp in a dish because I can not eat shrimp. The staff was very friendly, and treated us like family. We liked the mai tai parties with live music every Wednesday. The staff serves free mai tais, local snacks, and smiles. It seems like some of the negative reviews are from people who do not research hotels before they book. This is not a luxury hotel or resort with every amenity and that charges extremely high room rates. The Kaanapali Villas is a family-oriented complex made of individually owned condos. I have been to Maui several times with my family before, and this was my favorite place to stay. My wife and I enjoyed our stay here, and we plan on returning again soon. I

Reviews.Title: “Going back again!!!”
Reviews.Author: CarlsbadAnnie
Reviews.Content: Aloha! We were the family who stayed at MKV for our 20th anniversary with our 9 year old son, in June. We had a fabulous time - again! We decided to go back before Christmas this year also. Our stay there was wonderful. Our son met many kids at the pool and made many friends. The key to staying here is to make sure you get an upgraded condo. All the condos are individually owned, so no two are alike. We always have stayed at the same condo, so our stay has been enjoyable and predictable and we have been coming here for 20 years. The front desk staff usually know which condos are nice, and did guide us 19 years ago to a nicer condo, when we were there. And we never stay any place else now. The Castaway restaurant at the property is a great place to grab breakfast or lunch. And, Wayne the bartender, was very friendly and always remembered our names. It was like being at "Cheers". The restaurant staff was great too. The snorkeling, a short walk down the beach to the right, is the best on the island! There is really no need to take one of those expensive cruises to snorkel. Our condo has all the comforts of home and a sunset view that would take your breath away. The grounds are meticulously maintained and worth a stroll through. Many people from different resorts walk the trail that meanders through the resort. And the torches at night create a romantic and safe atmosphere. We especially enjoyed frog and crab "hunting" on the beach at night with our 9 year old. Our condo even has flashlights for this. We will let you know how our next stay is! Mahalo!

Reviews.Title: “Great place but rent the suites.”
Reviews.Author: Yago1
Reviews.Content: Units in B, C, and D are great. Location is away from the Kaahanapali craziness but still only a short walk away from the shops at Whalers Village. The restaurant is great.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid the hotel rooms”
Reviews.Author: Henry P
Reviews.Content: We started with a regular hotel room, which was in pretty shabby condition: one of the worst mattresses I've ever slept on, corroded window frames, extremely noise AC, carpet that came out of a 70's sitcom, lots of noise from equipment outside the room (oddly, the bathroom had clearly been remodeled sometime this century and was in very good condition). We upgraded to a studio for the remainder of our stay (at extra cost), and that was actually fairly nice. We definitely weren't the only folks with complaints about the hotel rooms, based on the other folks we met at the front desk that were also switching rooms. The food at the Castaway Cafe isn't very good, but the crowd is entertaining. Some of the best snorkeling we found was just steps away from the hotel, sunsets from the beach are fabulous, and there's a nice little farmer's market stand just across the highway.

Reviews.Title: “Ok until the cockroach appeared”
Reviews.Author: relaxinthesunrays
Reviews.Content: This hotel is only OK. The rooms are outdated. The bathrooms are a little smelly, dingy and stained, although they were kept clean. We had a nice enough time, but two things ruined it. We walked to the hotel next door and it was stunningly beautiful...which left us feeling a little bummed. But we got over that. The last night there, a two inch cockroach crawled above our bed. Disgusting and scary. The security guard promptly came to our room and caught it...but how am I supposed to sleep knowing another one may appear from under the countertop in the kitchen where it tried to hide form us?! I even tried to get a different hotel even though we were flying out in 9 hours. They could do a lot to improve this place. A facelift is definitely needed. Also, there is no waiter that comes to take your order at the pool. The beach is fantastic and swimmable (I believe not a lot of beaches in Maui are this nice), however, they do not provide you with beach lounger chairs. Instead, you have to purchase a cabana at 26 bucks a day or park yourself on a towel. The food at the restaurant onsite was not good and there is no room service. I realize this is a timeshare property, but it could be alot nicer with only a little effort. Tip:The Gazebo had the best breakfast. It is in some random timeshare property out of the way. Google it. You have to get there at 7am when the line starts forming. Worth it! YUM! Distance:Short Drive

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Devin W
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay. Shops and restaurants are close by. The beach was close by and exciting. The pool was always crowded but the area was always kept cleaned. Staff was visible all the time cleaning and up-keeping the property. I had a full kitchen in my room so that helped out in a good way. I will definitely be back again. The restaurant served some good food. The bartender was polite and very knowledgeable about the night life on the island. Over all the hotel was relaxing and quite

Reviews.Title: “Looking for a Spacious Studio? THIS IS IT!!!”
Reviews.Author: Jules G
Reviews.Content: Had the opportunity to visit these condos just this October and LOVED it. Great Front Desk staff. Patrick and Georgina truly has the guest best interest in mind. I had the Garden view studio Banyan Building on the 2nd floor. It was only a 3-4 minute walk to the beachfront swimming pool and beach. Castaway Cafe serves a delicious breakfast beachfront too. The unit itself more than accomodating for a Single family or couple. This particular unit was nicely furnished with marble counters also had a flat-screen TV. Also had King size bed with Queen size sleeper sofa. As well as nice little Lanai perfect for a evening night cap.

Reviews.Title: “Best condos in the area for a great price”
Reviews.Author: Aswst2
Reviews.Content: I have been going to Maui for over 27 years. I have stayed at a few condos and I think the Villas is the best value. The Alii is very nice but much more expensive and for the time you spend in the room not worth it in my opinion. The owners recently renovated most of the rooms so call and ask if they can get you a renovated room. The pool is great and the beach is one of the best on the right side a great place to snorkel and towards the left it is sandy with no rocks great to swim. You are close to almost anything and the free trolley will take you around. On a side note for the owners and Aston management. I have stayed at the villas over 15 times. The staff used to be really friendly "aloha spirit" this time they where rude and all around not very helpful or accommodating. I would suggest to the owners to find a new management company Aston has really gone down hill. I have been to villas a few times in the last couple of years and each time the management gets worse. All in all a great place to stay not over crowded and great condos. Just bring your own towels and try and not talk with the staff and management at the front desk and you will have a great time.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty and old.”
Reviews.Author: dhtlarmon
Reviews.Content: When we arrived at the hotel, the room looked like a flashback from the 70's. A few hours later I started to puke, probably from how dirty the room was and how old everything was like the carpet and apolstry. Also, our air conditioning did not work. By the next day I finally complained and they moved us to a nicer room that was remodled. If it wasn't for this I would give even lower ratings. The bar near the pool was also terrible. About the only good thing was the service at the front desk.

Reviews.Title: “Overall a great place!”
Reviews.Author: leelee6789
Reviews.Content: After neve being to Maui I searched and searched places and could not decide between Kaanapali or Kehei, I am very happy we choose where we did. We got in around 11:45pm and after reading on trip advisor someone mentioned to ask the front desk about seeing a few places before choosing our room, the late night guy was awesome, he noticed I had 2 kids and said we definatly didn't want the room we were assigned to as it had steep stairs and with the kids not good. He gave me 3 rooms to look at and we ended up with the one he thought we would. 212 was a fantastic room in the tower so with the elevators super easy access with the stroller, the room was huge! Over 900 sq feet, 1 bedroom big living room and big kitchen a full corner unit with a wrap around deck, I am still shocked how big this place was. All remodeled granite, etc, dishes, pots and pans etc everything was there for you, we were in need of a few bigger pots and some tongs but they ran them right up when we called. The maid was good, she did the beds, vaccumed, floors, towels etc daily and super friendly.The pull out couch was horrible. It was extremly uncomfortable, so if you are travelling with 2 couples and 1 has to get the sofa don't do it, choose and pay extra for the 2 bedroom. We did complain about this but there was a wait list for a foamy so they brought up a blow up mattress which was ok but a bed would of been much better! Also travelling with a 3year old and an 8 month old I would of liked to know there are no tubs here, all renovated places only have showers which can be a problem, if I would of known that I would of probably stayed elsewhere, its hard without a tub. The pools were nice, the kids pool was ideal and handy attached to the adult pool, they could use more kids stuff, like a water park area or swings etc. We found the Westin had a great kids waterpark and a majority of the kids at our hotel made there way over there a few times a day.The air broke in our room but the maintnace man was there immediatly and fixed it quickly, right below us were fantastic bbq's for everyone to use, we used the laundry facility and it was convienant. There is a cafe here which is directly behind the pool, we ate there a few times but found the one man (bald) not friendly at all so we ended up avoiding it because didn't want the attitude and feeling of not wanting us there. Many people commented on this, actual owners of the villas did as well. The other fellow and the blonde were awesome, for a pretty similair price you can walk down to the Westin and they have 3 or 4 very yummy restaurants there and its a great walk on the boardwalk along the Kaanapali beach! Safeway is close and 24hrs, as well there is a little market on th elocation which has some great ice cream my son loved daily and super friendly ladies working there! We didnt book and activities thourgh the ladies there but they did give us maps and helped us along to find the way anywhere we asked, there is a free shuttle to Whalers Village and you are about a 10 minute walk to the Sugar train that has a few stops and ends up in Lahania. The beach is amazing and approx a 3 minute walk here you can rent Cabanas for 20 bucks a day they were nice for the day, snorkles, lifejackets etc can be rented here, really I think this stuff should be free to use. Nothing was left in the room we rented and I had read people who stayed in our room 2 weeks before left chairs, snorkles etc, so rather than me leaving stuff at the end of our trip I gave it away to people arriving. Only problem we had was the day before we were leaving, front desk person "Rudy" and his personality matches his name was a grump from the beginning. I asked if we could get and extension on our room as our flight wasnt until 10:45pm so I would like to keep the room until 5:30 or 6 if I could,....absolutly not, knowing after talking to the other front desk fellow the place was only 60% rented/owner occupied at the time as October is the slowest month in Maui, I was like oh ok well can you give me the name of a hotel close to the airport so I can go there, he goes oh you have money and want to pay? I can find you a place here, not once did I mention I would not pay as with kids its easier than finding something to do for 11 hours rather than renting the room longer. He said for 130 I could get another room for 5 hrs whatever I said ok, but because our room was supposidly booked I had to move all my stuff from 212 to another room. Before I checked out I went back to 212, not only at 5:30 was the room not cleaned the maid told us no one was checking in there until tomorrow if the room wasn't cleaned already, so he could of let us stay in there but was a complete grumpy man from the beginning. Other than that would I stay here again, probably, good price, great location, amazing beach, close to the restaurants, great pools! One thing to make easier is they need a beach towel drop place by the beach and pool rather than trying to get new ones, the maids were always out of them.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location Great Value”
Reviews.Author: JT H
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in October of 2011. The property has a great staff. The Restaurant onsite is very good and has a great wine list. Overall a great value oceanfront location!

Reviews.Title: “Great View!”
Reviews.Author: Sharifah Z
Reviews.Content: Great access to the beach, if your in the coconut or the banyan building, its about a quick 5 minutes walk to the beach. I stayed in the Studio Ocean View room in the Aloha Tower on the 6th floor. I had a great view of the ocean, it was so beautiful to wake up to sunrise and seeing the ocean. The room was very spacious for a studio, the kitchen was updated with new appliances and also the bathroom. In the Aloha tower the lanai (balcony) is step-out juliet style so i open the doors and sat at the dinner room table and just enjoy the quietness and the view. Also I would recommeded having breakfast (of lunch or diiner) at the Castaway Cafe (which is beachfront restaurant).

Reviews.Title: “Good for families”
Reviews.Author: YuMCH
Reviews.Content: Good for families: not noisy, not crowded, not expensive, kitchen equipped rooms, children friendly. The hotel is old but clean. It's condo type, so a much depends on which room you get, some of them are remodeled, some are pretty worn-out. There is no sense to tell about our room coz you can have opposite experience, they all are different. Note there are regular free trolleys to Whaler's village and back. We decided to stay in the hotel because it's right between 2 great snorkeling spots: Big Rock (left) and Kahekili Beach Park (right), 7-10 min stroll each way.

Reviews.Title: “Great setting, service, and stay”
Reviews.Author: Chewiedog
Reviews.Content: I only wish our family of four could have spent a few more days taking in the sun and relaxing. The beach is awesome, the pool relaxing, and the grounds immaculate. Â And, their Castaway CafÃ© is amazingly convenient with a great setting, good food, and friendly service - perfect for a relaxing breakfast or quiet dinner. This was my fourth trip to HI, two of which were to Maui. Â As long as the Aston Maui Kaanapali Villas maintains their reasonable prices, dedication to their guests, and attention to the buildings and grounds, I won't need to spend much time planning our next trip because we'll just stay here. Mark

Reviews.Title: “Incredible value- wonderful stay in Paradise!”
Reviews.Author: Confusie
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I arrived very late after a long flight, exhausted....I was not pleased with the room that we were assigned to, so the sweet lady at the desk was kind enough to allow me to view several rooms before choosing an awesome ocean-front suite. It was beautifully decorated and updated, quite spacious, and the view was unbelievable with a balcony that stretched across the entire front and around one side. The grounds were fabulous and meticulously groomed constantly throughout our week-long stay. The staff could not have been more helpful as far as suggestions of places to go, restaurants, and insider tips. The on-site restaurant was extremely reasonable in their pricing and everything we ate was excellent!( the Macadamia nut banana, pineapple and coconut pancakes with the Lanai sauce were to die for !!) The staff there was also wonderful and friendly! The night we arrived, after checking in, we were starving and although they were already closed, they still put together a meal for us! The beach adjacent to the property was perfect for relaxing in the mornings before we began our long days and the perfect place to peacefully unwind in the evenings. I cannot say enough positive things about this property- totally incredible!!! The location was great as far as close proximity to so many different things to do . When we return to beautiful Maui someday, we will definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Best place on the island to stay!”
Reviews.Author: MootTravels
Reviews.Content: Paradise on Maui! Pool area is newly remolded, the restaurant/bar is wonderful, casual and fits all budgets. Wine list is amazing for this little hole in a wall! No car needed the Sugar Train is across the street, trolley brings you to Whalers Village, activities desk and car rental on-sight. The best snorkeling a few steps up the beach! The beach is not as crowded as it is on the other side of Black Rock (an easy walk to get to if wanted)l this beach is swim safe, beautiful sunsets and be sure to rent your snorkeling equipment or cabanas from Chuck on the beach The best luau is next door! The staff can be a little slow but wonderful and all the rooms are clean! Elevators and handicap access, and a small sundried store available. Internet available in the lobby which was also just remodeled. We come here as often as our schedules allow and our family has come to this location for over 20 years! You won't want to leave!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: Nancy W
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here two years in a row now and can't imagine staying any place else. The location is perfect, on a beautiful long stretch of beach that isn't overcrowded. The ocean is calm along this protected cresent and yields one of the best snorkeling sites. The room is very spacious and the full kitchen is perfect. Stop at Costco after you land and stock up. There are industrial size community grills around the property for personal use. The property is beautiful with lots of tropical flowers and trees. The pool is very nice and the restaurant located on the property serves up some wonderful deserts--take them to go and sit out under the stars on the beach! Although there are some children at the resort, it is a more serene, quiet environment-- mostly made up of couples. I almost hate to publish this for fear that our little secret place will become busy, but if you are looking for a nice, quiet relaxing place to stay that isn't full of loud kids and partiers then this is the place!

Reviews.Title: “Another Great Stay at the Maui Kaanapali Villas”
Reviews.Author: Frank O
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have been traveling to Maui since the late 70's. It is nice to visit a resort that has retained some of the earlier Maui style and feel - while offering all the comforts and amenities. The room, as on a previous stay, was very spacious - with a full kitchen and great view. The beach right out front is one of the best on the island. Castaway cafe - right on the premises - is one of our favorite eating spots. It is within walking distance of Whaler's Village and quite a number of great restaurants via the boardwalk either heading north or south. It is a quiet oasis in the heart of Kaanapali and a wonderful and peaceful reminder of an earlier time on Maui. We've given it a five star rating - not for any feigned opulence, but for its understated charm and wonderful location (not to mention the great value compared to the other neighboring resorts). Hopefully (fingers crossed) we'll be back again soon.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous as Usual!”
Reviews.Author: brenta38
Reviews.Content: We have been coming to MKV for 4 years now and continue to be surprised at the quality of the resort. The location is absolutely perfect, on the best beach for walking, snorkelling and views of Molokai and Lanai. The grounds are impeccable, and the pool and BBQ areas very well kept up. There is never a feeling of 'crowds" and the relaxed atmosphere is felt throughout. The staff is delightful and it is nice to see the same friendly faces year after year. It is quite simply THE place to stay on Kaanapali in our opinion!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Perfect !!”
Reviews.Author: beejaysgirl
Reviews.Content: I have nothing but praise !! Staff - helpful and friendly, location - perfect, Condos - clean and spacious, pool and hot tub - magic ! There are no hidden extras that you often find with other hotels and apartment complexes. Our second trip to maui and we will definitely stay here again !!! Wish i could click my fingers and be there again !!

Reviews.Title: “Very clean room”
Reviews.Author: Tish S
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a studio in the "Banyan" building. It had a full kitchen, and balcony which was nice. The room was very clean, and the housekeeping staff was very friendly. When we got there the guy who helped us at the front desk was very friendy. The lady who works at the general store was also very nice. My only complaint about the staff is I called prior to arriving because our flight was delayed to let the hotel know that we were stuck at the airport and we wouldn't be arriving until the next day. The lady who answered the phone stated that the cancellation policy states that a person must cancel 72 hours in advance and that they couldn't return any of the money. I told her I didn't know 72 hours in advance that I would be stuck in an airport and asked if I could please speak to the mananger. She told me she was the manager and finally agreed to extend my stay an extra day. I understand that places have policies but sometimes the unforeseen happens and it would have been nice if she offered to fix my reservation up front to save me some stress in an already stressful situation. She did maintain a polite tone of voice it was just frustrating to have to go back and forth about it. Every other business on Maui that I had to reschedule things with was very accommodating. So I guess I would recommend this hotel to people just keep your fingers crossed that your flight isn't delayed

Reviews.Title: “Great quiet get-away location”
Reviews.Author: Ken W
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a quiet location on Kaanapali beach,this is perfect! Not a large complex,so you do not get the large crowds around the pool, or along their beach, or any lines at the on-site Castaways restaurant. Located North of Black rock,all of the large resorts and thus large crowds are south of Black Rock. Becasue this in not one of the " all-inclusive " properties, we never had to put up with obnoxious rowdies that over-drink. All of the people working their were great....maids, bartenders, front desk, groundskeepers, etc.We had a 1 bedroom condo, which worked out perfect! We shopped at the Safeway in Lahaina, so we could fix some of our meals in the well-stocked kitchen in our unit. Our condo was very clean, and quiet. This property is perfect for couples who want a quiet, get-away . It would also be good for couples with small children/babies. If you are looking for a property that has booming music around the pool, and a " party till the middle of the night " atmosphere, this is not it.

Reviews.Title: “good stay”
Reviews.Author: RandL101
Reviews.Content: We had the most wonderful time. Our studio room was beautifully decorated, first floor, walk out on the lanai, fed the birds, sat and enjoyed the sunsets. Landscaped view of the pool, a few steps to the ocean. It was quiet, hotel staff was really nice. Beach is beautiful.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Value”
Reviews.Author: Ron H
Reviews.Content: I made this trip from New Jersey as a rescue mission. My sister-in-law and her daughter arrived for a week's vacation. Two days into her vacation she had an accident and was in the hospital for 5 days with a collapsed lung and bruised ribs. I flew out to help. They were staying at the Hyatt. I stayed at MKV because I've stayed here 5 prior times and loved the resort. It had everything I needed. My sister-in-law came here out of the hospital to recuperate and the entire staff were fabulous. Her doctor would not let her travel home to NJ for an additional 11 days and MKV let us all stay in very nice studio condo's at VERY affordable rates. Her recovery is ongoing but she was able to relax and enjoy her extra time in Maui very comfortably. I would definitely recommend Maui Kaanaplai Villa's to everyone who wants to enjoy Maui and all it has to offer

Reviews.Title: “Fifth stay here; Still as good as ever!”
Reviews.Author: Larry F
Reviews.Content: After four previous successful stays here, we didn't even look at other places. for our first two stays, we were given rooms in the villas and the next two were in the tower. This time, we were back in a villa and it was perfect! The staff were very helpful and the room and facilities were maintained well. We made multiple visits to the Castaway Cafe for meals and drinks and were delighted with the quality of the food, especially the pancakes with pineapple, banana and chopped macadamia nut toppings. The hotel is North of Black Rock and provides a quieter environment than on the main Kaanapali strip. I do have to say that we visited the last two weeks of September so there wasn't a lot of children in evidence; only infants and pre-schoolers. Our room was on the second floor of the Coconut building and so delighted us that my wife made notes for our next trip to ask if we could get the same room.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: BarbaraJane367
Reviews.Content: The Villas are right on the beach. They just refurbished the Villas in July - everything looked great. The staff is very professional and friendly. They have their own restaurant - partially open air and again, right on the beach. The lounges are available on a large grassy lawn with partial shade from trees or next to a very nice pool. This my the fourth visit. Kaanapali beach is a long beach, you can walk for a very long time, stop at other hotels and shopping areas and take a free little jitney back to the Villas. I have no complaint except I wish I were there now.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice experience overall.”
Reviews.Author: TracyandJade
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a few days and had a nice experience. The rooms were somewhat dated but extremely well kept and clean. The grounds were immaculately maintained. The pool was in perfect condition and there was a nice pool bar and restaurant. The property was on the beach. We ate a breakfast and an evening meal at the restaurant on the property called Castaway Cafe. Excellent! They had a five start wine list. I highly recommend both the restaurant and the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A Very Enjoyable stay! Good staff, Well-kept grounds and Big Comfortable Room!”
Reviews.Author: LauraJBB
Reviews.Content: Our recent stay was very enjoyable! The front desk staff was friendly, the grounds were very well kept, the beach was uncrowded, clean with lots of sandy shoreline (not too rocky). Best of all, our room was quite spacious compared to other hotel rooms I've stayed in on the islands. It had a fully stocked kitchen which was very convenient even though we ate out mostly. The full size refrigerator was perfect for left overs, keeping fresh fruit and bottled water chilled. The only reason this rating is 4/5 is because I don't want people to expect Sheraton/Marriot up-scale hotel room decor. The furniture in our room was not modern, but the room's spaciousness and amenities made it an especially comfortable place to enjoy our vacation. We plan to stay here again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Vacation!”
Reviews.Author: RVfromAZ
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a week, loved it! We were in a Studio Condo - ground floor of the tower building, nice quiet garden view. As others have stated this resort is not very crowded, it's very peaceful. Grounds are very beautiful, and tropical. Very nice pool area (there are 2 pools) Beach was awesome, nice clean sand, not crowded. We snorkled, rented a paddle surf board - lots of fun! Our studio was perfect, lots of room, updated kitchen and bathroom, nice Lanai with table and chairs, and a lounger. Nice, helpful staff. We hope to return here again, I highly recommend this property to anyone who wants a nice relaxing vacation in Paradise!

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: LoveMaui8_28_11
Reviews.Content: What a perfect location to stay at! We were in the Dolphin complex and although you could not see the ocean from our room, you could see the ocean from our patio. We were 20 ft away from the pool and about a 20 second walk from the beach. The beach was clean, not too crowded and great for swimming/snorkeling! The hotel grounds were immaculate and beautiful. The staff was friendly and helpful. The drinks at the Castaway Cafe were delicious! This location and experience was perfect and this is a great for people who do not want to stay in a large hotel and have easy access to the ocean. Also, if you are wanting to stay here and attend a luau, the Royal Lahaina Hotel Luau is right next door and a 2 minute walk from the Aston Maui Kaanapali Villas.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location, great deal, wonderful beach!”
Reviews.Author: cmventura
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this hotel twice before and always feel like we made the right choice. The beach is fantastic. It is clean, the water beautiful and there are no large crowds since it is north of the black rock (which divides this part of Ka'anapali beach from South Ka'anapali beach where all the gigantic resorts are. The rooms are large, some of them renovated. All rooms have balconies overlooking the beach, the pool or the tropical gardens. Property has two pools. There is also a beachside cafe which is nice if you want to grab a drink while enjoying the sunset. And let me tell you about sunsets here. From this property you will enjoy fantastic sunsets. It has a direct view of the islands of Lana'i and Moloka'i and the sun, for most of the year, sets right between these two islands which makes for a wonderful view. Travel time to Whalers Village is about 5 minutes, if that. Lahaina about 10, if that.Overall, I wouldnt stay anywhere else on the island, I avoid any huge resorts full of kids and people.. This has the perfect amount of privacy and seclusion.

Reviews.Title: “Great vacation lodging”
Reviews.Author: Jim M
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a weeks stay at Aston's Kaanapali Villas. We located the property thru Trip Advisors and chose to stay there because of the reviews that were written about the property. Even though the resort is older, it is very well maintained, yet because of it's age the grounds are mature and beautiful. We spent a lot of time on our lani just admiring the tropical view. The staff was excellent. We had rented a hotel room with a king size bed but at check-in only rooms with queens were available so the clerk asked us if we would like to look at some different units. After looking at 4 different rooms we were upgraded to a condo at no extra charge. I have never been to a hotel that insisted I look at a room before I stayed there but this is exactly what happen at the Villas. Beach access is a pleasant 5 min. walk from the condo we were in, (Coconut is the furthest building from the beach) and we had a swimming pool out front when we didn't want to mess with the sand. There is also a pool and bar next to the 2 condos and hotel so your never very far from water! Kaanapali beach is very long and the southern end can get pretty busy but the northern end where the Villas is located was not crowded at all. We were there over Labor Day weekend and were surprised at how few people were on the beach. We're already planning next years trip and definately will stay at the Kaanapali Villas when we go.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for longer stays, awesome view and I'll definitely be back!”
Reviews.Author: LASbobcat
Reviews.Content: This place is fantastic for people staying for longer periods of time. We have a full kitchen and access to a grill making it wonderful when you don't want to eat out every meal. The staff is wonderfully helpful and the housekeeping is great. After walking along the beach walk, I can say with full confidence that I wouldn't trade my room here for one at any other resort. Great beach (less crowded than many!), good atmosphere, nice pool, very comfortable and clean, easy access to anywhere! Can't wait to come back :)

Reviews.Title: “Low profile Hidden Gem resort”
Reviews.Author: R T
Reviews.Content: My family and I have been to Maui Kaanapali Villas 3 times and I can't recommend it enough. The location is ideal...directly on the Kaanapali Beach. The staff are extremely friendly, knowledgeable, and hard working. The rooms are very clean and updated. In addition, there is an excellent restaurant/cafe/bar overlooking the beach with reasonably priced, great food and drinks. Also, there is a beach/water sport rental business on the property that is run by very nice and helpful staff. Overall, my family greatly prefers this resort over the much more expensive larger hotels up and down Kaanaplai Beach. We will continue to vacation here and recommend to our friends!

Reviews.Title: “"Wonderful place to relax, enjoy the outdoors and shop"”
Reviews.Author: ShanaKalaakea
Reviews.Content: The garden view studio was beautifully decorated and very spacious. Unit has a full kitchen and is just steps to the pool, jacuzzi, and out door BBQ. The beach is know as one of the islands best snorkeling sites, and you can walk for miles. The grounds are beautifully planted, and I loved the evening Tilki torches. Has the feeling of a private home/condo. Quiet, peaceful, and convenient to the beach and downtown Lahaina.

Reviews.Title: “WE'LL ALWAYS COME BACK TO MKV!”
Reviews.Author: Tina B
Reviews.Content: We visit Maui every other year and we've stayed at the Maui Kaanapali Villas 5 times. We've tried other vacation rentals and big resort hotels and love the amenities and area of MKV. We travel as a family and have always had great rooms/units that accommodate us and our children. We have the option of eating in/cooking in the well-appointed kitchens or going out to the nearby eateries. We're on arguably the best beach on Maui, close to Lahaina, shopping, restaurants, snorkeling, golf, hiking, water sports and more. MKV has a lovely pool area and a quaint restaurant that offers a local flavor and excellent food - with a terrific view of the beach - we've spent many a sunset on the patio!

Reviews.Title: “Best Beach in the Area”
Reviews.Author: Cheryl S
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have stayed at MKV many times over the years. We love it! The beach is the best around with beautiful sand and great snorkeling. The condos are perfect for families or couples who want to relax and get away from the crowds and noise of large resorts. The condos and grounds make for a relaxing and peaceful vacation. Shopping is nearby. Paradise!

Reviews.Title: “Great Spot!”
Reviews.Author: Eddiebo
Reviews.Content: Okay, if you're looking for the Westin, it's down the street. If you're looking for good value for your money and a great place to stay, this is it. So this is an old place. HOWEVER, they renovated about a year ago and it's outstanding! Here's a quick summary from my perspective: * Immaculately kept grounds. * On the beach. * Great staff. * Great price. * Awesome cafe on the beach. (get the "Big Kahuna Dog") * Nice rooms with stoves, fridge, etc. So for anywhere from $120 - $170/nt this is a great place to stay in West Maui. We originally booked on priceline for $117/nt but had four people so we needed to upgrade. They charged us an extra $20/nt here at the hotel. This got us a room with two queen beds, full fridge, oven/stove, coffee maker, dish-wear, pretty much everything. $137/nt for a nice place in Maui. I'll take it. Of course everyone has different experiences when it comes to hotel rooms but ours was fantastic. Give them a try.

Reviews.Title: “Back to the 70's”
Reviews.Author: Marcela K
Reviews.Content: My first impression is the lobby area was beautiful and I was thrilled to have picked a winner But as I left that area to my room I went into a time warp. It's as though they ran out of money and stopped renovating. The walkways were painted and our room was stuck in the 70's. Friends of ours stayed down the road at Honua Kai Resort and WOW that place was fabulous. This place was not money well spent. I would suggest going to a newly renovated hotel unless of course you missed the 70's then you will feel right at home.

Reviews.Title: “Get Away from the Crowd at Maui Ka'anapali Villas”
Reviews.Author: expat326
Reviews.Content: The Ka'anapali Villas is a low-rise complex with spacious grounds, pools, a small restaurant, and is right on beautiful Ka'anapali beach. Our studio was large and nicely furnished with granite countertops, new appliances, tile floors, and a huge walk-in bath and closet. Our 'kids' had a generous one-bedroom in the Aloha bldg. The kitchens were well stocked with dishware and utensils. Our grandkids enjoyed making new friends at the 'active' pool while we did not feel overrun as happens at some family-friendly resorts. We also enjoyed snorkeling at the nearby reef. We took advantage of the free shuttle to Whaler's Village Mall and the luau at the Royal Lahina next door. The housekeepers kept our rooms tidy and well supplied with towels. There is a laundermat onsite that we used once but can't say we made it inside the fitness room. On Thursdays, there was live music, free drinks and snacks in the lobby. Our only disappointment was the Aston Kids Stay, Eat, Play program and coupon book which was useless due the limited number of places to use it and all the restrictions.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this resort-absolutely heavenly-will be back soon!”
Reviews.Author: BCvisitors
Reviews.Content: We stayed in July/11 in an ocean view condo, with the best view of the ocean out of all the windows, The condo was very roomy and clean for a family and great kitchen. The staff at the front were very friendly and so were the cleaning ladies. Very comfortable beds too. The new lobby was beautifully updated and lovely and the best part of the resort was the beautiful, tropical grounds, pools and the best uncrowded beach in front. We thought this resort had the best tropical grounds and Hawaii feel from all the ones we looked at that are on the boardwalk walk. Many of the other resorts are large concrete jungle buildings and little landscaping MKV was just so tropical. We loved MKV, and already are planning to come back next year!

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: Bgkahuna
Reviews.Content: This hotel/condo is a great value in the lahaina/kaanapali area. The staff are helpful, and maid service are very good. This is the deal when u reserve a room. The villas and rooms are individually owned by private persons and the property is managed by Aston . Sometimes the owners update their property with granite counters in the kitchen and bath area, and invest in nicer furniture. And on the flip side , some owners don't spend anything on upgrades. So unless you specifically ask for an updated room, you might wind up in room that looks like a time capsule from the 80's. The beach area is great. You kind of have a private beach because of the jetty (black rock) that separates the rest of kaanapali and lahaina. It is not nearly as crowded as the other area. Quiet strolls are possible on this beach and the sunsets are amazing. Overall a great value on Maui .

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful did not want to go home!”
Reviews.Author: njtess96
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a two bedroom garden view villa. The second bedroom was an upstairs loft. We booked the hotel about 9 months in advance and when we arrived we asked if we could see a couple of rooms in our price category. There were rooms in the hotel building and then several outer villas. We chose a room in the coconut building. The room was great, full kitchen with everything we needed. The location is close to everything. The staff was always polite anf friendly. The restaurant at the hotel The Castaways had great food and we had a wonderful vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Great Family Place!”
Reviews.Author: EAV2
Reviews.Content: A low density, family-style condo development. The grounds are beautifully landscaped, the two pools are nicely screened from surrounding condos, while being centrally located and accessible. The beach is absolutely beautiful, clear, and swimmable and much less crowded than near Whaler's Village, Sheraton. The Westin further west is an enormous facility just down the beach but is right in front of some of the best coral beach to snorkle. Better to stay at the villas and walk down to the westin beachfront. My family had a great time there. Quiet, lots of grass, lounge chairs, shade, beautiful beach. Our room was nicely appointed, with comfortable king size bed, fully stocked kitchenettes, dining tables and chairs inside and on the lanai. We love it there! It's low key, comfortable and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant place to stay!!!”
Reviews.Author: padywop
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for our honeymoon for just over 2 weeks and after coming all the way from the UK we were hoping that all the positive reviews on TA were true............and they were. Even though we checked in late in the evening we got our welcome back with some champagne for us honeymooners and were asked if we needed any help with anything to get us settled in. We staying in room 239 in the Banyan building and we loved the layout and location overlooking the smaller, quieter pool and a glimpse of the ocean in the background. The place was kept clean and tidy and all the on site facilities were excellent. Castaway Cafe was a nice little place to grab dinner, especially on pasta nights!!! The sunset view must be the best on the island from here. The beach was perfect, a little way from the busier noisy areas at Black Rock but only by a 5-10 minute walk. Great snorkelling at Airport beachtoo, again only 5-10 minutes away. I will definately be going back as soon as i can.

Reviews.Title: “It was paradise - we would return.”
Reviews.Author: Phoenixblue50
Reviews.Content: We toured 3 islands of Hawaii in 16 days and we spent four days at the Aston Kaanapali Villas. The Studio Garden View Suite was spacious, clean, full kitchen, comfortable tropical furnishings, and had a beautiful wraparound balcony, facing the oceanfront - however as the beautiful and lush plumeria and palm trees blocked the view of the water, it was called garden view. Conveniently located near the great town of Lahaina, and also within walking distance from many beachfront restaurants (Dukes Beach House was great) so close that you could wine, dine, and walk back to the villa on the beach boardwalk, which was also great for walking or jogging. The beach was clean, sandy, calm for swimming, uncrowded, and had fabulous sunset views! We highly recommend the Tour to Hana, and snorkeling at Molokini Marine Preserve for outings. The only drawback was that the balcony was a little noisy at peak traffic times as the building backed fairly close to the main highway. Reasonable rates that included parking and WiFi. We will certainly return.

Reviews.Title: “Great place and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: raralston
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the hotel part of the resort and very much enjoyed it! Clean, beautifully decorated room. They provide a trolley to other hotels, shopping in the area free of charge.

Reviews.Title: “Had a great time!”
Reviews.Author: deadmessenger13
Reviews.Content: Loved the property - the rooms were just what we needed, and the grounds are lovely. The staff couldn't have been nicer or more helpful - truly they were fantastic

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Place in Paradise”
Reviews.Author: denise_cote
Reviews.Content: Great location and fantastic beach. We stayed in room 420 which was perfect for our family of four. Will definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “amazing condos”
Reviews.Author: europeantravler_2011
Reviews.Content: i have been staying at this location for many years and can never complain...its off the main hotel strip which makes it less busy and it a lot of fun....perfect beach out front and walking distance to an amazing reef to snorkel...the service is amazing and the people are always nice...the resturaunt always has some specials going...perfect place for big groups and amazing location...a must stay

Reviews.Title: “Not glamorous, but good!”
Reviews.Author: bgsualum
Reviews.Content: My husband and I, and his brother and his wife, stayed here for the second night of a three-day Maui mini vacation. We arrived at dinner time and checked out late the next morning, so we weren't there long. We had two rooms that were next to each other (though not adjoining as we'd requested and been told we had). Our room was nice (huge!), but it definitely showed some wear, especially in the bathroom. The mattress could have used to have been replaced, as well. It had a nice kitchenette, though we didn't use it at all. We ate breakfast at the Castaway Cafe and it was really good. My husband and his brother rented snorkeling gear and spent the morning snorkeling while my sister-in-law and I lounged on the beach. It was a lovely beach and it wasn't overly crowded. Both check-in and check-out were fine with the front desk staff being very personable. The location was convenient to Lahaina, where we spent the last day of our trip walking around. We would definitely stay here again were we to come back to Maui and want to stay on that part of the island.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel / Condo setup.”
Reviews.Author: SteveTodd2011
Reviews.Content: My boyfreind and I stayed here in one of the condo suites facing the pool area, and we enjoyed our stay here very much. It's an older hotel, and not as large and grand as some of the other hotels near by, but what it lacks in size, it makes up with location. The beach is large and beautiful and attached to the hotel. The beach in front of the hotel is also quieter than the sorrounding beaches because the other hotels are larger and have more guests staying in them. The grounds are well taken care of, and the two pools were very clean. The room we stayed in was on the second floor near the back of the grounds facing the second pool, and was completely renovated and clean. All new kitchen and large flat screen TV. We walked all over the place, and decided that if we came back to the Island, we would strongly consider booking again at this Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Maui is Heaven”
Reviews.Author: LoveMaui2011
Reviews.Content: We stayed and Maui Kaanapali Villas in January 2011 and loved it. Our room was very clean and well stocked with the kitchen essentials you need. We had a studio room with a partial ocean view. The lanai was quite small so we couldn't sit out and enjoy the view. The hotel grounds are beautiful and very well groomed. The beach was a short walk from our room which we didn't mind at all and the views from the beach were spectacular. We watched the whales enjoying a beverage. Spent the whole day just watching the ocean. We lost track of time. Very relaxing part of the beach. Not overcrowded. We enjoyed the restaurant on the property, Castaways, which is next to the beach. Very good food with large portions. There is a path to walk on to get to Whalers Village where there is plenty of shopping options, but we really just enjoyed sitting on the beach at our resort and then driving into Lahaina later in the day to walk around. We loved staying here so much we already booked our reservations for January 2012. I'm ready to enjoy another relaxing, enjoyable 10 days with my spouse. It's like a honeymoon all over.

Reviews.Title: “WILL BE BACK NEXT YEAR SAME PLACE”
Reviews.Author: LovinMaui2011
Reviews.Content: This place is absolutely gorgeous. The staff is Awesome, the Views are great, Just a hop skip jump to the beach which never was overly crowed like the other resorts. IT was clean and very nice all the way around. We walked to Whalers Village which was a very nice and beautiful walk. The rooms are absolutely just what I wanted. We walked to a couple other resorts to eat and they were just to overly crowded. Here at the villas its perfect. I just can't even say enough about this place. I will be back with my 2 older kids in April of 2011.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Coconut62
Reviews.Content: Nice tranquil spot. Clean. Friendly staff. Though some rooms are dated others have been updated. Nice beach and close to all amenities.
