Would be good if pool and hot tub was open a little longer (perhaps 11 p.m instead of 10 p.m) for a quick swim after an evening out. Would recommend for couples and families. Tour desk very helpful and don't miss Mai Tai Thursdays! Parking and internet are free but there is a $13/day resort fee.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing atmosphere, we will return.”
Reviews.Author: jayjayAustralia
Reviews.Content: Kaanapali Villas is a relaxing spacious resort, not as large as most resorts but this is definitely in their favour. Set in beautiful grounds and gardens with great fenced pool so that families can relax and right on the beach for those who choose crystal clear water and white sand with not too many people. We loved our stay here, staff were friendly and our condo was clean and spacious, we will definitely return. Decor is a little outdated but comfortable balcony / lanai is quite narrow but fine if you open sliding doors to create space.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Dreamy!”
Reviews.Author: HeatherSL
Reviews.Content: My sweetheart and I got away to MKV for a much-needed week of relaxation. Here are the highlights: Accommodations - excellently furnished, clean, homey, contemporary, gorgeous Staff - responsive, respectful Activities - quiet pool, loud pool, strong ocean current but excellent snorkeling right off the beach just north of MKV property (we saw a multitude of colorful fish, eels, a pod of dolphins and others nearby saw a turtle), free trolley to nearby locations. Overall, excellent experience and a bargain. Every time we went off property, we were bombarded with crowds, chaos, traumatized wildlife and generally no fun. MKV literally seems charmed - even the daily clouds/rain slide by on the northern edge leaving it mostly sunny. The lady at the activities desk does nothing but scowl and read novels. Not even a 'hello' the entire week! Downsides: The spa is really just a glamorized closet - massages poor and not worth the price. The dining is just so-so, but convenient. Very well-stocked though predictably pricey hotel store. We could tell that we landed in one of the best units in the place. It really does vary by owner and if you'd like to reserve the one we stayed in, reach out to me and I'll give you the owner's contact info.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: ADeissroth
Reviews.Content: This is going to be long... I want to be thorough so that i am helpful, i cant stand reviews that are short and dont help at all... why even leave a review? I thought that the price of the hotel and the amount of amenities would be too good to be true..just FYI though AMKV was not a hotel for people that want glits and glam and to be pampered. But for people that are down to earth and practical this is a great place... But dont mistake that comment to mean this place is shabby in any way, it is absolutely beautiful and you get all of the average amenities and then some. But starting off we arrived to Joe at the front desk and he absolutely, hands down, was the best person to start off our honeymoon check in. He upgraded our room to an ocean view at no charge to us and made sure that we had a bottle of champaigne. We were in the tower room 620. The hotel and room was clean, the grounds were amazingly well maintained, and just lovely. Our room was recently renovated with granite countertops nice furniture and had huge mirrors throughout the entire room that made the place feel much larger than it already was. The kitchen was complete with everything you can think of to feel at home. We woke every morning to bright skies and birds chirping. And the room had an awesome AC so when the nights were hot and muggy (bc that is Hawaii for you) we just turned on the AC and were super comfortable. The grounds were beautiful kept and every night they lit the torches all around the property which was so cool to walk around at night. The beach was perfect. The sand was fine where we were and if you go to the left towards the sheriton the sand becomes more course and you can see the black rock beach and if you go to the right towards the Westin the beach becomes super corally and the snorkeling there is amazing. We just got some snorkel gear and snorkeled there like 4 days it was so great. We saved money doing it that way instead of pay for a cruise ;that takes you out in the middle of the ocean and you have to squint to see anything because you are so far above the coral. In front of the Westin You only have to walk about 10 feet from where the wakes break to see so many different types of fish. There are these black fish that hang around the shore so you can see them just feet from the shore. We even saw two turtles there during our many snorkeling adventures. They have a trolley that goes to the Whalers village but we didnt use it bc we had a car and we only wanted to do whalers village once, why spend time at a mall when you can be doing so many other things. Joe suggested a restaurant called Da Kitchen in Kahului that serves hawaiian food and it was perfect. Great prices for the amount you get. We had dinner for LITTERALLY three meals. $8-$15 PerPerson. Thanks Joe The pool area is beautiful and fun. There is a bridge that crosses over the pool and you can swim under the bridge and there is water the falls continually from the bridge which is fun. There arent too many kids but it is not just for old people like some of the earlier reviews state. My husband and i are 23 and we had a lot of fun and didnt feel out of place at all. We didnt eat at the Castaway but it seemed like it had a steady stream of customers and we heard from other vacationers that the food was great especially the breakfast. We will not hesitate to stay at this location for our future Maui trips or any of the Aston properties on the other islands for that matter. Thank you soooo much to everyone at The Villas especiall Joe - Jon and Ashley D.

Reviews.Title: “great for family on a budget”
Reviews.Author: noodles09
Reviews.Content: coming over from australia we definetly wanted to be right on the beach and kaanapali delivered !, the best part of the beach actually !! ,lovely staff nice room (fold out sofa needs an update ),also carpet cleaned or replaced ......,we shared a wonderful holiday together catching the trolley to and from whalers village ,visiting all around maui and loving that beaqch and sunsets blew us away ... mahalo

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place, but...”
Reviews.Author: JuneJimJaxJadon
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews, we made a call to the front desk and asked for an upgraded room long before our arrival. We got to room 615, and OMG it looked like the 50's exploded in there. The furniture was awful and falling apart, and the room just felt old & crusty! I sent my hubby down to talk to the front desk. They didn't have any other rooms with a king bed, so on our honeymoon, we settled for two queen beds in a room that had decent furnishings and furniture made post 80's era. The kitchen in the new room - 609, was fabulous and upgraded. The views from the couch were incredible! The beach was close. The cafe was not so great, the food was bland and if you mess up a quesadilla in my book you should just throw in the towel. Having the kitchen in the room was well worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Spend a little more and stay somewhere nicer.”
Reviews.Author: patriciaucla
Reviews.Content: The first room I was given was the hotel room category. It had a mini fridge in the bathroom closet which I thought was a bit strange. The view was of the maintenance area and it was right next to the busy highway. The cars and trucks driving by were so loud. As I tried to leave my room, I couldn't open the door. The handle was stuck and it took several tries for me to finally get out. I let the bell hop/maintenance worker know about the door issue when he brought up my bags. He proceeded to very loudly pound on the door jam and handle for quite a while before I'd finally had enough and asked to switch rooms. I was then sent on a wild goose chase to find an acceptable room, all in the hotel room category. They were either all located near the highway, had views of the maintenance area which was uncomfortable because the workers would look up at the rooms to see the guests which was very creepy and uncomfortable. I ended up paying a fee for an upgrade to a studio room. Had I spent just $10 more/night I could have stayed somewhere nicer. Parking situation is terrible. No valet and very limited space. The beach right in front of the resort is very steep, however there is a good snorkeling spot about 500 feet up. The hotel decor is very dated. Looks like it hasn't been updated in 30+ years. No elevators to rooms so you have to drag your luggage up the stairs or pay the bell hops to do it Bottom line, spend a bit more money and stay somewhere much nicer.

Reviews.Title: “AHHHHMAZING!”
Reviews.Author: Helenah79
Reviews.Content: Travelled here with my sister and father. Extremely friendly staff, our first impression was really good. We however, did not quite know what to expect of the rooms. But wow- were we pleasantly surprised. We got 238 and 241 in the Banyard building. First we entered 238 and thought it was great; since we were early we got 241 at the check-in time and were swept off our feet. Ahhmazing! We didn't mind a short walk to the beach, (why would anyone??) and the condos were so comfortable, spacious and gorgeous. We had breakfast on the lanai every morning and also dinner since the kitchens are fully equipped and if you wish, you can even bbq downstairs. The condos had really everything you could ask for, it felt like a 5-star hotel!! Even DVD-players, so we rented movies and stayed in one night. The gardens are sooo wellkept. I really cannot think of ANYTHING to complain about. We loved it! 2 nights are really not enough, we'll be back for sure!! Mahlos for everything.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, just know what to expect”
Reviews.Author: justusor
Reviews.Content: While we were a little bit disappointed with this property, I will start with the positives: the grounds were immaculate and housekeeping was great (thanks, Juliette!). The pool was large and well maintained. We had no issues with the staff, and they responded quickly to our few requests. Being north of the main Kaanapali resorts, the beach was not crowded at all and snorkeling areas (including Black Rock) were within walking distance. The restaurant was okay -- not too pricey and the food+service was good, but we found better options in town. Room rates were more reasonable than some of the other resorts in the area. On the down side, as with many condos, you shouldn't expect to get the room shown in web site photos. Ours was adequate but quite outdated, although still clean and comfortable. The air conditioning worked well at night, but the unit couldn't keep up with daytime temperatures. Be aware that "ocean side" really means ocean view, as those units are perpendicular to the ocean and some distance away. Even so, they are worth the extra money since the other units are much farther away from the beach and pool. For those traveling with young children, this is probably not the best place for you. Most of the guests were much older, and the pool rules banned pretty much everything except swimming (Marco Polo games, balls, snorkeling gear, etc.). If you are looking for quiet, uncrowded beaches and not too many kids, and are willing to take the luck of the draw on the quality of your room in terms of updates, this is not a bad place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise”
Reviews.Author: raingirl4
Reviews.Content: Kaanapali Villas are an outstanding place to stay. I enjoyed a ground level studio suite in the Dolphin building. My lanai was directly across from the pool. The surrounding landscape was beautifully maintained. It is a quiet relaxing place to stay. The open air restaurant is good for breakfast and whale watching, or a mid day cocktail. Security patrols the grounds and I felt safe and secure at all times. I would return to Paradise in a heartbeat..

Reviews.Title: “Peaceful Paradise!”
Reviews.Author: mrsbettyl
Reviews.Content: We spent 5 nights here, and were so sorry to leave I teared up on the last day! Compared to the other properties in Kaanapali, it was fairly small, with one main mid-rise building and several smaller 2-story buildings, which I believe are all studios and suites. It was very quiet, so if you're looking for nightlife, this might not be the place. However, we found the quiet to be a perfect balance - Lahaina and the bigger resorts were a quick drive if we wanted a little more action, but when we wanted to relax and get away, the complex and the beach were perfect. Our studio unit had an updated kitchen and bathroom, which was huge. The pool was beautiful, especially at night. There was a weird noise in the air conditioner, and it took a couple of visits for the maintenance staff to fix it, but they did take care of it. We wished the restaurant / bar had been open a little later, and that we could have taken drinks back to our room, but the food and drinks we did have there were good. An unexpected highlight was the very nice bathrooms with showers in the lower level off the lobby. We almost found out about them by accident, and since our flight wasn't until several hours after checkout, we were still able to go to the beach and clean up.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay!!”
Reviews.Author: Aurora627
Reviews.Content: We stayed in room 237. What a nice surprise!! It is a townhouse-style suite. VERY spacious. The main bathroom is newly remodeled and HUGE! The bedroom is upstairs in the "loft" area. There is also a second bathroom upstairs. There is a spacious balcony outside the living room which overlooks the pool. Great view! There is also a large, fully equipped kitchen. The beach is awesome! You can rent cabanas for only $25/day. You can also rent chairs for $5/day, along with snorkle gear and kayaks. Great location!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place but Beware of the Pictures On the Aston Website”
Reviews.Author: travelbertCalifornia
Reviews.Content: The Aston Kaanapali Villas in Maui is a resort complex of condominiums on the Kaanapali beach just north of Black Rock by about 1/2 a mile or so. The facility consists of a number of 2 story buildings as well as one 6 story tower. I had read that it was built in the late sixties and is smaller and less densely built than other places nearby. 3 of the buildings are centered around the main pool and a restaurant and all have partial or complete ocean views (where we stayed). There are several other buildings that are set farther back and do not seem to have any sort of ocean view. These other buildings also have another pool near them. The beach is about 50 feet from the main pool and the grounds are immaculent with plenty of lounge chairs to sit in and watch the ocean. The pool and spa are nice, not too big without any sort of water slides, but everything was very nice and clean, we liked the gas torches that were lit each night. Regarding the title of my review, when booking we saw the pictures of the rooms on the website main page, and they appeared to be very recently remodeled and very modern in design. To be honest is was a significant part of the reason for picking this resort. When we arrived we were surprised to get a room that looked nothing like the photo shown on that page, along with the banner stating 'Newly Renovated'. We thought that meant the facility on a whole was renovated, what they mean is that the lobby was renovated along with a small number of select condos. Despite our surprise of the decor of our unit, we were still very pleased with the facility and our view from our room was beautiful. The condition of the unit was fairly good with some signs of wear (torn wallpaper, older furniture) the kitchen was probably remodeled more recently with granite countertops. We could have asked to be moved, but it was not important enough for us at the time. Each condo is individually owned and will be furnished and maintained at different levels, Aston just facilitates renting them out as far as we could tell. Our 1 bedroom condo was huge, had 2 televisions, a dining room table a large kitchen with all of the appliances (with plates, pots, pans, etc) and a large bathroom. The entrance to the unit was strange, it looked like at one time it was a single 2 bedroom unit converted to 2 separate units. Nearby we did hear construction noises from a unit that was being gutted and remodeled. We ate one night at the Castaway Cafe on site, we happended to show up on pasta night and it was buy one get one free. Our food was great, the service was good and we enjoyed sitting outside listening to the waves crash while we ate dinner.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect home away from home”
Reviews.Author: SusanF54
Reviews.Content: This hotel was so much nicer than expected based on other reviews. The property had a wonderful homey ambiance and the room was huge and very well equipped. We had an ocean view on the front of the tower but the Pool Side units looked very nice as well. If you like some shade in the afternoon, the area the garden views look out at is very quiet and pretty for a lot less $$. It was too hot to sit outside in the afternoon so we didn't miss the balcony. But when it's not so hot, just open the doors and turn the whole living room into a lanai. The location is perfect and Kaanapalli is the best area to stay on Maui. We loved the beach walks for our very long daily walks. Also, the snorkelling is even better than Molokina and Black Rock, right in front of the Westin Villas next door. Our flight was delayed 8 hours and we didn't get there till 2am, but someone was there to look after us and even switched our room so we'd have a king. When I asked for some more beach towels, they came in 5 minutes. So, what little service we asked for, was all good. I think it pays to book with Aston over the independents. This is the first time in 30 years my husband said he wants to go back, SOON. So I'm working on booking for Christmas, with the whole family. Susan - Vancouver BC

Reviews.Title: “WOW - Great Villa (Room 211)”
Reviews.Author: TravellingTia88
Reviews.Content: Fantastic location, great accommodation. We had 1bed with twin bed apartment - very clean, everything in it you could ask for. Great accommodation for families. Privately owned and owners have gone the extra mile to have everything you need at your fingertips.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: EGinDC
Reviews.Content: My husband, 10 month old son and I stayed here for 3 nights in April 2011. We came to Maui for a wedding held in Lahaina, and the Aston hotels were recommended as a mid-range hotel chain by the couple. Since we knew we wouldn't be spending a ton of time at the resort, we just wanted something affordable and nice, but not with a ton of resort amenities which you pay for. This particular hotel appealed to us because of its proximity to Lahaina and because it had been recently updated and looked like it had a nice pool and a kitchen in each of the units. We originally booked directly with the hotel, but checked VRBO the week before we were arriving and noticed this unit was available. We contacted the owners who immediately wrote us back and allowed us to rent it for a shorter time period than the normally required 1 week, and they even knocked $20 off the nightly rate since it was short notice, which made the cost of staying in this 1 BR just $25 higher than what we would have paid the hotel for a studio. Great deal! The condo was clean, airy and we appreciated the updated kitchen and bathroom! The kitchen was completely stocked with any kitchen utensils/glassware/etc you would need, though we only ate breakfast here each day. The view was great, I loved that we had a water view, though it was mostly of the pool - you could only somewhat see the ocean behind the pool. But it was pretty none-the-less. Huge patio which we sat on every day once our son went to sleep. (Unite 291) The only problem we had was with the Property Management company that the owners use (Whalers Realty Management). One downside of doing VRBO is that you don't get to call the hotel for pool towels, a crib or high chair. We ended up having to rent these separately from a furniture rental company. This added $15 to our daily costs which we had not anticipated. When I asked the Property Mgt company about needing a crib, she said she would look into but we never heard back from her. When I contacted them again, the man who answered gave me the names of two local companies which we used. When we checked our credit card bill after we left Hawaii, we saw another charge from the Property Mgt company - turned out it was for a Pack n Play that they had ordered for us. They never confirmed this with us, we thought it came with the unit after all. Also, when we inquired about a late checkout (we took a redeye home) they were not helpful and didn't even offer us the option to pay for it. They refunded us the money for the Pack n Play, but I will never rent a VRBO on Maui again if they are the management company.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: SCBill
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Kaanapali villas for 10 days and it lived up to the reviews. Although it was among the least expensive of the places on the beach, the grounds and buildings were very well maintained and attractive. The personnel were very helpful and attentive. The beach was a little small, but you only had to walk a few yards up or down the beach to get to a wider part. Two pools kept you cool if you didn't want to go to the beach or you could relax on the lawn overlooking the beach. The Castaway restaurant served good food at reasonable (for Maui) prices. A free shuttle went to Whaler's Village every 30 miutes. One bonus was the west-looking view of the sunset - beautiful. we'd go there again in an instant.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place To Relax For Family with Tweens”
Reviews.Author: wiltshs
Reviews.Content: We were fortunate enough to get 8 days here as a "prize" in a silent auction so we paid well below the going rates - I suspect full fare is probably among the priciest resorts and so the value equation might be a lower given the relatively small size and limited amenities, but not to take away from our experience.. What we experienced was a really nice small resort on a perfect strip of beach in West Maui just north of the town of Lahaina. This was our first trip to Maui so we can't compare it to other properties. These are condo units, often rented out on behalf of the owners by the management. Ours had two bedrooms each with en suite, and critically a kitchen. With the price of eating out being about 15-30% higher than a comparable meal in our home state of Minnesota, the availability of the kitchen saved us a fortune on meals, because we were able to make several breakfast, lunches and dinners. Tip: go to Costco in Kahului and stock up - the local Safeway in Lahaina was very overpriced. If you don't make it to Costco, go North on hwy 30 to the Time grocery store (2 lights north of the Villas) - prices are much more reasonable there for groceries than in Lahaina. The resort was small - I didn't count but probably 200 units in a variety of configurations. They had a Mai Tai reception on thursdays, and free coffee very morning. The staff were friendly and helpful. The store onsite like any hotel store was expensive but helpful if you're short on something. The Castaway Cafe by the pool area served great drinks and breakfasts (we did not try lunch or dinner there), and the onsite excursion staff helped us book our key events. We had a specific condo unit on the 1st floor which worked out great - I wasn't worried about the view since we only had to walk 100 yards if that to the pool and beach, but if you want a beach view, there would only be a few units (west looking) to choose from. Overall, we would go back here in a heartbeat, if we could get a good rate. The resort was right on a very nice strip of beach - apparently one of the best beaches in Maui. The water was clear (although no fish to see). If you have younger children, be aware that the beach drops off from paddling depth in the surf to 5-6 feet deep in the space of 2-3 lateral feet from shore, and the backwash from the surf was very strong. Our 10/11 year olds thought it was great fun, but younger kids might not relish being dragged under a wave. And the sand gets in EVERYTHING so be prepared to spend a lot of time in the shower! Overall this was a great place and we would go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Not my favorite Aston”
Reviews.Author: wewannagoagain
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Aston Kaanapali Villas for 4 nights in March 2011. This was not our first trip to Maui, and have stayed at other Aston properties. Although the property is on a beautiful stretch of beach, the majority of the rooms do not have the sweeping ocean view. I decided on this trip that an oceanfront room trumps a beachfront property anyday. We were upgraded from a studio garden view to a one-bedroom garden view on the 2nd floor of the Aloha Builing. The view was disappointing, as I saw mostly the entrance to the property--very little gardens. The lanai was quite spacious--but when the guests in the unit next door were also on their lanai, there was a serious lack of privacy--the two lanais were separated by plants. The room we were in was very nice--looked like it had been the recepient of several upgrades. The bathroom had a nice shower, no tub, but was extremely small and very poorly lit. The sink/changing area was very large--some of that unnecessary space would have made a nice bigger bathroom. There was no washer/dryer in the room, which was a negative. I don't want to spend my vacation running to the guest laundry at the back of the property. Parking near the entrance to our building was an issue, as there were maybe 15 spots in the lot, and quite of few of them were for private use. We ended up parking 2 buildings away. There is a resort fee, that included the parking charge and internet access, of $13/day that is not included in the room cost. That is payable when you leave. We arrived at 240 pm, and were told the room would not be ready until 3 pm. Yanked my chain a bit on that--I could see not having it ready hours early, but 20 minutes??? I read some reviews after I returned and was surprised to find that was a trolley to other areas of Kaanapali from the Villas. I was not informed of this, but certainly would have taken advantage of the service, as I walked to Whaler's Village several times. The walks in the property are very slippery when wet--I almost fell twice within 10 minutes after it had rained. There were no caution signs out, however they were placed out later. The woman that checked us in was very pleasant, however, the gentleman that checked us out was a bit on the grumpy side. He didn't leave a good last impression. Now that I have stayed at the Kaanapali Villas, I think I will go back to one of the other Astons that I love so much on my next trip.

Reviews.Title: “the concierge named Dawn was the rudest most unprofessional person”
Reviews.Author: apple731
Reviews.Content: The hostess named Dawn was so rude and disrespectful. We had never visited Maui and thought the concierge could help us with our activities. This women looked at us and said, "can't you give me a minute! " We were in shock, there was no one else there and she was just looking into her purse. The tone in her voice and the look in her eyes were of pure hate. It just sucked the life out of us. My daughter had just commented on how pretty her dress was-wow! Yes we complained to the manager and yes she lied and tried to dispute what she said.But she couldn't the truth always prevails, but was she disiplined no, did she apologized, no. I guess she was duh, WINNING. She will always be a, well you know, and one bad apple don't spoil the whole bunch.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely perfect vacation”
Reviews.Author: memorymakermom
Reviews.Content: When we arrived our room was ready. We had booked a one bedroom Gardenview Room through Expedia. We felt we had lucked out because the suite was huge, recently updated (granite counter tops, stainless steel appliances) and it was located on the 2nd floor of the Aloha tower which meant we had a full-size lanai complete with patio furniture. (the 3rd to 6th floors have small balconies which you can't fit a chair on). The beach was awesome, we didn't have any issues with the staff, most were very friendly and helpful. The grounds are gorgeous, we used the pool and hot tub daily. Although the fitness centre isn't exciting, you really don't need it because there is a beach walk that goes for miles throughout Kaanipali and it is busy with joggers and walkers in the morning....great way to see other properties and to people watch. We saw beautiful fish and sea turtles while snorkeling just to the right of the hotel...same fish as we saw at Black Rock but much less busy. We rented snorkeling equipment right in front of the hotel and Mitch was helpful in getting us the right fit on the first day and we were able to keep the equipment for the week. The location is quiet and comfortable. I was surprised to meet people there who hadn't rented a car, I understand that there is a trolley that goes around Kaanipali but we enjoyed having our rental car to go about as we pleased. We saw a lot of other properties while we were in Maui but none looked any better than this one. We liked that it had the lower buildings in the front and the Aloha tower at only 6 floors...the huge tower resorts aren't what we were looking for. This was our first trip to Hawaii and this property was everything we had hoped for and more.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Property - NO ALOHA (Aston Management Please Read)”
Reviews.Author: vegasfanNj
Reviews.Content: Checked into this property on Tuesday March 8th and departed on Saturday the 12th. First of all when I checked into the hotel I was given room 507 in the Aloha Tower. According to Expedia this room was to have an ocean view and was supposed to be 1200+ SF. The room was not an ocean view in my opinion but was more of a parking lot / lobby view (Just because your high up and can see the water does not make a room an ocean view IMHO, heck I can see NYC from the roof of my house but that doesnt mean my house has a view of the city). Also the room was no where near 1200 SF and the furnishings were quite outdated. Although the room was not as ADVERTISED the overall grounds of the hotel were quite NICE. Excellent park of Kaanapali Beach and probably the most relaxing property on the entire section of Kaanapali. No crowds and beautiful grounds. And even though the room was not as advertised it turned out to be fine for y stay as we were on the beach for the most part anyway. The major problem with this HOTEL is the FRONT DESK STAFF. Two employees stand out in my mind as being very rude. A gentlemen by the name of RUDY was probably the RUDEST person I met in all of HAWAII. Never once said Aloha or Mahalo, acted like any guest was bothering him whenever someone wanted something. While waiting in a long line I watched him basically tell one lady to stop bothering him and ask someone else. And one woman needed a key made because her 21 month old was locked in the room. He slapped the key on the counter and made her walk all the way around the lobby to get it rather than handing it to her. By the time I made it up to the counter to ask for the key to the shower this man had already ruined 3 peoples stay at the property. The other staff member of interest was a man named Joe. Joe was quite arrogant when I came to him with a room issue and seemed to care much more about hotel OWNERS than hotel guests. His arrogance really put a damper on the first day of our stay. I was really surprised at the difference in hotel staff between Waikiki Beach (stayed at the Marriott and this property). Literally some of the rudest staff I have ever encountered throughout all my whole stays ANYWHERE. Now to the TSUNAMI WARNING. Had this TSUNAMI hit Kaanapali hard this hotel would have been destroyed and many would have lost their lives. The hotel had NO IDEA what it was doing during the Tsunami warning. One gentlemen said to leave the hotel and go up the mountain. Another one said to stay put in my room. Shouldnt there be a better plan of action in place. They really didnt know what to do and that made it worse for us visitors to the island. Even though my review is quite critical if this property would clean up the front desk staff I would probably stay there again. I really liked the grounds and the quietness of it.. And all the other staff were fine from Castaways to Maintenance. Its really just the FRONT DESK staff. They were TERRIBLE!!!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding!!!”
Reviews.Author: rmac2581
Reviews.Content: Last year we stayed at the Kaanapali Shores. KS was great but we wanted a place further down the beach away from the rocks. We picked the Maui Kaanapali Villas for the location. We stayed in a 1 bedroom ocean view room. Room was recently renovated and was huge for a 1 bedroom. Property was quiet at night. The recently renovated lobby looked great. Location was perfect. Beach was great for swimming in front of the hotel, outstanding snorkeling 100 ft down the beach in front of the Westin and 15 minute walk in the other direction to Black Rock. I thought snorkeling by the Westin as better than Black Rock. The kids dug the pool and the beach. We booked the room on the Aston website and got a fantastic package deal for flights, room and car. We loved the place and expect to return.

Reviews.Title: “This resort reflects what Hawaii is all about.”
Reviews.Author: Just556
Reviews.Content: The accomodations and ambience of this resort were perfect for our vacation. We enjoyed meeting other guests, loved the water sports available at the front shack, and couldn't take our eyes off the whales playing offshore. The people who work there were friendly and helpful, our condo was beautiful, and we were within walking distance of great restaurants and entertainment. I'll definately plan to stay here anytime I go to Maui.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful beach, very convenient location, relaxing, private - my favourite place to stay on Maui!”
Reviews.Author: janl49
Reviews.Content: We have been here many times, mostly in a garden view, ground floor studio, but this time we stayed in a 2 bed, 2 bath with an ocean view because there were 5 of us, including 2 toddlers. All the rooms we have stayed in have been good. We always get a ground floor so we have a patio, grass and can walk right out to the beach or pool without using stairs or elevators. We really enjoy the privacy and quietude here, instead of the rows on rows of lounge chairs and the many people at the big high rise hotels . Also the public areas such as the lobby and main pool have been tastefully updated. As the other reviews have noted, the location is super convenient - right on the "beach walk," very close to "golf," a beautiful15-20 min. stroll to Whaler's Village and close to the "snorkelling" areas. The restaurant "Castaways" is pretty good, but we do like to eat at the Hula Grill in Whaler's Village better, although Castaways fish sandwich and cocktails are good, especially with a $1 off during Happy Hours. Beautiful, relaxing place!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice resort on beautiful beach”
Reviews.Author: Toofaraway
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Villas from Jan. 25 to 31, 2011. We opted for a one bedroom ocean view suite. We were placed on the sixth floor of the tower with an ocean view at an angle. We were disappointed at not having a lanai, but only a balcony where we could stand, but not use chairs due to its narrowness. The room did not resemble photos on the website for the resort, but we expected that, since many units are individually owned and decorated. All in all, we were happy with the accommodations, which were clean, comfortable and well furnished, including the kitchen. The grounds are very well maintained and attractive. The pool is well landscaped and large. There is a second pool in another part of the property, which consists of five buildings used for accommodations' and we did not use the second pool. The staff was courteous and helpful. The beach area is first class. The resort is well located on the beachwalk and away from more crowded areas. Whalers Village is a 15 minute walk away, and a free shuttle also goes there. Lahaina is about a 15 or 20 minute drive away. I review the restaurant separately ("Castaways"). We were very happy with our stay and would return.

Reviews.Title: “Just average at Best”
Reviews.Author: Fisch78
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a wonderful trip to Maui...the only disappointing part was the Aston Kaanapali Villas. Our room overlooked the parking lot and the noisy main highway through Kaanapali, so instead of being able to enjoy the hawaiian breezes we had to keep the windows shut and the A/C on because of the noise! But then the A/C would make a loud clunk every hour or so which made for very restful sleep...NOT!!!! Didn't use the pool or the restaurant at all as they just didn't have a welcoming appearance at all! The only thing I noticed that was nice about the hotel was the lobby and the location, we spent a lot of time around black rock which was not even a 10 minute walk. Staff was not terribly welcoming. The whole hotel experience was just BLAH...thank goodness Maui has so much else to offer! If I had to do again I would have stayed at the Sharaton or the Westin like I wanted to in the first place rather than saving the money!

Reviews.Title: “Don't go there!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Stepbouc
Reviews.Content: The rooms was not ready at 21 h. We had to return at the front desk with all the luggage to get another room. The other room was not very nice and we did not get what we supposed to get. A very old room who smell humidity and it is not humidity like in tropical place but humidity like mushrooms.... It had insect in the kitchen, and old fan made a sound like very hard. You can heard the sound of the car because the highway is very near so it is very far away from the quiet place we expect on a island. The restaurant on the beach near of the pool has chairs and table they really need to change because their very very very old and not clean and the personnal not happy to work there. We cannot give thing positive for this hotel who was the worst of my life and I travelled more than 30 times: Cuba, Turk and caicos, Florida, France, dom. Republica, mexico, riviera Maya......... We try to cancel when we arrived but they take one day of cancellation penalty....without any reason..... We pay the 5 days with the travel agency but when we arrived here they had 17 $ a day of fee without any reason. They tell us it is normal....on Kauai and oahu we never paid this. THe restaurant took 20 min for a latte coffee very bad. They told us that the expresso machine needed to got pressure.....i have an expresso machine at house, office and In my cottage and all of them take 1 min to get pressure.... Thaw price we paid for a night was 250$ plus their 17$ so it is very too much. I think the true value of a room there could be 75 $ or maybe 100$.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Great Views, Super Beach but some rooms need updating”
Reviews.Author: Skibug_10
Reviews.Content: We had a nice stay even though we found the room we were in needed some upgrades and some plumbing was so, so. The view was great, the staff were kind, the pool was perfect, grounds were well kept, and the beach was excellent. A 20 minute walk from Black Rock along the shore path was nice during the day or for a evening stroll. We liked the location as it was relatively quiet compared to other resorts but near the action if you wanted it.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good price, some rooms need work”
Reviews.Author: DarioGo
Reviews.Content: As far as location of the condos on the north side of Kaanapali, itâ€™s a perfect location right by the beach. Itâ€™s away from all the big resorts (south of Black Rock) and avoids the hordes of people that stay in that area. The beach in front is not busy at all. As far as price, they are one of the more affordable places on Maui especially if you take the location into account. We've been to other islands and found Maui to be pricier in general. The grounds are well maintained. The building seems a bit older as compared to other places. But unless you stay at the brand new developments and willing to pay a very high price, youâ€™ll most likely stay at an older resort. We initially had a garden view studio in the Aloha Building (the main bldg). And this was the down-side. The difference between the picture of the condos on the website and what we got was night and day. The condo units are individually owned and youâ€™re taking a gamble with what you end up with when you get there. I know thereâ€™s no guarantee on the room that you will get. But wow, it looked like there was a 10-year difference between the website pictures which looked brand new and modern and what we ended up with (see attached pics). They either need to put up more pictures of other units so there are no surprises or give some sort of concession (i.e. different price structure for older units). I commend the staff and receptionists who were very gracious and accommodating. They moved us the next day to another unit in the Banyan Bldg. They really have no control over what the condo owners do with their units. If you're looking for value and location, this is a good place to stay. But be sure to ask for a more recently updated unit.

Reviews.Title: “Keep looking, there are better places to stay!!”
Reviews.Author: LuvTheBeach1973
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 11 nights. The front desk staff were very unhelpful. The power went out due to a bad storm and was out for over a day. Nothing was communicated with the guests as to what the plan was and when we asked the front desk staff they appeared annoyed. We asked for a flashlight, but they said they ran out, so we had to go buy our own as well as candles. Housekeeping didn't come at all during the power outage. When we checked out, we were not compensated for the power outage and even had to pay the resort fee for that day when nothing was open. The pool was even closed. We couldn't do anything at the resort and went to neighboring hotels. Also, all of the creatures decided to desend on our room during the power outage, again, when the front desk was notified, they did nothing. This resort also caters to the "older" group. If you are over 60 this is probably a great resort for you, but we were not and felt like we were vacationing with our grandparents. The people who own property there are also pretty rude to guests. The restaurant is ok, but there are much better ones very close by. We spent a lot of time at the Westin resort right next door and were very impressed with their hotel, and their service. We will stay there next time.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, but outdated rooms”
Reviews.Author: KatieB26
Reviews.Content: Walking distance to beach/water; seemed like spot for long term vacationers and not for short stay visits. Rooms were very outdated with pink tile in shower/bathroom. Decor was very old.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel if not for the Service”
Reviews.Author: EverydayKnight
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself is very nice. The location has beachfront access, 2 pools, an on-site restaurant, and the landscaping is filled with palm trees and flowers. We stayed in the Coconut building. Our room had a nice King size bed, a full kitchen (with refrigerator, stove, and microwave). We also had a lanai looking out at the smaller pool. The beach is awesome, very little rocks like the rest of Hawaii. We saw numerous whales right from the hotel beach! Whaler's village is a 15 minute walk down the beach, right past Black Rock. The downside to the hotel we felt was the service. First and foremost, the power for the hotel was out for over a day. I know they can't control the weather or the time to fix it, but there was no communication from the hotel staff about the outage. I had to go to the front desk to ask. Also, the outage forced the cancellation of the free Mai-Tai social. I was very much looking forward to this, but it was not rescheduled, simply canceled. During the outage they didn't clean the room or provide fresh linens, either. Finally, during the outage the creatures of the jungle decided to come out to play. We found a huge roach in our shower (which we had to take by iPhone flashlight) and a small dead lizard in our entryway (inside the unit). Yuck. Make sure you take into account the $9 a day resort fee. This covers parking and the internet.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Place to Wake Up”
Reviews.Author: nrcalsound
Reviews.Content: Really enjoyed our room in the Banyon Complex. We had nice bamboo furniture, complete kitchen. Staff was great and very helpful! Would stay again! Only thing is that the back hotel rooms are near the road, so you do hear some noise, but most of the condo's have the same problem. We we're not on the ocean front, but for the price we really enjoyed our stay. If you can afford it, get the ocean front!

Reviews.Title: “The Kaanapali Villas are the best value in the nicest area of Maui!”
Reviews.Author: loveholidaysKelowna
Reviews.Content: We stayed on the property for over a month. It 's low density on the quietest spot in Kaanapali is truly desirerable. No running down to place towels on the chairs by the pool, lots of great sandy beach out front and lovely grounds surround the condos. Each condo is individually owned and thus there is a wide variety of bedding configurations and decors available. Many units are upgraded with new cabinets in the fully equiped kitchens, granite counter tops, tiled floors, flat screen tvs, etc. The front desk, maintenance and housekeeping staff are friendly and do a great job to make the vacation the most memorable. It has all the amenities you need with two pools and twp hot tubs, spa, onsite Castaway's Cafe (best selection of wine anywhere), the free Kaanapali Trolley to visit other complexs and Whaler's village, beach shack (snorkel equip., paddle boards, beach chairs, sailboats all available to rent and no charge to watch the whales, dolphins and turtles going past in the water. Does it get any better than this?? We loved it. Thank you MKV.

Reviews.Title: “Great condo, great location, great bargain”
Reviews.Author: benlegato
Reviews.Content: Our studio was excellent in every respect: clean, comfortable, quiet, with tasteful modern decor--natural stone throughout, granite counter and nice bamboo cabinets in kitchen--enough room for three adults. Staff is courteous and very helpful. Helpful concierge books activities. I will absolutely return to these condos and will recommend them highly to my friends. Our "garden view" still afforded a great ocean panorama. Large glass/screen sliding doors open to a small SRO balcony. Room has great climate control. Very comfy king bed; sofa bed is better than average. Very nice bathroom with no tub, traditional and waterfall shower heads. Room was cleaned thoroughly every day. Full kitchen was completely stocked with pans, utensils, dishes, coffee pot and grinder, etc. Very easy to cook and save $. Safeway is a five-minute drive. Costco is near the airport, on the way to the condos. Many upscale and budget dining options within ten-minute drive. Grounds are manicured and lovely. Very nice pool-spa area, right next to a beautiful beach. Plenty of shade next to beach. Lots of places to walk, jog. Restaurant on beach has good breakfast. Adequate workout room--seven weight machines, three cardio machines. Free parking, free internet. I didn't use the hotel's laundry room. During my stay (late Dec.) most guests were seniors or families--very quiet and peaceful. Be aware that every room pays a mandatory $13-per-day activity fee--I find this practice deceptive but still consider this place a bargain. Also, I understand that condos are individually owned, so each is a little different. If you prefer low-key non-commercial vacations, you'll love Maui. I napped and read in the shade with an ocean view while my adult children swam and sunned. Road to Hana has waterfalls, vegetation, beaches, hiking and swimming opportunities. I rented an ordinary sedan, which was fine for everything I did. If you rent a jeep, you can drive the entire island perimeter, which I understand includes a few miles of unpaved road. If you whale watch and are lucky enough to see the critters breach, as we did, you'll never forget it.

Reviews.Title: “This is a perfectly sited comforable resort with just enough of the right kind of amenities.”
Reviews.Author: OBrFamily
Reviews.Content: These villas were absolutely perfect for us! This low-scale resort is situated on an amazing stretch of beach on the west side of the island. This beach had everything we could have asked for, from sunrise and sunset walks to snorkeling, swimming, and body surfing (depending on the wave action). And when we wanted something less challenging than the surf, the hotel pool was perfect. Our studio room with a full kitchen was on the second floor of one of the two story buildings overlooking the pool - close enough to allow our teenage girls to spend time in the pool by themselves. The kitchen was a "must" for us and it was stocked with all of the essentials for cooking and baking - other than food which we supplied from the Safeway store in Lahaina. Service was absolutely excellent. Sheets for the sofa bed were delivered within minutes of the request, as were towels. Housekeeping left our room spotless every day. Parking was convenient to our room and the mix of condo owners and guests was appreciated. The pool was never swamped and guests never too loud. There were many activities close by, including shopping in Lahaina, golf, horseback riding, ziplining, whale watching tours, surfing, hiking, etc. And for die-hard Starbucks fans, there is a location about 10 minutes down the road (I'll admit to a run or two in our 10 day stay). The location is just minutes from an array of activities to suit different tastes. But somehow, we found ourselves just relaxing in the comfy chairs on the lanai. The hotel website, along with travel sites, offers a very accurate depiction of the grounds, property, and buildings. If you are looking for multiple on-site restaurants and bars, yoga on the beach, kids clubs, and water sports...maybe this isn't the place for you. But for us, this resort had just enough of everything and was an excellent value compared to the neighboring 5 star resorts. It made our MUCH needed vacation possibleand we thank Kaanapali Villas staff for making it special with their hospitality and accommodation. Mahalo.

Reviews.Title: “This is the place to stay”
Reviews.Author: tmtrice
Reviews.Content: We knew which beach we wanted to stay on, but picked the hotel based on reviews and pictures. We made our reservations online with the hotel. Very easy. Our room was to be a 1 bedroom ocean view in the tower, however when we checked in they informed us we had been upgraded to a ground level, one bedroom ocean front. I can not emphasize enough how much of a difference that made. The room was BEAUTIFUL, all newly remodeled with a giant walk in shower and multiple shower heads. There were two LCD large screen TV's, all the lighting dimmable, granite counters, luxorious kitchen and two double sliding doors that opened to a private lanai. We were a 10 second walk from the pool, 15 seconds to the restaurant and a full 30 seconds to get to the beach! No stairs, elevators or hallways. Just open the door and you're there. The beach is wonderful and feels very private. No crowds and lots of familys. Our 14 month old had a great time and I always felt she was very safe. You can rent anything, like paddle boards, snorkel gear, boogie boards, right there on the beach. The staff was quick and helpful as we needed a crib, high chair and a repair to the screen door. All requests were met. We used the kitchen just like we would have at home. There is a Safeway Supermarket about 3 miles away. One big shopping trip and we were set for the week. There is a free shuttle that will take you to the resort side of Kaanapali for shopping, fine dining and checking out the over priced, over crowded fancy resorts. I could go on and on, but I'll leave it with this... on Maui, this is our new "place to stay"! One word of caution, each unit is individually owned and not all owners have spent the kind of money it takes to make their unit luxorious. We were unit 192 in the Emerald building. That's where we will be staying.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Family Holiday!”
Reviews.Author: traveltheworld95
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Hawaii and we absolutley loved Mauii and the Kaanapali Villas!!! Beautiful beach, spacious and comfortable condo, lovely pool & grounds. Cannot wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Staff”
Reviews.Author: Shena_2010
Reviews.Content: The Staff is so wonderful here! You will love it! They have done some great remodeling with no disturbances what so ever. The new lobby looks wonderful and they are and still upgrading, but no need to worry you would never know they where doing construction. The property is great ! You will love it!

Reviews.Title: “A great family holiday”
Reviews.Author: Yago1
Reviews.Content: The hotel is great. This is our second stay and we'll be back. The condo was clean, well equipped and comfortable. The restaurant is a island favorite and the fish sandwich is amazing.

Reviews.Title: “You will love it here.”
Reviews.Author: macmurphy17
Reviews.Content: After ready many hotel reviews, and doing a thorough price comparison, I chose the Kaanapali Villas for my trip to Maui, and I am so glad I did. This place is wonderful! I stayed in the Banyan building, which I prefer over a high rise hotel. It is only two stories, had a full kitchen, and a large balcony with a breathtaking view of the pool area and garden. It saves you a lot of money to forgo the ocean view. And you are still very very close to the beach. It was so quiet in this location, because it is a back from the beach and the larger pool. It has a pool and hot tub right there too. It was updated and beautiful. The room had granite counter tops in the kitchen, completely modern and clean like any of the best hotels I have been in. I am very picky about lodging. I like to stay in a place that feels luxurious and this place fit the bill. I felt so comfortable and pampered. And the price was amazing!! Check the hotel website for specials. Also when you check in, ask for an updated room. If you don't like the room they give you, go ask for a different room. We got lucky and the first room we were assigned was a dream! All I was expecting was a one bedroom and we actually got a loft with a bedroom and full bath upstairs, and a small bedroom and full bath down stairs. It was great to each have our own bathroom. All the construction on the lobby was complete by the time I got there, and it looks beautiful. The gift shop was newly opened and had great prices on souvenirs. You can pick up many great trinkets to bring back for gifts, for under 4 dollars; calendars, mini tikis, hair flower clips....we were surprised at how low the prices were. The beach there is beautiful, and the hotel restaurant is right at the edge of the beach, and the food is great. You will be so happy if you stay here. It is a great value, and so perfect! the grounds are immaculate too. It has a very nice relaxed feel, and many tall swaying palm trees to make you really feel like you are in the tropics! We went to the "Drums of the Pacific" Lu'au at the Hyatt. I highly recommend this one. And be sure to get a VIP ticket, it costs a little more but you get a front row seat and first in line at the buffet. This lu'au is really well done. Also, don't miss "Warren and Annabelle's Magic show" !!! Even if you don't like magic shows, it does not matter-- GO SEE THIS SHOW YOU WILL LOVE IT! This is a really funny and entertaining show, and be sure to get the "Royal Flush" package, that includes the most amazing drinks, food and dessert!! you will not be able to eat it all, but you will want to! Please be sure to book your tickets in advance on their website, because it sells out a week in advance, and believe me, you don't want to miss this incredible show! I am still smiling just thinking about it. We also took an afternoon boat to snorkel at Molokini on, "the Pride of Maui" and it was so fun. Only a 3.5 hour trip so not too long, which is good for me since I don't like to be on a boat all day. Plus it there were only about 21 of us on a large boat so plenty of room and the food was fresh, grilled burgers, veggie burgers, hot dogs and all you can drink, beer, tropical drinks, you name it ! and the cost was only about 40 dollars. The crew was really nice, and you can rent any equipment you need right on the boat. We thought it was a great deal, we went to Molokini. Saw lots of pretty colorful fish. Yes, I had a wonderful vacation, and I am already planning my next trip. I will definitely be staying at the Kaanapali Villas. It is a beautiful place to be. You will love it there.

Reviews.Title: “I Love Maui”
Reviews.Author: imdb
Reviews.Content: This was my first trip to maui, I came with my parents who have been to this hotel 3 times before. I love Maui and this hotel made my experience that much better. The staff were friendly, the food, beverages and service at castaways was excellent. The pool was always very clean as was the hot tub, and the beach front was amazing. We had room 111 which was very spacious and always cleaned daily. The housekeeping staff was very promt when we asked for clean pool towels and it was lovely sitting out on our deck for breakfast every morning. The only thing that was a little frustrating was the weather which was obviously not the hotels fault, it was a little cold and rainy on somedays but it was still warm, and the hot tub was lovely when the outside was a little colder.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely happy with the stay.”
Reviews.Author: Paula0425
Reviews.Content: I was very pleased with Maui Kaanapali Villas. From the check in to the check out we had a great experience. Joe checked us in and was very helpful. I was concerned about having a second floor unit because my father has difficulty with stairs, but Joe assured us we would love the unit and he was right! It was recently remodeled. The kitchen had new cabinets and beautiful granite countertops. The bathroom was also recently remodeled and had a beautiful walk in shower with a stone surround, new cabinets and another granite countertop. There was a loft bedroom with it's own bath. Both of the beds were new and very comfortable. We had a beautiful, large lanai which overlooked the smaller pool (which we had to ourselves almost every day). We were just about a 2 minute walk to the beach. The beach at Kaanapali Villas was the best beach I saw. Not rocky at all, just beautiful soft sand. And not crowded at all. The hotel was convenient to everything. They even have a trolley that runs to the shopping center and other hotels. There is also a great walking path that runs along the beach and connects to many of the other hotels. If I had to give any negative comments it would be that the lobby is under construction and the reception area was cramped. But I'm sure when they finish the construction it will be fabulous. This was a small, quiet complex. If you are looking for a lot of ammenties you won't find them, but if you are looking for a quiet, simple place to stay, this is it. All in all it was a great experience and I will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “False Advertising”
Reviews.Author: hoyt1980
Reviews.Content: I read several reviews on this website about people not getting the type of rooms that they expected and I ignored them thinking that 29 bad reviews out of 318 were pretty good odds, and I regret it. My family and I saved for five years to take a vacation in Maui and we wanted to stay in a nice place. I looked at pictures and took virtual tours on the Aston website and the place looked beautiful. After reading the bad reviews on trip advisor, I even called to make sure that we got the quality room we wanted and I was assured that if I made the reservation on the Aston website, and then all was fine because Aston has certain standards of rooms they will rent. When we checked in we were given a room that was never updated and didnâ€™t look anything like the virtual tour. It looked old and dated with teal tile floors and shag carpet with plastic on the dining room table chairs. The shower was gross. I tried to get another room, but the hotel was under renovation so nothing else was available. The manager on duty told me â€œwhen you order a burger at Wendyâ€™s, you donâ€™t get the burger in the picture; you get the one they give youâ€�. Nice comparison. We tried to find another hotel, but the internet did not even work. In order to get it to work we had to call the cable company ourselves and schedule an appointment. I called the general manager several times, but could never get a hold of him, so I called the corporate office and finally talked to someone. They offered us a different room that was like the one I expected but our trip was over halfway over by then. The trip that was supposed to be so great and we had looked forward to had really been ruined by a lie. Donâ€™t Do It.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing! A+++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++”
Reviews.Author: chiko85
Reviews.Content: After staying at the disgusting Ohana Beachcomber in Waikiki this place was like heaven! We were highly impressed right from the start, the grounds were immaculate and staff were friendlier than anyone we had spoken to on the whole of Oahu. Joe checked us in and we felt welcomed straight away. our rooms were very hawaiian and beautiful with our own kitchen and complimentary box of chocolates (which were delicious!). The staff are a true asset to the Villas. Location is ideal on Kaanapali Beach, a free trolley (shuttle) to the local shops where you can pay $1 for a bus into Lahaina town. Lots of facilities within the hotel including a gorgeous pool and spa, free wireless internet in your room and sparkling clean barbecue facilities. Next time i come to Hawaii I will skip Oahu entirely and i will stay at the Kaanapali Villas again 110%!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Best Family Oriented Hotel”
Reviews.Author: sunsetbeach_10
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Aston Maui Kaanapali Villas for attending a wedding. It was perfect location to beach, very very clean rooms, beautiful views, huge balcony, very nice furniture and all you would have in your own kitchen at home was available at its kitchen. We had a one bedroom apartment, and it was perfect for our family of four. The kids loved the hidden away twin beds! The staff were very friendly. The morning coffee was great and the cleaning personal were so helpful and accomodating. Overall, our stay at the Aston Maui was great and we recommend it to everyone who wants to stay in someplace affordable and so great for the price you pay.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise found here!”
Reviews.Author: Nor-Cal_Chic
Reviews.Content: Great location, perfect beach, superb snorkling, outstanding room with full kitchen (Banyan Bldg.), conveniently located right on the beach "Castaways" restaurant & bar (yummy breakfast and great afternoon mai tai), two nice swimming pools, super ez parking. We loved it here, I give it two thumbs up.

Reviews.Title: “First Time in Maui”
Reviews.Author: agfontanez
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip tp Maui. My wife and I were there to celebrate our 6 year anniversary. We booked the vacation package through Travelocity. The Kaanapali Villas grounds are well kept. During our stay there, the main building and lobby were under renovation. This was not an inconvenience to us since we didn't stay in that building. We stayed in the Banyan building. Our only diappointment with our room was that we were at the furthest point away from the beach. Obviously, we didn't expect an ocean view or a partial ocean view since we didn't pay for such. This disappointment was short lived because the room was pretty comfortable and the owner of the "room" had upgraded it to include a full size refrigerator, a cooktop stove, a dishwasher and a sink. We also figured that since it was our first time in Maui we probably wouldn't be spending much time in the room. We were right about that! Maui is beautiful! The Kaanapali Villas was a great place to rest after a long fun day of playing in Maui. The on-stie restaurant Castaway has great macadamia pancakes...along with a beautiful view of the ocean. We would definitely recommend the Kaanapali Villas for any first time Maui visitors. The cost is reasonable and though the rooms are not luxurious - you will sleep comfortably with all the neccessary amenities.

Reviews.Title: “From Kauai to Maui - what a contrast!”
Reviews.Author: PeakLifeExperiences
Reviews.Content: The last four times we have travelled to Hawaii it has been to Kauai. We adore the peaceful, low stimulus energy of Kauai, the fabulous food, snorkeling and red dirt. We experience a powerful groundedness in Kauai. That fact alone made it difficult for us to venture to other islands - why leave what you know meets all your needs? We booked this trip last minute - a Westjet Vacations package direct flight from YVR to OGG. We had reviewed the hotel virtual tours on-line and liked what we saw so we took a chance. Part of the complex is under construction. The first night we were sorely dismayed by the room we checked into but were so exhausted - direct flight arrives at 10 pm Maui time; by check in it is 3 am Vancouver time - we decided to speak to the management in the morning. We have since been moved to a better room that is closer to the standard that was displayed on their website, in front of the pool, within the sound of the crashing surf. We will be moved again in 3 days to the quality of room that we enjoy. The concierge "Dawn" is very helpful and knowledgeable for bookings, recommendations and honesty. The free shuttle to Whaler's Village is a convenience that we appreciate. As I am writing this review there has been at least a dozen people jog or power walk by getting their early morning workout. It's going to be tough to decide which island we would keep coming back to or sending clients to - or perhaps want to retire to??

Reviews.Title: “Bait and switch, view of a mud puddle”
Reviews.Author: wlrdtravlr
Reviews.Content: When my girlfriend and I booked this trip months prior to departure we clicked on the 1,200+ sq foot garden view. So upon arrival loaded with groceries going up the stairs I was shocked to hear her tell me that we needed to go back to the front desk. The staff had put us in about a 600 sq foot loft with another bed in the living room. Far from the 1,200 sq foot one bedroom I had envisioned. So upon explaining the mix up to the staff we got our next room assignment. This one was even worse. We were facing out to a green fenced off construction area were I was staring at a mud puddle. Back to the front desk were we finally got our third room assignment. We finally settled on a 600 sq foot garden view overlooking the pool. Rather than a one bedroom we had a bed upstairs in the loft. Overall we were happy to be acroos the street from a beautiful beach, but this place was far from what we had imagined. Overall I would say search for other places to stay in Kaanapali or consider staying a couple of miles North in Naplili.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: alemautone
Reviews.Content: hotel consists of spacious and bright apartements. There is also a central building with four floors. Excellent cleaning of the apartment is that of the many green areas and two pools. All apartments are within walking distance from the beach and pools. The restaurant offers a good selection of dishes. Near a highway but silent locations

Reviews.Title: “Bed in the Wall”
Reviews.Author: SMJCal
Reviews.Content: We stayed in one of the low rise units overlooking the pool and really enjoyed our full balcony and distant views of the ocean from our 2nd floor. The pool was never crowded and the pool water nice and warm. Our 12 year old son enjoyed the shuffle board as well the pool. The beach is pretty good and there is good snorkeling just up the beach in front of the Westin Villaâ€™s. The room was a bit dated and weird setup. When we first got into the room we looked around and realized there was no bed or bedroom. The bed was in the wall and had to be pulled down. The washer and dryer were locked up and there were family photos all around the living room which we put away. We also stayed at the Marriott just down the beach which was over $100 more and preferred our time at the Aston and would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “The friendly and responsive staff left us with the best impression”
Reviews.Author: Stephanie777_10
Reviews.Content: The hotel was going through renovation, therefore did affect the overall ambiance of the place. However, it was compensated by the friendly staff at the reservation desk, particularly Shirley Barrera. She went to great length to make sure that we are happy with our accommodation. I applaud her for your friendliness, patience and her professionalism; The maintenance staff was quite responsive when we had some issues with the faucets; Also the cleaning staff was quite accommodating and helpful as well.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing value! Wouldn't stay anywhere else!”
Reviews.Author: pnwest
Reviews.Content: We LOVED the AMK! The service was excellent, everyone was very friendly. Our housekeeper was ON it! Everytime we came back from the beach our room was spotless! Dishes were in the washer, beds were made and everything tidy. The pool was perfect. Loved the kiddy pool area for our 14 month old. The hot tub was just right in the evenings. Even though we were told the hotel was filled to capacity it never felt crowded. The beach was BEAUTIFUL. When we compared it to the other side of Kaanapali, it was waaaay less crowded and the water was calmer. NO rocks, just super soft sand. My husband said the snorkeling to the right was better than black rock. Less crowded and calmer water. He also saw more fish. Yes the hotel was under construction, but we were on the 6th floor and didn't see or hear a thing, except for when we had to walk by it on our way out. We requested ahead of time to be as far away from the construction as possible. We were offered a one bedroom in the towers, or a loft style room in the villas. The villas would be wonderfull, except that we wanted the privacy of a 1 bedroom. Defiantely stay in the villas if you don't want to be near the construction. I can't wait to see it when it is all done. Not having an actual lobby didn't affect our trip one bit. Yes, the rooms are a little dated. Our room had glass EVERYTHING, glass coffee table, kitchen table, end tables, not too safe for our 14 month old. We were never in the room so it really wasn't a problem for us. We had a 1 bedroom ocean view unit. The view was amazing and the room had plenty of space. My mom slept on the hide-a-bed and it was quite lumpy, but they all are. The restaraunt, Castaways, was hit or miss. Somethings were great, others not so much. The bartenders seem to ignore you a little bit unless you were a regular. This was our only real complaint. We just had to be more persistent. The prices were pretty decent. One thing that bothered us was that only somethings were available at certain times of the day on the menu. Like Pupus, and other items. They wouldn't make any exceptions. We saw people leave and not order anything due to the inconvenience. Overall a great place! Definately the best bang for your buck! We visited the Hyatt and other pricey gorgeous places. Not worth the price and crowds to us. Plus our beach was WAY better.

Reviews.Title: “A little piece of paradise !”
Reviews.Author: Garcia745
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a week - from Aug 7th to the 14th. It was an AMAZING place to stay. Our room was clean, comfortable and had a great view of the garden and pool area. It is right on the beach - which is one of the best beaches on the island !! We were very pleased - and looking forward to returning here. Don't hesitate to book your stay here - you won't regret it !!

Reviews.Title: “Nice location, under construction”
Reviews.Author: tkelly7
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel during the first week of August 2010. It is currently under construction (there is no lobby, for instance), but the noise was minimal and we experienced no significant disruptions from the work other than that it was a little unsightly. The staff of the hotel was very friendly and always asked if we were having a nice stay, was there anything they could get for us, etc. We booked an "ocean view" room, which meant in the high rise part of the property, as opposed to the low-rise units. Given that our view was partially obstructed by palm trees, I would have rather have had a low-rise room with a pool view, than be in the high rise, which was louder and generally less attractive than the low rise units. Definitely go for a low-rise unit if you can, even at the expense of the view. After all, when in Hawaii you don't spend a lot of time sitting in your hotel room staring at the view... The hotel has a very nice pool, suitable for all ages and is located on an excellent stretch of beach. From the hotel you can see Molokai, Lanai, and even Oahu in the distance. Just up the beach a few hundred yards was some of the best snorkeling in Maui.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, Fantastic Location in Paradise”
Reviews.Author: gottogetaway2day
Reviews.Content: We stayed 10 nights in June booked through a package. MKV assigned our room 3rd floor in tower. I did ask to see 2 others in the Emerald and Banyan buildings but ultimately we decided on this one. It is true that every room varies in amenities and some have not been renovated in a few decades. I saw one such room in the Emerald Building with an ocean view that definitely was not presentable in my opinion and I was surprised they even let us view it. Nonetheless, our 3rd floor room was independently owned but for sale and managed by Aston. Very clean, spacious and beds (even the king pull out sofa) were very comfortable. Lobby construction was nearby but never did we hear noise as most of it is interior work at this point. Only downside was no lanai in the tower rooms except the 1st floor. $13.50 per day resort fee covered parking/gym(which is very small) and internet. This property is located on a perfect, quieter stretch of Kaanapali beach with snorkeling just north that is superb! Walk past the beach park a short distance and there is great sea life to explore. Take the walking path to Duke's Beach House to the north or toward Black Rock to Hula Grill south. Two great places to eat and enjoy. The Castaways was great for breakfast - the banana pancakes are delicious. Sunsets are fantastic from the property - take your camera and drinks for viewing every night from the lawn chairs next to the beach. Splurge on a dinner to remember at Mama's Fish House in Paia - it's a dining experience. Take your car north to Slaughterhouse beach to boogie board - the waves are intense! Several others in and around Napili and Kapalua are great for snorkeling or swimming. Get the Maui Revealed book as a guide. It's a great resource for new adventures. This was our 3rd stay at MKV and we'll be back again. We like the smaller scale (vs the larger hotel properties) and though it is older, it is beautiful with well maintained grounds. Great for families - a truly memorable vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value, friendly staff on one of the best beaches in Maui.”
Reviews.Author: Someguy747
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just got back from a week long anniversary get-away on Maui and absolutely loved the Aston Maui Kaanapali Villas. From the moment Gwen and Rudy at the front desk checked us in we knew we were in for a treat. Everyone was so friendly and laid back. We were also given a bottle of champagne for our anniversary trip which was a nice touch. The hotel consists of several small two story buildings and a larger 6 story "aloha tower". The smaller buildings were well spread out giving the hotel the feel of an old Hawaii. We stayed in one of the small buildings ...the Banyan Building. Our room was studio 124 and it was beautiful. We had a full well stocked kitchen with new full sized appliances, granite counter tops and maple cabinets. Everything in the bedroom appeared to have been updated from the carpet to the new lcd TV. The bathroom was tiled and had corrian counters. The shower bottom was tiled to look like you were standing on river / beach rocks. Really cool. While we had only a garden view studio, our lanai opened up to a patio and a 10'x20' grassy area partially surrounded by thick shrubs. This was great for a relaxing private morning breakfast. The grounds were immaculate. You could tell that the gardeners took great pride in their work. Every shrub was trimmed and there were rarely ever loose leaves to be seen. The grass between all the units was like a green carpet. It was so thick and felt great on bare feet. The two resort swimming pools though small by Kaanapali standards, were always clean, never felt crowded and there were always plenty of lounge chairs to be had. The grounds also had several gas BBQ stations that we all beautiful high-end BBQs built into granite counters. We utilized these a couple of times to grill steaks and ahi tuna for quiet dinners on the lanai. The restaurant on the grounds was a good value for your dollars. We had a couple of meals there and found that they were best for breakfast. It was really nice to have breakfast just a few short meters from the beach. The resort is also a hub for the Kaanapali trolley which is a free bus (often driven by Rudy from the front desk). This bus will take you to the Whalers village and other nearby resorts and restaurants which is nice if you want to have a few cocktails and leave the rental car behind. My only complaints are as follows: 1. The process for getting beach towels needs to be a bit more streamlined when you first check in. 2. The construction going for for improvements to the aloha tower was loud at times but since we weren't actually in the tower this wasn't that big of a deal for us. Overall we had an amazing time and plan on coming back again in the near future. Aloha!

Reviews.Title: “Do Not Be Fooled By Pictures!! Dont stay here!”
Reviews.Author: FloridaGirl618
Reviews.Content: The grounds are OK at best for maui. The rooms are all individually owned. The first room we walked into had 1980's white "leather" ripped couches and carpet sooooo dirty I cant believe they had the nerve to even act like it was acceptable. Room 111. Then when we complained they gave us a "good" room which was only slightly better because there was no leather. There was also major construction going on and we had to listent to drills and the blaring radios of the workers. Also, the staff was NOT very friendly at all!!!! Dont waste your Maui Vacation here!
