Reviews.Title: “June 26th thru July 10th - LOVED the place!”
Reviews.Author: DoeMaho42
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed in a third floor, one bedroom "garden view" for two weeks. From our balcony we had a garden view - but also could see the ocean. Grounds are amazing - flowers everwhere. The Mai Tai party was fun. Our housekeeper "Dee" was fantastic and made sure our room was spotless each day. Low-key - not crowded - but close to everything. We hit alot of beaches and hotels on this two week trip - and always liked ours better. Snorkeling was awesome about 60 yards to the right of the beach. Our condo had not been unpdated too recently - but was large and super clean and had everything that we needed. Bathroom was HUGE - which worked out well for four people getting ready at once. We are already planning when we can return...we didn't want to leave!! Great value for the price!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location, nice place for families.”
Reviews.Author: janna24
Reviews.Content: We had an excellent one bedroom apartment (rm 215). However, some of the other rooms are very dated while ours had recently been remodeled, so you might want to ask for a newer room. The beach is great, we drove to a Kahana public beach one day and ours at the resort was way better. Technically you probably could walk places from here, but we had our 2 year old and definitely needed a car. You can walk to many of the fancier resorts (Westin, Sheraton) along the beach boardwalk. A great place for the value, I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: hawaiianskye
Reviews.Content: This was my second time visiting Maui, and my husband's first. My first time ,a few years back, I had made the mistake of staying in an overpriced hotel along the Kaanapali beach. This time, for our honeymoon, I researched and remembered the villas and chose them. And I was more than happy. The suites with the kitchens are perfect. We went grocery shopping at the local market, and I made breakfast and/or lunch almost every morning to take with us. We saved money because we basically only ate out maybe twice a day instead of three times. The grounds, and the rooms are extremely clean. And the location is perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and Cozy”
Reviews.Author: flymeaway89
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Aston Villas for 4 nights. Although the decor may not be quite up to date, the room was practical. It had a nicely refinished bathroom and the double sinks had a door separating the bathroom/shower, so it was easy for 4 of us to get ready quickly. The kitchen was very convenient. It was fully stocked with glasses, dishes, silverware, coffee pot, toaster, stove, fridge, and even a blender! We stopped at a grocery store on the way there to save some money. We had a nice view of one of their 3 pools. Very short 2 minute walk to the beach. The villas are a nice change from a high rise, cramped hotel room. The room was spacious with a sitting area and balcony. The location was pretty centrally located near restaurants, site seeing and shopping. We rented a car so we were able to travel all over the island. Although there are some renevations being done to the front desk portion of the hotel, we could barely hear them. This hotel is very close to downtown Lahaina where many shops and restaurants are located. Overall, we were very satisfied with the Villas and would probably stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Never ever stay here!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Botobby
Reviews.Content: The room except for having cochroaches and except for not being cleaned properly was fine. The problem was the staff and the cleanliness of the room. My daughter dropped popcorn on the floor one night and it was still there 4 days after (after 4 cleanings by the cleaning lady). I killed a large cochroach in our room and made a splatter on the bathroom floor. The cochroach splatter was there on the June 21st, 2010 and was still there when we left on June 26th, 2010 (its probably still there). The pool is supposed to open at 8:00 am. On our last day we went to the pool at 8:45 but the pool guy was still cleaning the pool. I nicely asked the pool guy when he would be finished and he gave me a pissed off look and said it would be done when it was done. We have kids so we can't wait around in the heat forever. 20 mins later my wife decided to ask the pool guy and he rudely said to her "i don't know" and went back to his work. How could he not know - he cleans the pool everyday. When we told the front desk about the incident, the lady there did not seem to care at all (she did not write anything down or say that she would advise the manager or someone else). On another occassion my wife had to feed our baby and went back to the room. As my wife was entering the room the cleaning lady told her that she was just going to go in and clean up our room. My wife asked the cleaning lady if she could come back. My wife said the cleaning lady gave her a look like she wanted to kill her and turned around without saying anything and walked off. We never had our room cleaned that day. The front desk was very rude also. They have a rack of clean towels right in front of them - I am not sure why because everytime we asked them for towels they acted pissed off and said that guests were not supposed to get towels from the front desk and that that was the job of the cleaning ladies. The only place where the staff was really pleasant on the grounds was at the restaurant on the grounds called Castaways. One more bad thing about the hotel - the gym looks like its someones basement gym - the equipment is old and dirty and they have no dumbells (at least not past 15 pound and they only have one 15 pound dumbell) or barbells. I never thought that staff at a hotel could ruin my stay but they did at this hotel. Pay a few extra bucks and stay somewhere else. Honesty never stay here.

Reviews.Title: “perfect location and great accomodations”
Reviews.Author: NorCalhikers
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel. If you are sick of staying in HIGH-RISE hotels, this is the place for you. The convenient location, restaurant on premises, beachshack rentals, snorkeling reef, walk out right to the beach, nice grassy lounge area, beach walk, closeness to Lahaina and Whalers village (yuk)....all was fantastic. It was quiet and had beautifully kept grounds. There was construction during our stay and we didn't hear a thing. I can't wait to come back and see the hotel when the construction is done.

Reviews.Title: “Maui Dream Vacation”
Reviews.Author: cbuecker
Reviews.Content: Condo exceeded our expectations. Very nicely decorated with comfortable new furnishing. Conviently located to all ammenities. Kitchen was fully equipped with the latest appliances. Enjoyed swimming in both pools. Each pool are was very unique with hot tubs and beautiful landscaped grounds. Nice restaurant and bar on grounds. Can't wait to plan our next trip to Maui and will definately ask for this condo.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing close to a 3 star villa”
Reviews.Author: Iverigma
Reviews.Content: Be careful they're dumping their rooms in priceline.com with the fake 3 star rating. I like the location(very close to the beach) and it is cheap (considering free parking, free wi-fi & fitness center.) Restrooms are old with dozens of little flies which scared my wife. Furnitures are old and ugly. Don't expect any 3 star level from it and you will feel better about the stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and Quiet”
Reviews.Author: rayunited
Reviews.Content: The hotel location is very good. Great ocean view and very quiet. Easy access to the beach and has a nice pool. Unfortunately, the hotel room is kind of outdated. The Castaway Cafe (restaurant inside the hotel) has good food and ocean view, recommend the breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “a good resort, a great restaurant”
Reviews.Author: Yago1
Reviews.Content: Although currently renovating their lobby the resort is still very relaxing and a wonderful place to spend a week or two. We didn't notice any noise from the construction but we were in the villas and not the main building. Our unit was recently redone and it was very comfortable and well equipped. The pools on the property are excellent and the beach is great. The restaurant is outstanding. The Castaway is an island gem. The food is local and fresh. The wine list and its pricing is amazing and the staff are superb. Even if you stay somewhere else this restaurant is worth a visit.

Reviews.Title: “very charming , loved our stay”
Reviews.Author: frances64
Reviews.Content: before I booked our trip, I researched most of the hotels on the west end of Maui. Maui Kaanapali Villas seemed to stand out for me, as it seemed so charming in the pictures. Actually it is. We loved everything about this place. Even though they are renovating right now, it did not bother us. We could not hear any noise. But then we were gone most of the day. We had a 1 bedroom suite that was newly renovated, and it was very nice .Coconut building, room 266. The king size bed was very comfortable. The lanai overlooked the smaller swimming pool that we used everyday. The grounds are immaculate. They provided complementry coffee in the lobby in morning which was nice. And then Joe , who works frount desk, if he was not busy always had time to chat. We had a wonderful stay here, and would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Please do not stay here - I want it all to myself”
Reviews.Author: maui4fun
Reviews.Content: I hate to tell everyone how much I love this property because they will start booking the condos that I want to book. I found my condo on VRBO. My 5th trip to Maui and the best property for many reasons. 1. wonderful beach with sandy bottom so you can swim! 2. great snorkeling beach about 100 yards to the right and Black Rock to the left a short walk away. 3. quiet at night 4. restaurant on premises 5. easy access to Lahaina, Kapalua, and trolley to the Whaler's village I have stayed in the Hyatt and other properties. But coming back over Labor day 2010 to stay here again. We had family that stayed at the Hyatt but they hung out with us at our condo in Kaanapali Villas. The laid back ambiance, wonderful beach, and large accommodations are great value for the money. Also the views! Wonderful mountain view on one side, and great ocean view with Lanai and Molokai visible. Grocery stores nearby and Westin property next door has a little grocery store if you don't want to drive to the grocery store. Please find another place to stay..... I want this one to myself.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Place”
Reviews.Author: Calgarycouple2
Reviews.Content: The Villas is a fantastic place for people who want to go and relax. The rooms are spacious, the beach is right their. The Pools are nice. Castaway Cafe is open from 7:30 - 9:00. We had an amazing time. The Kaanapali trolly picks you up every 1/2 hour and takes you into Whalers Village, where you can catch the Maui bus to go into Lahina and go shopping or shop at Whalers Villiage. We had the most amazing time here and we definately will be going back next year.

Reviews.Title: “Nice with a caveat”
Reviews.Author: Henrik47
Reviews.Content: Good resort that they are in the process of improving but be warned the main building is under construction and will be for months. Noisy from 8am to 4:30pm weekdays so there will be no napping. Most of the one bedrooms are in this main tower so they will put you in a 'loft' instead (and call it a one bedroom) in one of the smaller buildings which doesn't work with young kids. No discount offered so I will complain here instead. They will not warn you about this. Should be a great value once complete but prices will likely be hiked up.

Reviews.Title: “PARADISE WITH HOUSEKEEPING ISSUES”
Reviews.Author: schoolhouse20
Reviews.Content: Still here for 2 more nights. The studio garden view is absolutely gorgeous. Clean, great view of smaller pool. Love the tiki torches each night, all over the property. This owner really did a great job decorating, wood floors and tile, real sweet , instead of rug. Being a motel owner myself I'm a little picky. Now the disappointing part. On day 1 we did not need housekeeping so we put the privacy sign up. On day 2 we needed at least a change of towels. We put the SERVICE please sign in the key slot at 9am. At 5:30 I called to ask if the maids were done. They said they were done by 4:30 each day. I mentioned the towels could become an issue. The front desk offered to send some up. We returned at 9PM to find still no clean towels, I called again. Someone did come up 10 min. later. Being a motel owner, we would of cleaned the room ourselves within 1 hour, if my maid had missed it. It has happened to us only once in 5 years of ownership. Guess it was just not my lucky day at a beautiful resort in paradise.

Reviews.Title: “Wedding Stay”
Reviews.Author: Leenie05
Reviews.Content: I actually got married here on April 24th and everything was awesome!!! We are local residents and were so impressesd with Craig, Francis and the rest of the staff here to make our wedding day perfect. This resort is one the the best deals on Kaanapali. You can't beat the beach and location and they are currectly making renovations to update the resort. The rooms are big, spacious and clean. We were married on their ocean front lawn and had our reception onsite at Castaway Cafe. Thank you everyone at Maui Kaanapali Villas for all of your hard work to make our special day PERFECT!!!!

Reviews.Title: “BEST VALUE ON MAUI”
Reviews.Author: zaguche
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a studio with kitchen/garden view which was AWESOME. We could pick 5 different types of fruit on the grounds. Pool OK, great hot tub at pool. Grounds were gorgeous. We liked garden view better than ocean view, because people walked in front of ocean rooms patio to get to water so we had much more privacy. Great fully equip. kitchen with EVERYTHING. close to grocery stores so we cooked most meals ourselves. They also have very nice gas grills on property you can use.One great advantage was being able to park right outside our room {ground level} instead of a multi level. Close to everything. Very accommodating staff. Third trip for us, and can't imagine staying anywhere else. Very nice property at a great price, other comparable resorts showed age, not here. If you go, get the book about hidden secrets of Maui at ABC store, very very helpful. If water is flowing GO TO TOP OF 7 POOLS. AWESOME. This is a fabulous resort for the family. You won't want to leave. Also the best things on Maui are FREE, get the book !

Reviews.Title: “This resort was Paradise !”
Reviews.Author: Al_yesiller
Reviews.Content: We stayed here from April 20-27 Iam writing this while Iam still here relaxing the reason iam writing this review while Iam still on vacation is because of the service we recieved when we checked in they gave us room 145 at the banyan which was beatiful and newly renovated but was far from the pool the next day (Craig and Stephanie) upgraded us no charge to the water front and next to the big pool and didn't charge us a dime. This place will be our new home away from home thank you Aston kaanapali for giving us a piece of paradise.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place to relax.”
Reviews.Author: clevelandrub
Reviews.Content: Sadly this is my last night's stay at the Villas. We were greeted warmly at the temporary reception desk (it resembles a motel reception desk, only because they're renovating the lobby). The room is nicely equipped with a microwave, coffeemaker, and kitchen items, has a nice outdoor seating area, wonderful pool, and great access to a fantastic beach. I'm so glad we took a chance with Priceline and got such a great place.

Reviews.Title: “Top notch in every aspect”
Reviews.Author: ken2152002
Reviews.Content: My wife and son have stayed here 4 times since 2000, and each time it gets better and better!. Every room, and every aspect of the facility and its' grounds seem to have been recently renovated or are in the process of being renovated. New BBQ islands, tropical pool grounds, and everything is immaculate!. Great beach location(calm water) adds to the ambience. And, on top of everything else, the staff is just fantastic-friendly and helpful. Forget the pricey name resorts-if you want the total package then stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Stay at MKV; Absolutly beautiful, peaceful, clean, and comfortable vacation”
Reviews.Author: charfman
Reviews.Content: If you are going to Maui you should really stay here! Your can pretty much walk across the street to rent a car, or catch the FREE trally that comes around every 30 mins to take you the the Village.....The prices for the rooms were so cheap! the pools are brand new. In fact Most units have a view of with a pool or the ocean. My favorite feature of this proprty is the fact that's it an liitle bit older facility. It's very sound proof, large rooms, nice kitchens... CLEAN!!!! upadated grounds. The staff are helpful, friendly and on the ball... If you need beach towels you can get them at the front desk... You can rent cabanas if it's a little windy... such a nice place we have aready BOOKED OUR NEXT TRIP BACK MAY 2010! see you there!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Condominium/Hotel”
Reviews.Author: airforcecolonel
Reviews.Content: We recently visited Maui and have stayed at MKV before. Great location, very friendly and helpful staff, updated pools/ hot tubs and grounds, great restaurant on property with reasonable prices and our room was updated with everything you would want. Excellent for families as well as those celebrating special occasions. While there, we learned that they will soon begin an update of the lobby and library, the last remaining item that needs to be done on their property. It is a hidden gem located among the big hotels on Kaanapali Beach. Great value (surprised it didn't cost more), activity fee of $13/day is the cheapest on Kaanapali Beach and an outstanding property.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful condo and location”
Reviews.Author: snorkelingfamily6671
Reviews.Content: We stayed here from March 10-17, 2010 in a one bedroom condo. We loved our condo which had a partial ocean view even though it was a garden view. The condo was updated and very comfortable. The beach was amazing and was only a short walk from our hotel. We have a 7 and 9 year old and we all snorkeled about a five minute walk to the right of our beach. There is a coral reef in front of the Westin Villas (just next door to this hotel). We saw tons of tropical fish and a couple of turtles. My kids loved the pool here and we were always able to find chairs by the pool. It is a quiet, peaceful location! We would stay here again. We also loved Maui and all of its charm.

Reviews.Title: “Great place on the best beach in Maui!”
Reviews.Author: Tina_in_Ottawa
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Aston Maui Kaanapali Villas the first week of march and loved it! The location is great - about 3-4 miles from Lahaina which has lots of stores, shop and restaurants. The hotel/condo is right on Kaanapali beach which is the most beautiful beach we've ever experienced (and we've travelled the world), The beach is large, with nice sand, clean, warm water and dolphins and whales just off shore which provided daily entertainment. The beach was never crowded. The hotel itself was very nice. The grounds are beautiful, the two pools and hot tubs were very nice - clean and well-maintained and staff were friendly. We stayed in room 257 in the Coconut Building. It was a studio with a garden view overlooking the second pool. It was great - quiet, well maintained and clean. If we had one complaint it would be that the carpet was older and in need of replacement and the wi-fi signal was very weak. The room was equipped with everything we needed for a great stay. THere's also a trolley service that goes between the main resorts in the area that is very convenient if you want to go to a nice restaurant/bar and not worry about driving. We'll definitely go back!!!

Reviews.Title: “A503 Mixed Feelings”
Reviews.Author: alxjnn
Reviews.Content: Mixed feelings about unit 503 as previous postings have shared. The location of the complex was very convenient to the beach. The staff were friendly but could not help with any issues since this unit is privately owned and not managed by Aston. A503 is large and spacious but there is a reason why they showcase a photo of the newly remodeled kitchen. Everything else is not worth seeing. Carpet, walls, popcorn ceiling, beds with multiple eggcrate mattress toppers all very dated. The bathroom looks like the "before" version of any bathroom cleaning product commercial that demonstrates before and after results. No hot water for 2 days. There is a decent partial view of the ocean if you look out to the right.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Location on Kaanapali Beach!”
Reviews.Author: KRLyons
Reviews.Content: We visited the week of Feb. 16/10 and the hotel's location on the sandy 3 mile beach is excellent! The staff (Joe and Anthony at the front desk, Dawn at the tour desk and Allan in maintenance were very helpful. The gardens, pools and hot tubs were well maintained. We stayed in the hotel and the room decor was a little dated, but clean and spacious. You can walk the boardwalk to Whaler's Village in about 15 min. Sites we enjoyed were the Halekala crater trip, the lavendar farm in Kula, a guided Ekati tour on the road to Hana, golf at Kapalua (expensive but worth it for the views), the authentic luau on Front st. in Lahaina, as well as Lahaina Grill, Pineapple Grill and Plantation House restaurants. We look forward to another visit in the near future.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to vacation”
Reviews.Author: JoyvanBrackel
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our 2 week stay in February immensely: *great beach, beautiful grounds *Castaway Cafe is on the ocean, patio overlooks the ocean *pool is large *condo has great views over the ocean and whales breaching *has paperback library for reading, fitness center(small), laundry facilities *staff busy but helpful *beachwalk with avid walkers come through-fun to watch *parking available *close to Lahaina and Whaler's Village for restaurants and shopping *low-density area (no highrises)-very relaxing and quiet

Reviews.Title: “This is what a stay in Hawaii should be like”
Reviews.Author: suebenn
Reviews.Content: Excellent condominium hotel with relaxing atmosphere, quiet beach, kitchen facilities, a terrific restaurant on site, and wonderful people working there to help you. I was looking for a room on the West side of Maui that reminded me of what old Hawaii was like - not too "hotelly" but with modernized facilities and amenities that reminded me of the feeling of old Hawaii - that is that you know that you are in Hawaii and not some other resort. This condominium hotel really fit the bill. The grounds are beautiful, the experience is relaxing, and much of it has been renovated recently. This is an excellent place to get away, relax and enjoy the experience of Maui.

Reviews.Title: “Say NO to highrises - enjoy the tranquility of the beachfront and tropical gardens”
Reviews.Author: writer99
Reviews.Content: Maui Ka'anapali Villas is a truly unique and restful place in an area abounding in faceless highrises. It maintains its low-key charm and unhurried pace - the staff are wonderful and genuinely warm. It vies with the high end market with its beautiful landscaped grounds, expansive beachfront, and fully appointed condominium rooms. The one I stayed in was newly remodeled and gorgeous. In January, I saw whales off the coast as I dawdled over breakfast on the Castaway's Restaurant lanai. The Ka'anapali trolley (free!) is great fun as it transports you to Whaler's Village for shopping and dining. But a highlight is to go the beach and watch the sunset.

Reviews.Title: “A Wonderful Place to go if you're on a Budget”
Reviews.Author: itsmejs
Reviews.Content: We stayed in one of the the 2nd floor condos, nice but a bit dated and the bed was a murphy bed that was not very comfortable. The grounds were very tropical and exquisite. The restaurant is right on the beach and was a nice place to go for sandwiches and drinks. The pool was clean, a good size but it was very cold. The fitness center looks like it was a afterthought so if that's important to you try another resort. Now for the location, it doesn't get any better when you're on a beautiful large clean beach that you can take long walks on without being crowded. If you're on a budget and looking for a good value I would recommend the Maui Kaanapali Villas.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, good value”
Reviews.Author: corycory19
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed in a studio apartment at the back end of the Maui Kaanapali Villas. The room was perfect, well furnished and clean. The value was great, centrally located on Maui to get to the various parts of the island. We appreciated staying at the back of the property as it was cheaper but still had a great resort feel. We liked having the small kitchen, so that we didn't have to find a place to eat breakfast everyday. The beach was beautiful, and was not too far from the room, even at the back of the resort. I would definitely visit again, and try to stay in the same room!

Reviews.Title: “Very Happy Customers”
Reviews.Author: PercyKittens
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 4 nights on our honeymoon. We were both very happy with everything. The staff were friendly and helpful, the room was neat and clean and the facilities were great. Having a small kitchen was great for tea and coffee and snacks so we didn't have to eat out constantly. The bathroom was clean and spacious. The bed was comfortable and the room overall comfortable and relaxing. The grounds were lovely and we were well able to get around to the places we wanted to see. The place was quiet and the pool and beach were beautiful. The cafe on the grounds was great for basic fresh food and the convenience store on the property was great for necessities. Overall we wouldnt hesitate to recommend this place to anyone and we would certainly return!

Reviews.Title: “Great for the price!”
Reviews.Author: DynamicDuo2007
Reviews.Content: Beds were basic and furnishings were simple; OV studio was spacious, clean and had a full kitchen with a full size coffeemaker, blender, etc. Buy large jugs of water at Safeway as Hawaii hotels tend to have heavily chlorinated water and it does not make for good coffee. Huge bathroom lined with mirrors with excellent lighting. Prices were around $140 per night less than the hotel hosting the event I attended. Floors in the Aloha tower from 3rd-6th have rudimentary balconies but you can open the glass doors and put your front legs of the chair out. Still a very lovely sitting area even though you can't actually sit on the balcony. Ask for a quiet room and you won't be put too near the highway which runs next to the ends of the wings of the Aloha Tower. This is a quiet resort, not a party-style place with loud rowdy drunks. Ocean Side rooms have a substantial lanai or patio although they are only 1-2 floors in the two bldgs nearest the ocean (with pool/garden view). The restaurant was nice and service laid back. Sit at the most remote table by the beach outside and watch the wall geckos. Great snorkeling up the beach north (short walk on the beachwalk path) and you can walk though the resort area on the beach walk from this hotel through the south end of kaanapali beach, although it is easy to lose the path as it goes through the Sheraton hotel that is built on the Black Rock. Grounds are pretty and parking was pretty easy. $12.50 resort fee covers parking, phone calls, and internet ($25 per day at the fancier resorts). Staff were very pleasant with one exception and not a terrible one (guy just seems too tired to move from his position leaning on the front counter to accomodate customer requests). If you want luxurious mattresses and four star treatment, pay the extra bucks. If you are a relaxed independent traveler, you will get your money's worth here. The kaanapali trolley stops right in front of the lobby and covers the entire resort area including the Fairway shops.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Beach-Will Be Back!”
Reviews.Author: Papaya81
Reviews.Content: We booked a Vacation Package and this was one of three choices we had for hotels. Our travel agent had been before and said the place was good and the location was amazing. But before booking I read about 400 of these reviews and found many good ones but a few really bad ones which made me a little nervous. However we booked and now I am glad we did! Its true what people say, this location is the best. The beach, Kanapali Beach, here is white sand and clear ocean water. Almost never rainy or too windy you can enjoy the hotel property everyday. There is amazing snorkeling to the left on the beach about a 5-10 minute walk. There are three pools on the property and one restaurant which is not cheap but has great food. There is a general store which again not as cheap as going to one of the many ABC stores in town but has almost anything you need if stuck. There is also an amazing activities desk in the lobby which is free. The lady that served us was Dawn, we told her what we wanted to do and she booked it all for us that day, we paid right there and she wrote our a plan for us and then we just showed up for the events we booked; Easy! The room we had was 226 in the Banyan building. This room was clean, fully furnished and newly renovated, with a king bed. and safe. All of the things that we had requested a week prior to arriving. I do recommend doing this as it seemed the only way to avoid being one of those people that had a poor experience. I guess the rooms are privately owned so some are up to date and others are not as well maintained. The room was large and air conditioned and quiet, the bathroom was also large. All tile flooring and no frills decor but really you do not spend much time there and its nice to spend the extra money on adventure, food and shopping. Although if you get a condo which we did you can buy groceries at the Safeway down the road (5 minute drive) and save. Bring a cooler so you can take snacks or lunch out with you. We went to Lahaina most of our days for dinner and a stroll down Front street where you can shop, dine, enjoy ice cream and the view. There is an old courthouse, prison, and Banyan tree in town (all sites to see). There is beach walk access at the hotel that takes you by all the other resorts so you can check out other locations and beaches. The cleaning service take out garbage, makes the bed, and puts in clean towels daily but not much else. There are beach towels that are given to you at your arrival. There is a 20 dollars hold for each towel on your card but it is removed when you return your towel at departure. As well, there is a 12 dollar daily charge that for a week added up to 87 dollars US for us. This charge is to cover your parking, high speed internet access and gym access. A lot of people who wrote reviews were upset about this charge because I think it was a surprise for them at checking out but if you are aware of it now and take it into consideration when booking and adding up your total cost you will avoid this upset. We didn't use internet or the gym so it was basically 12 dollar a night for parking. This location is 45 mins from Airport, 30 mins from Maui Ocean Center, 2 hour drive to top of Haleakala Volcano, 3 drive to Hana (full day for the entire trip including stops) 1 hour drive to Ziplining, 1 hour to Macys and more shopping, 15 minutes to Whalers Village which has high end shopping such as Louis Vuitton etc.,short drive to Lahaina Town and many many beaches. Advise buying the book Maui Revealed which was very accurate in its reviews and helped us to not miss the big things to do in Maui. Would stay here again and recommend to others. We saw elderly, families and couples of all ages on the properties!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the place, the relaxing atmosphere, and friendly staff!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Gabby125
Reviews.Content: Loved the place, very close to any other activities you would want to do in Maui. Pools are awesome and the beach was amazing! You can snorkel ritght on Kaanapali beach. Be sure to rent snorkeling gear at Boss Frog's in Lahaina (Cannery Mall) for the best price. Loved it and would definitely stay again and again!!!

Reviews.Title: “Avoid at all costs”
Reviews.Author: lisalongoria14
Reviews.Content: New tile flooring, and that's about all I can say thats good about this place. Bed was a flat as the floor with sharp springs digging into our back. Water main broke in a different building, and the front desk refused to let a guest use the beach towels to help clean it up. Really? You'd rather have water damage and give awful customer service? Really?

Reviews.Title: “BEST KEPT SECRET”
Reviews.Author: radytogo
Reviews.Content: we stayed 6 nights at the villas.It is one of the best kept secrets.They staff were friendly and always willing to help.Ms Gwen treated us like we were family.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Saelyn
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 6 days. The bed was low quality and uncomfortable and the air conditioner had a difficult time keeping our room cool. We stayed in a studio and appreciated the use of a full kitchen. There is a $12/day fee which hardly seems worth it. Laundry facilities were expensive and the gym was small. One positive is that the $12 covers parking. Overall the facility was outdated. The staff were very friendly and helpful and we made use of the trolley that is scheduled to stop at the hotel every 20 minutes. It is great if you have a luau to attend somewhere else, but both directions of our trip were not on time. I would recommend finding a hotel on this stretch of the beach, however. It has great swimming and great snorkeling. Black rock is down the beach from the Ka'anapali Villas to the left, and if you go further down the beach to the right of the hotel (or park at Ka'anapali Beach Park) you can snorkel right off the shore. Despite the hotel, we loved our stay on Maui and plan to go back . . . only to a different hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Shop around”
Reviews.Author: TRAVELSCa
Reviews.Content: We could not run any water in the bathroom sink because the bathroom sink leaked. We had to brush our teeth and wash our faces while leaning over into the bathtub/shower or while taking a shower. We had to do the same just to wash our hands after using the bathroom. We stayed for only one night and that was plenty. They also charge you for the use of their swimming pool towels, regardless of whether or not you use them. Your credit card will be credited or your cash refunded once you checkout and personally bring them the pool towels to the front desk! Shop around - we could have done better for the price we paid. They did not offer any discount for the hassle and the sink did not get fixed before we left.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Manek
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Aston Maui Kaanapali Villas from 17-21 July 2009, and we could not have chosen a better hotel. The hotel is on the beach. On one of the mornings, we saw wild dolphins that came very close to the shore. They have snorkel rentals too. There is a reef close by and we went snorkelling one of the days. It is very close to the Lahaina Cannery Mall (easy spot to Safeway)..

Reviews.Title: “Great value and the location is paradise!”
Reviews.Author: Escape_from_MA
Reviews.Content: We chose this property for our stay in Maui because it was reasonably priced for Kaanapali area and we figured we would enjoy having the extra room and full kitchen after our family of four with 2 teenagers spent several days in a standard hotel room in Waikiki. We were pleasantly surprised by the beautiful, quiet beach and pool and the friendly, helpful staff. Not only is the location outstanding, but the property was very well-maintained and clean. After spending a fortune on restaurant meals in Honolulu, it was a relief to be able to cook in for breakfast and a few lunches and dinners. The room furnishings were a bit outdated, but the view was beautiful, the kitchen spacious and the beds comfortable. Let's face it - you don't go to Maui for the furniture. There was ample parking (we rented a car) and the trolley to Whaler's Village and the nearby resorts was very convenient. If you are a snorkeler, check out Honolua Bay, it was amazing! You don't need to spend 100 bucks pp to go out on a boat - just bring or rent gear and jump in!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place to stay; great value”
Reviews.Author: RyryE
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Aston Maui Ka'anapali Villas for five nights after having a good experience with other Aston properties. This was no different, as we thoroughly enjoyed the location and hotel. We booked a standard hotel room that was not classified as an Ocean View, but we could see the Pacific in the distance, as well as some of the West Maui Mountains. We were on the fourth floor of the main building. Other than needing to update the hotel with new wallpaper or paint, everything was in fantastic shape. Some reviews said it was old, but it was only cosmetic, and not bad at all. Our room was one of the cleanest I have ever stayed in. The housekeeping staff was outstanding, as you would have no idea it was a beach hotel because we didn't see a speck of sand during our stay, even though we tracked plenty of it in. The location of the hotel was absolutely fantastic. We were less than five minutes from the main portion of Ka'anapali Beach and Whalers' Village, and the beach in front of the hotel is outstanding. It is not nearly as crowded -- you could have 50 feet on either side of you to yourself -- as Ka'anapali, and the water is crystal clear. There are no rocks or other impediments to hinder going in the water like on many Hawaiian beaches, and there is good snorkeling about 50 yards to the right of the main beach access from the hotel. The hotel rents beach chairs and lounge chairs to sit directly on the beach, but we preferred to use the free lounge chairs on the grass that overlooks the beach. It was almost the best of both worlds... no sand to get all over us unless we wanted to walk or go in the water, and a perfect view of the Pacific along with Lana'i and Moloka'i. There is plenty of shade from palm and mesquite trees, as well as late afternoon shade that comes from the buildings. The pool is also close to the beach, although we didn't spend time there. Castaway's Cafe is located by the beach and pool, and while we didn't eat there, the prices on the menu were very reasonable by Maui standards. We did enjoy Happy Hour there ($2 draft beers, $$ off mixed and frozen drinks), and it had a good atmosphere. The staff was extremely kind and helpful at the hotel. The front desk was able to check us in even though we arrived at 10 a.m., and the staff elsewhere was equally as nice. If you are staying at this hotel and arriving on Maui from another island (particularly O'ahu), consider taking an Island Air flight into the Kapalua airport. It is less than 10 minutes from the hotel, and the rest of Kapalua or Ka'anapali for that matter, and flights are only about $20 more. A cab to the hotel was $12, and we were able to take a day of car rental off since there is a free trolley from the hotel to other places in the area. There are plenty of car rental places within an easy half-mile walk of the hotel to pick up from in the morning. The hotel is 10-15 minutes from both Napili, Kapalua and Lahaina, which made it convenient for going either way. It took us about 45-50 minutes to get Kiehi on the South Shore. Ka'anapali Villas also has a small 'general store,' although the prices are very high. We preferred to get some small staples at a nearby grocery store (there are a few in Kahana and Napili to choose from). We did use the coin-operated laundry facility, which was $2.25 for a washer (a large one) and $1 for the dryer. Nice facility with plenty of machines. Also, they have free hi-speed internet in the rooms. We booked this as part of a package, and we couldn't have been happier with the hotel and the value. From walking around some other hotels in the Ka'anapali area, it looked like we got very similar amenities on a nicer part of the beach for a better price. We'll definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: arev2
Reviews.Content: My Husband myself and daughter stayed for 10 daysat the kaanapali resort. We were not to happy with the room assigned to us on the 4th floor in the tower.It was supposed to be a one bedroom, but it was just one very large room with a small partition. However the staff at the front desk were very helpful and did find us another unit ,a one bedroom overlooking the pool. The unit was very well equipped with everything we needed everything in good condition,It had a roof top bedroom with full bathroom. Downstairs had a bedroom with a full bathroom and a very comfortable living room with full kitchen.and a very nice balcony where we enjoyed breakfast in the mornings. This is a quiet resort,the pool is never overcrowded and always plenty of beach chairs The beach is great and the grounds just beauitful,also there is a free trolley that takes you to other hotels in the area and shopping but still reccomend a car to get around the island..Once again all of the staff were very helpful from the front desk to maid service, If you are looking to party this is not the place for you,great for familys and people who like to just relax. Just so you know the tower does not have balconys as such they are just a narrow strip.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely wonderful place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: HawaiianVisit0r
Reviews.Content: We were greeted by Joe at the desk when we checked into our room. He was very helpful and friendly. Our room was beautiful, clean, and very comfortable. The staff was very helpful and whenever we called the desk for help, they sent someone up to our room immediatey. We enjoyed the big lanai and view of the gardens and pool. The kitchen was well stocked and met all our needs. The restaurant had excellent food and reasonable prices along with a beautiful view of the ocean as you ate. This is the third time I have stayed here and if I come to Maui again, this will be the place I stay.

Reviews.Title: “Very Pleasant Stay”
Reviews.Author: NYCLover08
Reviews.Content: Pros: the beach is steps away, is clean, sandy, and semi-private. The staff is friendly and helpful but not intrusive. The grounds are immaculate. Parking is easy and plentiful. On site store is well stocked. On site restraaunt is good and not too expensive ($10 for a burger and fries that will cost about the same at Carl's on Maui). An activities director is available to assist with planning, but you can get better deals shopping around. Beware that the lowest priced deals come with a manditory timeshare presentation. You can horseback ride a few miles away, snorkle on the beach (gear is cheap), or travel north or south a few miles to clear water sandy beaches. The boats to Molikini are 30 minutes away. The "Quicksilver" is the absolute best 5-hour trip there. Parasailing is a few miles away. You will not regret doing this one activity if you do nothing else. A good Luau is right next door at the Royal Kaanapali. The room we stayed in was on the 4th floor of the main tower. We had a partial ocean view, but a relaxing view of the quiet gardens below. The pool is big and clean. The spa is small but refreshing. Literally steps from the beach which is sandy and clean. Our room was one bedroom deluxe with a full kitchen. The beds were in a separate room apart form the living/dining area. Clean with plenty of furniture and 2 TV's. The kitchen was fully equipped which allowed us to cook in all week. Free in-room coffee, but Starbucks is just 3 miles away at Cannery Mall. There is also a Safeway there, but we stopped at Costco just outside the airport to stock up on food. If you go to BJ's, one 4-slice pizza will set you back $24 not including a drink. $125 spent at Costco will feed 4 for a week. Cook your own food and save a ton of money for all the fun island activities that are available. Or go to the Hyatt, spend $400-500 a night on your room and enjoy your ocean view. You won't be able to afford anything else.... Cons: This is a timeshare property, so each room is different in size and features. Read the individual descriptions carefully before booking. If there are rooms available, free upgrades are the norm. Just ask. Many owners "rent directly" but there are deposits, etc. Booking directly is easier in my opinion. Tips: Rent a car. It is easier to get all over the island and will save you time and money. A free trolley stops in front all day long, but it only takes you to Lahaina (great shops and food).

Reviews.Title: “Surprise double-charge”
Reviews.Author: NevaPlanet
Reviews.Content: The resort was actually nice, but I have 2 disappointments. First, when I made a reservation I asked and paid for an ocean view and got a slight view of an ocean behind the parking lot and the trees. The beach was excellent, and I think it was the best part of the resort. Pools are gated and accessible supposedly by the room key, but we never used our key; we were able open it from inside. Second disappointment was to find out that myself and another family we were charged double during the checkout. I received a credit next day, but my friends still havenâ€™s seen one and this double charge created an overcharge hassle with their credit card. I hope the hotel will pay for the overcharge fee; will see.

Reviews.Title: “Seriously disappointing”
Reviews.Author: EwaBound
Reviews.Content: Aston kaanapali Villas appears nice at first but declines quickly. Each of the units is independently owned and maintained, meaning its hit or miss for things like working A/C, television, windows that open and close. The room categories are meaningless. "Garden view" means parking lot view. "Ocean view" means if you walk somewhere on the 13 acre compound, you may see the ocean, but not from your room. Oceanside room (what I booked, and the most expensive option) has no ocean view, and is hundreds of feet from the actual ocean side. Management plays word games with conventional definitions of "ocean side" and "ocean view". I guess technically anywhere on the island you are "ocean side". All guests are charged $12 a day automatically for "facilities" use like their micro-gym, even if you never use it. All rooms are supposed to have beach towels upon arrival, ($20 deposit automatically charged for each, and refund at checkout). Our room had no towels so we called the front desk to have some sent. 90 min. and two more calls later, they finally arrived. And as expected, they tried charging us for the towels we never had. There's only one little restaurant that's overpriced. Avoid getting a meal near the closing time of 8:50pm, because the quality is pathetic. At every turn there are reminder notes posted. No shoes inside your room - keep screen doors closed at all times - don't use the bed as a couch - don't move any furniture - no snorkels in the pool - no, no, no, no! Lastly I would say its overpriced when compared to the cleanliness and quality of other resorts in the immediate area.

Reviews.Title: “Maui is Paradize!!!”
Reviews.Author: Mauied05
Reviews.Content: We arrived rather late, were tired and disapointed in our room at first...4th floor, Aloha Tower, outdated furniture, and no lanai. After a good nights rest, we had a better outlook on our room. We loved having a full kitchen (saved $ eating breakfasts, lunches, and 2 dinners) , the short walk to the beach, being close to Airport beach and Blackrock for snorkeling, and the resort pool was nice for taking dips in at night. We were married in Maui 4 years ago and stayed at the Royal Lahaina. We fell in love with the beach then (sandy, easy to swim in, not crowded, beautiful turquois blue) but wanted to stay at a condo this time around so that is why we chose the Kaanapali Villas (which is next door to Royal Lahaina). The pool was really nice and we enjoyed taking dips in the pool and jacuzzi at night. Blackrock and Whalers Village were a nice walk and not too far. I also enjoyed walking on the beachwalk early in the mornings. We wish our room was a little more dated (i.e. the tile was falling off in the kitchen, old bamboo furniture) but it was large, clean, quiet and met our needs. We were impressed that our maid had our room cleaned before 11am every day (before we came back for lunch). My husband appreciated that parking was really easy and that we never had problems finding a space. We ate at the restaurant one night and was surprised on how pricey it was. My ahi was pretty good though and the view was to die for. We will defininitely stay here again but may opt to stay in one of the 2 floor condos that have lanais. Maui is a special place to us and we'll be coming back for years to come!

Reviews.Title: “I will stay here again!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: cowboytx_1999
Reviews.Content: My son and I really liked Studio that we stayed in. We were there from May 29th till June 4th. It was so relaxing it was not your typical busy resort. The condo we were in was clean and could not have asked for better service from the front desk.

Reviews.Title: “Wow!”
Reviews.Author: Hiker1SantaFe_NM
Reviews.Content: I just got back from Maui. I stayed at the Kaanapali Villas based on the reviews in Trip Advisor. My stay was from May 22 -28. I loved it. When i checked in I got upgraded to a room with a kitchen, with the food prices on Maui this saved me a ton of money. I ate most of my meals in my room. The villas also have grills this really gave a summery feel to my vacation to be able to grill burgers and chicken. The room was VERY nice and was cleaned immaculately every day. TIP! Go to the Safeway in Lahaina and buy your food. I would absolutely recommend this place. I want to go back!!!! You'll also need a car.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: NinaLunaTella
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay in Maui, last time we stayed at the Sheraton, but this time we wanted to stay at a condo so we could have a full kitchen and cook our meals. We stayed in Maui Kaanapali Villas based on reviews from this website, and we are very pleased we chose it!!! location is excellent, since most of out plans for Maui were: 1.snorkeling; , 2. relaxing on the beach. We stayed in the building, on the 6th floor, so we had partial ocean view, and it took us 5 minutes to walk to the beach, and if you walk 5-10 minutes more to the north, there is an amazing reef with lots of creatures to see. The beach was never crowded (a plus for us). Although the main lobby and building look dated, inside our suite everything was nice, full nice kitchen, very good appliances, plasma tv, and there was no tub but there was a shower to die for, one of those 12" rainshowers. The only complain I would have about the room, is the size of the balconies, they are minimal and can't really be used. Staff was very friendly and helpful. Pool was nice too. If you want to walk to black rock, you can use the beach wak and you will be there in about 15 minutes. Overall, great, and for sure we will stay there again, hopefully soon!!

Reviews.Title: “This Condo is Big!!”
Reviews.Author: Wagolfingbuddy
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 days and 3 nights at the Aston Maui Kaanapali Villas, and the time went by way too fast. There is so much to do on Maui, and this resort was a wonderful home base for us. The beautiful beach was just steps away from our room. And that included walking past the wonderful pool and spa. They had a great kids pool for the small ones, and the large pool had some nice waterfall features. There was so much to do and enjoy, but the rooms were so large and nice that it would have been easy to have stayed there all day. We had 2 private bedrooms, kitchen and dining area and a large living room. TV's in both bedrooms and in the living room and free wireless internet were nice features. The kitchen was fully equiped and the condo nicely decorated. I believe that they are owned by private owners, so each one is different. I'm used to fairly small hotel rooms in Hawaii, and this was a wonderful change from that. The rooms were spacious and lots of space for a family to spread out, especially with small children. I would recommend this resort to anyone, but especially for families or couples travelling together.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel, but eat elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: Crowded_Minds
Reviews.Content: Great room, it felt very homey. I loved the bathroom with the double sink - I wish we had that in our own home! Nice pool & hot tub. The resturant was not so great though: it was overpriced and the quality was very low. Luckily the rooms come with a furnished kitchen, so it's easy to make your own meals (there is a Safeway close by) - or you can eat out at Whalers Village (Â½ an hour walk) or you can take the bus to the nearby Lahaina. Nice touch: Free shuttle bust service to Whalers Village where you have busconnections to other destinations.

Reviews.Title: “We had a wonderful week at a lovely resort with friendly accomodating staff.”
Reviews.Author: OMOKEEM
Reviews.Content: We loved the warm atmosphere of the resort. Joe at the front desk was attentive, friendly and has a great happy smile. Dawn was most helpful with planning our daily excursions. We stayed in Banyan 146 which was beautifully decorated - loved the updated furniture and the tiled floors! We slept like babies in a very comfortable bed and enjoyed watching the evening news on the flat screen television. We especially enjoyed sitting on the lanai which overlooks the beautifully landscaped grounds. The workout room and the laundry room were appreciated. The two pools were lovely - and no need to wake up early to "claim a chair". The location of this resort is great - the beautiful beach overlooks the islands of Molokai and Lana'i and it is within walking distance of Whaler's Village (although there is also a free trolley that runs throughout the day. We will definitely be returning!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Accomodations- A home away from home with great housekeeping!”
Reviews.Author: chefanneo
Reviews.Content: From our check-in to check-out, we loved staying in the Coconut villa. We enjoyed the relaxing lanais overlooking the beautiful gardens and pool area. The room was nicely decorated, with a huge bathroom/ dressing area and a fully functionable kitchen and well-stocked. The sofa bed could use a firmer mattress or more support, but if you are traveling with small children will be accomodating. Plenty of security and ample parking around resort. It was a home away from home, with great housekeeping service. We can't wait to return. The Beach in front of the Aston Maui Kaanapali Villas was very nice for swimming and snorkling (only in mornings, gets a little murky in afternoon), with a rental station for any water toy you could ask for. The Castaway Restaurant is delightful and convienently located with nice view of beach and sunset. Try the Mahi Mahi encrusted with black & yellow sesame seeds with the Pineapple Teriakyi Sauce. Breakfasts are great and fast. For a great morning coffee, Breakfast or Lunch that's inexpensive go to CJ's Deli and Diner up the Honoapiilani Hwy (Hwy 30) toward Lahaina about 2 miles in the Lahaina Civic Center. The location is a little further up from Lahaina Town, but there is plenty of public transportation. Avoid the Sugar Cane Train (expensive $22.50pp) to go to Pizza Hut in Lahaina. Car rental will be the best mode of transportation around Maui (especially for your trip to Hana). Mahalo

Reviews.Title: “All condos are not created equal”
Reviews.Author: geomon
Reviews.Content: First the good news - The grounds are beautiful, the pool is great, and the beach is spectacular. Now the bad news - In more that forty years of travel I've never encountered a more rude staff. It all started at checkin following a long flight from Florida. We had booked a garden view studio room through a tour agency. The lady at reception insisted that we take a unit on the top floor of the six story tower building and told us that all units were garden view or ocean view. She made us take the elevator up where we were shown a rather ratty looking one bedroom unit with a tiny two foot wide lanai. When we flatly refused this unit she next had us hike out to the far end of the property where we looked at a ground floor unit right next to the highway and the farthest unit from the beach in the whole place. It too had a skinny lanai not ten feet from the roadway. The complex appeared to be about half full at the time. Back at reception a third time my wife and I played 'good cop - bad cop' for a while and finally landed a very nice unit only steps from the pool and beach. Somewhere during the debate I asked to speak the to manager and got that old reply, 'He'll be in tomorrow.' The whole checkin routine took about an hour. Then, five days later came the checkout. I politely asked the guy behind the desk for a written receipt and he replied rather bruskly that since I had booked through a travel agent he wasn't going to give me one. Five tramatic minutes later I left empty handed. It's a shame that during these tough economic times some folks still don't get it. The problem here is simply a failure to communicate. The property managers, tour operators, travel agents, and condo owners don't seem to be coordinating their efforts and this causes a lot of confusion for travelers like us. The next time I book a condo unit anywhere I'll use VRBO 'Vacation Rentals by Owner' or some other website and contact the owner by e-mail and phone to make sure all bases are covered.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with the PERFECT beach!!”
Reviews.Author: EJMC
Reviews.Content: Definitely Maui no ka oi!! My husband, 2 daughters and I went for spring break recently...the whole vacation was GREAT! The room we got was just right for us. We weren't looking for the Ritz this vacation--just a homey place and we found it there. Big floor to ceiling windows, full kitchen, huge bathroom and lots of space to spread out at night! The location is perfect--close to Lahaina, down the road from Kapalua golf, not stuffy Wailea--and the most perfect beach: sunset right in front of you every night, Molokai and Lanai to the right and left, and just sand! There are other awesome beaches on the island but this one is "right there"! Joe checked us in and was so nice! He let us see 3 rooms to pick from and after a 13 hour trip, was just the kind of Hawaiian friend we needed to greet us. The rooms are owned and decorated by private owners but serviced by the hotel, so the decor might be a little 70's in some of the rooms. Our room was cleaned perfectly everyday! The pool was pretty big and the property itself was beautiful. The only 2 things that were not good about our stay were the pool being closed for 2 24hour periods because some little kid had an "accident" and the pool had to be shocked; and, the ONLY restaurant on property does not accept the "kids eat free" that is advertised by Aston! The waitress didn't tell us until they brought the bill, stating that they were a separate entity from the hotel! But we all loved Maui so as far as we are concerned it was all good! We would stay there again for sure! Just hope they get a pool policy for babies/little kids and either quit advertising kids eat free or work something out with the restaurant!

Reviews.Title: “cockroach!!!!”
Reviews.Author: elanette
Reviews.Content: were were there the middle of april. first we get in and was put ina decent studio only to wake up the following day with hammers banging next door. i called front desk and was told construction will last a week, that was the total length of our stay! i asked why we were put in that room if they knew construction will start the next day and they couldnt give me a straight answer. then they upgraded us to an ocean view room whihc would have been great but my 6 year old found a cockroach on the kitchen floor! i called reception again and was told that they are in the tropics and that cockroaches are common! front desk even said that presence of a cockroach " does not mean we are not clean"! duh!!!! i am a physician and i will be th e first one to refute that statement. cockroaches ARE the definite proof of uncleanliness!!!! they need to get their information straight before they open their mouths! then i asked to speak to a manager but never got a return call . i had to call again 2 days later to follow up on the call then they connected me to the manager who gave me all kinds of excuses why there is a cockroach, he even said ONE cockroach does not mean an infestation and that people were leaving their lanai doors open allowing the pest to get in. he even added that it is in sheraton and westin ,etc. i called up my friend who has been to maui for at least 20x and she told me that in her 20 visits to maui in different hotels she has NEVER, NEVER encountered a cockroach! the villa is very close to the beach but i think people are better off trying the other hotels in the kaanapali area where they will get better help and reception. housekeeping was very helpful but front desk sucks!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Kaanapali Villas - Fantastic Experience!!”
Reviews.Author: thekathyhale
Reviews.Content: Stayed there with a friend for my niece's wedding and it was the BEST vacation of my life. At the time I thought it was a one time deal, but after staying there, I will be back! The size of our room was amazing. The staff were very accomodating (they called in a massuese so that I could get a massage the morning after we arrived). The beach is beautiful and NOT overcrowded. The grounds were immaculate and colorful. EVERYONE was so very friendly and the environment was beautiful & peaceful. LOVED IT!!!

Reviews.Title: “great value....even better beach!”
Reviews.Author: gotfunit
Reviews.Content: maybe the room hasn't been updated in 30 years, but the beach right outside the door is timeless! we stayed here with my 6 and 2 yr old boys and it was perfect...well, it's not the hilton or anything, but if you stay on the ground floor (***highly recommended for young children***), leave the sliding doors open and let the kids run amuck on the lawn! you can't pay for that kind of a babysitter! take the kids to the beach, no need to pack anything because you can walk right back in less than 5 minutes, get them showered up easy. stash the groceries you bought in lahaina in the fridge and heat up last night's leftovers while the kids are getting changed....voila! now that's a vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Maui Kaanapali Villas - Mixed feelings”
Reviews.Author: cvmar
Reviews.Content: We rented unit 503 direct from an owner. The unit had a very nice kitchen and was very roomy. The carpet was old but clean and it had a nice view of the tree tops and some ocean view. If you went out on the lanai (only 2' deep) and looked right the ocean view was very nice. The issues our family had with the unit was a very old and dated bathroom, extremely hard beds and lots of noise from the highway. I was really surprised at how noisy it was with the sliding doors opened however we kept them open so we did not have to use the AC. More than once we were woken up from loud trucks, sirens or just loud cars in general. The property itself is very nice although older. The grounds are very well kept and everyone we encountered was very nice. This property has a much more laid back feel than further south where all the large Kaanapali resorts are located. The pool is very nice and the beach is beautiful. I much prefer this beach to the "main" Kaanapali beach. I would stay at this property again although in a unit further from the highway noise, if it had an been completely updated and had high quality hotel beds. To be fair the owners of this unit will be updating the entire unit in stages and if they do as nice a job as they did on the kitchen it will be a very nice unit.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful low-key complex with great beach!”
Reviews.Author: mamamoss
Reviews.Content: When planning our trip to Maui back in January, I researched and researched where to stay...I used tripadvisor, I asked friends, I finally went to a travel agent. She suggested the Kaanapali Villas (we wanted Kaanapali over Kihei). I checked out the reviews here and they were up and down...but mostly ok. We booked our 9 night stay in a 1 bedroom "garden view" for our March trip. When we arrived, check in was easy, quick and courteous. Our first impression of our room was good - it was clean, spacious, bright. Lots of room to spread out. There were 2 queen beds in the "bedroom" and then a pull out sofa in the living room (which was actually quite comfortable). The "bedroom" was more like an extension of the living room as there was one of those foldout "walls' that we just used to divide up the room, but it worked well and there was enough privacy. The kitchen was spotless and new. Well equipped for dishes/cutlery/pots/pans. I felt that it could've been better equipped for condiments, or have the abilty to pre-order these in small amounts. There was salt and pepper, and a small "starter kit" for tea/coffee and sugar - but these only had a couple of individual sugar packets, a couple of teabags and a single coffee packet. I dont' mind coffee/tea, but I felt sugar should've been provided, and possibly even things like butter, ketchup etc...things that you don't use very often but still would like/need if you're cooking etc. Our garden view was very nice - and we actually could see the ocean from our room. My other slight disappointment was that our lanai wasn't really a lanai...it wasn't large enough to put our chairs out there and sit. It was basically wide enough to stand on and that was it. Calling it a lanai was a stretch. However, because both the living room and the bedroom had very large sliding glass doors, it basically made the condo have one side completely open, we just slide our chairs so the front legs were on the "lanai" and the back legs were on carpet. The location is perfect - low key and away from the huge expensive resorts south of Black Rock, yet right on a perfect beach with great snorkeling *right* there. It was an easy drive down to south of Black Rock, or you could take the complimentary trolley that ran often. You could also walk to south Black Rock by using the paths through the neighbouring resorts (Royal Lahaina, Eldorado and Sheraton). There was also a great beach boardwalk that ran north of the condo. The main pool is wonderful...I understand they just renovated it and it's great. Has a neat bridge over it, with "waterfalls" and a nice shallow kids area (that for some reason was cooler than the main pool). The restaurant there - Castaway Cafe - was good. We had 2 dinners there and both meals were pretty good. Not outstanding, but fine. Breakfast was nice, particularly since we ate outside and had a great view of the ocean and whales! The Westin next door (I think it's a timeshare) had a nice little bar and grill that we walked to as well to eat. The grounds were immaculate. Lovely lawns and gardens. Every morning there was staff out cleaning up fallen leaves or flowers. I thought it was lovely, particularly after reading a review or two here saying that it needed some TLC. Not anymore! I found the whole complex great. I would definitely recommend this place to stay...it's low key, good price, good beach/snorkeling, good base for exploring Maui!

Reviews.Title: “Hidden treasure”
Reviews.Author: godswill2005
Reviews.Content: Hotel is on the best beach in Maui. Rooms are great, everything you need, full kitchen. Castaway Cafe is a great place to eat on site, and ocean side. Luau next door is great no need to drive. Scuba from hotel is amazing. Been here 6 times, will never stay another place on Maui...it is perfect

Reviews.Title: “Basic Beachfront Condo”
Reviews.Author: globetrotter627
Reviews.Content: Stayed two nights in a ground floor studio apt Room was clean and appears to have been redecorated with granite countertops and new cabinets within the last 5 years. All appliances and cookware were there. Direct beach access and very close to Black Rock, a nice snorkelling site. Buildings are older than other condo resorts in area, and are very basic beige/brown in color. Grounds are decorated. Pool is decorative, not huge like some resorts but bigger than your average hotel pool. Small toddler area, bridge over pool and whirlpool area. Crowd is typically older, with short term guests younger. Though people are generally very quiet, can hear blender and chairs moving from condo above and hear people from outside. $12.50 resort fee per day is added on per room

Reviews.Title: “O.K. If you pick the right room.”
Reviews.Author: EdmontonFritz
Reviews.Content: Stayed 13 nights in Suite 108, a two bedroom-2bath unit very close to reception. The unit was generally very nice ,but not as clean as it could be, and being from a cold weather climate we don't ever see cockroaches...well we had more than our share of these little critters, which really really bothered at least 2 of our party of 4. Apparently they spray every 3 months, so you could be lucky and show up at a good time after a recent spraying or have to deal with the opposite situation when they have re-populated the grounds. The resorts beachfront location is perfect and on the NOT AS BUSY North Kaanapali Beach. The pools and grounds are also really nice as is the beachfront Castaway Restaurant. We booked our suite through Kaanapali Beach Rentals, but have since seen more and better suites on VRBO. YOU JUST NEED TO PICK THE RIGHT UNIT! and this place would be really good.

Reviews.Title: “Nice grounds, laid back, could use renovation”
Reviews.Author: mcguires54
Reviews.Content: We stayed 12/26- 12/30. The location is good, grounds are nice. Nothing fancy but a laid back feel. Got take out fromt the restaurant one night which was decent. The staff is nice and the shop on grounds is really helpful. There is a spa for massage, although we didn't have time. Used the Gym once which was fine. Our room was a one bedroom garden view. The balcony is small, and the place is in need of renovation. Each unit is owned by individual owners, so I am sure it is hit or miss. Overall a nice place, but our unit was not in hotel shape. The beach is small but nice. Water is a bit cold this time of year. The price is right.

Reviews.Title: “Little piece of paradise except...”
Reviews.Author: bahamamama37
Reviews.Content: Our stay was lovely at the Kaanapali Villas. The front desk staff was exceptional. Very friendly and efficient. The condos were great - fully furnished and spacious. We encountered one little (or not so little) problem though. Our party comprised of 3 African-American ladies. When we went to the on-site gift shop (can't quite recall the name - I think one stop store or something like that), the clerk did not stop following us the entire time. She would hang around us and preety much "stalked" us. She would pretend to take some inventory with a pen and clip board but she was actually hovering around us. At one point she just stood and stared directly watching us from a close distance. We chose not to confront her as we were having a stress free vacation and did not want to let anything ruin this. She was cold to us at the register. I would like her to know that we are all professionals and would not pay thousands of dollars and travel thousands of miles to come and steal small items at a gift store. Needless to say, we did not purchase any gifts or souvenirs from this particular store (though we got some icecream). I would be cautious about whom I recommend this hotel to based on this incident. Otherwise, we had an excellent stay.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Staff!!”
Reviews.Author: TravellinDad909799
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights at the end of October, and this property far exceeded my expectations. The location is fantastic, right on the beach and a short drive to Kaanapali or Lahaina. Plus there is a shuttle bus that stops right in front of the lobby. The pool was beautiful, and onsite restaurant not only let you hear the surf while you ate outside, the food was great! Fresh Mahi Mahi was excellent. Gwen at the front desk really made our trip. She went out of her way to make our stay enjoyable, and for that we will definately return next time we are in Maui. Condos are just condos, its the people working there that make the difference.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Surprized”
Reviews.Author: coldinmilehi
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed Sept 27th thru Oct 3rd. The grounds are beautifully maintained and manicured. Our "condo" was older but in great shape. The Front Desk staff was pleasant and approachable. The pools and jacuzzi were clean and "kid" free most of the time. I had a spa treatment on site which was amazing!!!The only downside was the on site "Castaway" resturaunt. The food was mediocre and overpriced. We walked down the beach ( it was a 20 minute walk ) and found the "Hula Grill" which was excellent. I also recommend the Old Lahaina Luau. Worth the cost. Overall, we plan on returning in 2010. I was worried when I read the mixed reviews prior to our trip but was prepared for the worst! Thank goodness we weren't too disappointed!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location in Maui”
Reviews.Author: BchBumm
Reviews.Content: Maui Kaanapali Villas is a great value in a great location. We were pleasantly surprised with the overall experience. The beach area was beautiful and quite private compared to the public beach area at the Sheraton. A short walk to the north for great snorkeling at a reef right off of shore. Here you will see lots of tropical fish, and maybe even a sea turtle. A quick complimentary trolley ride to the Sheraton will also allow you to snorkel at Black Rock. The pool area was very well kept, and never crowded. In my opinion much better than the larger resorts where it is difficult to even get a pool chair.

Reviews.Title: “Nice condo, service needs help”
Reviews.Author: capperCalifornia
Reviews.Content: Overall our 1 week stay in condo with Garden (pool) view was OK. But we had two issues I should point out. (1) We purchased (3) cardboard and insulation type coolers at Costco. We left 2 of them out and the maid service either threw them away, or took them for themselves. We discovered this in the early morning as we prepared to do the road trip to Hana. They were brand new, and we were surprised. We called the desk to let them know, then expected some sort of reimbursement. I spoke to the maid and she said she did not see them when she did towel service that day, so I replied that it must have been the day before then? She was silent. When we checked out I relayed the details to the manager and asked how he would handle this. He repeated what the maid said with blank eyes. I was disappointed they charge $13 a day for facilities fee, but can't credit us $10 for the coolers they took, not to mention our time spent buying another cooler for our trip to Hana. (2) The microwave stopped working, various kitchen items were not present. Other than that is was OK for a budget condo. But left a bad taste in my mouth and we will look elsewhere next year in Maui.

Reviews.Title: “Our first trip to Maui and it was amazing!”
Reviews.Author: pattic76
Reviews.Content: My mom, my 8 year-old daughter, and I stayed for a week at the Kaanapali Villas and loved it there. We stayed in a studio with a garden view and it was very roomy and comfortable. Everything about our trip was so nice and we definitely plan to go back. I'm not sure if it is the time of year or what, but the beach in front of the resort is very nice but we didn't actually get in the water because of the strong undertow as you get in. I think we would have been fine once we got past it since I saw several other people in the water having fun and snorkeling, but I wanted my daughter to feel comfortable getting in and out of the water, so we drove just a short drive to Baby Beach and it was perfect for us to play and swim and snorkel in the water. I don't have anything else to compare our resort to, but I really enjoyed it there. Everyone was friendly, the grounds are beautiful, there are 2 nice pools, and the Castaway Cafe restaurant had great food at a reasonable price and a great view of the ocean. The sunsets on the beach in the evenings are one of my favorite memories of our trip. I would recommend Kaanapali Villas to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and Simple”
Reviews.Author: CaliforniaMark
Reviews.Content: My family stayed at the villas from September 3rd thru 9th. We have two children ages two and five. The grounds are very clean and decorted with typical trees and flowers of the area. Checking in we were upgraded from a partial ocean view to a full ocean view room. In most resort the full ocean view would still only be considered a partial ocean view. We stayed in the Emerald wing of the condos. The pool is nice and is good for small children since it includes a shallow kids area. The resort was very quiet in both the day and night. All the condos are independly owned so decorations go from very nice to very simple. The house cleaning staff was awesome the ladys did a wonderful job. There is a local grocery store just north of the resort that is maybe a five minute drive good place to get grocerys. The beach is awesome that is located at the resort. The beach is nice and clean. The resort charges a resort fee which really isnt worth the money but you dont have much of a choice. I would stay here again but if Im sure I could find a nicer hotel for just a little bit more money.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Experience!”
Reviews.Author: tonybLosAngeles
Reviews.Content: My family (two adults and two young kids ages 4 and 2) and my extended family (4 adults) stayed at the ResortQuest Maui Kaanapali Villas 8/6 through 8/11. I had found this location through trip advisor. Thanks to all of those who helped me with enough information to select this location. Our initial request was for two studio condo's with a garden view. We also had asked for our condo's to be next to one another. I had read a few frightening stories about the rooms and braced myself upon check in. To my surprise we ended getting two rooms in the main bldg (aloha tower) #601 and #602 . We asked the gentlemen at the front desk if we could see the rooms first, before checking in and they were okay with it. The two units appeared to be remodeled. In fact, they were one bedrooms. These rooms could definitely accomodate a party of 6-8 comfortably. Both units were very clean. Someone came to clean the room everyday in the afternoon. There is a nice size pool next to the restaurant Castaway, which has a kid pool (1 1/2 feet of water). Connected to the kid pool is a larger pool, which gets to about 7 feet of water. There is also an adult pool on the other side of the Aloha Tower which is nice, quiet, and private. The beach is very close and very scenic. It's also a short walk from the Westin.
