We took advantage of the full kitchen, by purchasing groceries from the Safeway. Out of the 5 nights on our stay, we ate breakfast and lunch in our room 4 days. Some items were a bit more expensive than being on the mainland, but we were prepared for this. Safeway is also affiliated with Von's, therefore you can use your Vons card or telephone number to get items at the member rate. We took the free Kaanapali shuttle to Whaler's Village for some shopping and souvenirs. My younger brother took some surfing lessons, and went parasailing. Both experiences were pretty exciting for him. I can't remember the name of the guys or company which provided the surf lessons, but i can find out for those who are interested. Thanks to a work colleauge I found this small private beach, called Baby Beach. A lot of local folks are familiar with this place. The cool thing about this beach is that the water isn't too rough and kids (with adult supervision) can feel comfortable entering the water. FYI this beach isn't just for kids. There were a few families and couples enjoying there time as well. Ask Gwen at the front desk for directions. I would definitely stay at this place again! A couple of things to note. The policy on pool towels may be a bit confusing at first. Just bring them back to front desk at the end of each day, and request new ones. Sometimes service can be a little bit slow, when requesting anything from the front desk. But it's okay, we were never in a rush. Front Street has a lot of shops, and restaurants to visit as well. I was able to order cocktails from Castaway and take them to the pool..just ask for them to be made in a plastic cup. Aloha..

Reviews.Title: “Not Near What It's Rated”
Reviews.Author: TimeZonePilot
Reviews.Content: We booked an "Ocean View" in this supposed "3-Star Resort" on Hotwire.com which we didn't get. We booked blindly not knowing what hotel we would get until we paid our money (that's the way they do it). When we arrived we were hit with a surprise $12 a night "facility" fee over and above the $142 a night we were already paying for this 2-star room. Worse yet we found a $99 a night room at a true 3-star hotel in beautiful Wailua while we were there. When we checked in we got a small room out in the back 40 with a view of a parking lot and a tool shed. Instead of the lapping waves of the surf we had a major highway sharing noise with us all night long. We had a very hard bed that you could feel every spring in and sheets that felt like sand paper - definitely not 3-star quality. It had a coffee maker listed in the amenities and you get coffee with it for the first day only. You are then told rudely that it is for the first day only and you have to buy it after that (unless you raise a stink). The staff was adequate at best. They would answer questions if asked but offered no additional assistance or suggestions. The grounds were well kept but the beach showers didn't work. Parking was always difficult to find. At 30% less this place might have been worth the money spent. But not at what we paid. Find someplace else.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Value and Great Vacation”
Reviews.Author: Dana-Mama
Reviews.Content: Our family stayed at the Kaanapali Villas for our family re-union in July. There are four families with a total of 9 adults and 5 kids. We choose Kaanapali Villas due to a great rate we found on Tripadvisor plus the fridge and kitchen in the rooms. We booked a total of 4 garden view studios. Two days before our vacation, I faxed a room request to the property asking for rooms that are newly renovated and closed to each other. All if our requests were met and the management upgraded all of us to Ocean View. Checkin was great, Ms Gwen at the front desk was friendly and informative. The studios were very clean and well kept, the furnitures are good for a beach resort. The maid service was execellent and she left us extra towels for the pool/beach each day. The kitchen was execellent for light breakfast s, reheating leftovers and keeping our drinks cold. There are WiFi service, the reception is usually very good if you leave the balcony doors open a slight crack, this instruction was printed in the check in brochure. The newly renovated pool was a hit with our kids ranging from 13 yo to 7 yo. The beach is exceptional , it is right next to the pool and we just love watching the sunset on the beach. The Castaway resturant was very good, the price is very reasonable compare to other eateries around Lahaina. There is a small exercise room onsite, it is functioning and meet the needs but why exercise in a room when you have the whole beach available to you. The laundry room has plenty of washers and dryers and it is never busy. There is an activity desk in the lobby of the resort, I got a quote for tickets tfor a snorkel tour to Molokini and Turtle Town plus surfing lesson for my daughter from them it is much higher than buying the tickets from Activity Warehouse or Boss Frog. Get one of the tourist magazine, lookup the phone and call for your tickets. Stephen at Boss Frog actually gave me his cell # and told me to call him if we need anything or directions. He will even deliver gas to us if we ran out of gas anywhere in Maui. Activity Warehouse offered me $150.00 off our snorkel tour if we take a timeshare presentation, we just said no - no hard sell at all. Both of these vendors are very reliable. This is a older resort, but the grounds are well kept and it retains the charm of what Hawaii used to be. If you are looking for a 5 Stars hotel, you should stay in Grand Wailea. If you just want a reasonable rate hotel with clean room with a beautiful beach, this is the resort for you. After my return, the resort's management actually send me an email to ensure we are OK. I mentioned about the printer issue with the paid computer system in the lobby, it was eventually resolved by the hotel IT contractor. But the hotel management send me an email apologizing profusely for my inconvenience. This proofs to me the hotel mamangement actually cares about their guest and their experience.

Reviews.Title: “Alright place”
Reviews.Author: laotzu_ching
Reviews.Content: The hotel was expensive for the service it provided. No internet in the room, extra charge per day for work out room whether you use it or not (10$ and it is not included in your price). The room was nice and spacious, it has fridge, microwave, dvd player, nice access to the beach. I would stay here again if I didn't find anything cheaper. Not worth the money overall. But then it may be hard to find something reasonable at Maui.

Reviews.Title: “Satisfaction guaranteed!!”
Reviews.Author: RT75
Reviews.Content: Ask for room 232 when booking!!! looks brand new and unused, very quiet, spacious, full kitchen, big bathroom, we couldn't ask for more!! Perfect for relaxing. No ocean view, but you can solve this with a very short walk to the beach front. The Resort amenities are great, very nice pool and beach area, the breakfast was good but a little pricey (and not included on room rate - we suggest you to do your own breakfast in the room, there is a 24h supermarket nearby, and the room has all the tools you'll need). 5 minutes drive from Lahaina downtowm, full of restaurants and nice shops. Maui is beautiful, stay there for a week or more to have enough time to see the whole island. Just pay attention to where you park your car inside the resort, one side of the road is a non-parking zone, and the signs are very small on short posts, almost got a ticket.

Reviews.Title: “Gone to Maui and Happy”
Reviews.Author: D728
Reviews.Content: Maui Kaanapali Villas was a great getaway weekender from Oahu. The hotel is situated in the center of West Maui with a 5 min drive to Kapalua and the Ritz one way, and Front street, Lahaina 5 min the other way. I found the room we had to be large and personalized as these are private condo units with fully supplied kitchens (pots pans ect.) and the personal touches of the individual owners. Parking was close to our room and included in the resort fee. Check in was quick and easy and done with much Aloha. The stretch of beach in front of the hotel was great for everyone. There is a small store in the lobby that was great for small necessities and a 24 hr Star market a mile up the road for a full shopping run. Overall I was very satisfied with the amenities, Location, and service at check in and would recommend this hotel to others looking for this type of condotel on the Beach in Maui.

Reviews.Title: “Loved It All”
Reviews.Author: cocoBritishColumbia
Reviews.Content: We stayed in unit 218 in the towers from May 24th to May 31st and loved it. The kitchen and bathroom were very nicely redone and we had a large lanai. The rooms above the second floor have very small lanais so we were lucky. We travelled to Maui to attend a wedding. The other wedding guests were in the Kaanapali Shores which they liked but we booked late and couldn't get into the Shores and we're glad that we couldn't. Our resort was quainter, friendlier and had a far better beach. The people staying at the Shores were coming to snorkel and swim with us. We liked the Villas so much that we're already planning our next trip for two weeks in October.

Reviews.Title: “Checked out after first night”
Reviews.Author: BL24
Reviews.Content: My wife and I elected to stay here since we were able to get a great Entertainment card rate. We were a bit apprehensive due to a few negative reviews, but decided to give it a shot. because when we spoke with the reservations personnel, they told us the hotel rooms had been recently renovated. When we checked in, they assigned us to roon #182 and said it was a good room due to it's proximity to the beach and ocean. I believe they even told us it had an oceanview. When we walked in, we immediately were disappointed. It smelled funny and was anything but recently renovated. The furnishings were worn, the comforter had a burn hole in it , and the sink area was literally swarming with little ant-like bugs. Sure, it's tropical and bugs are to be expected, but this was my 5th time to the islands and I've never seen a bug problem like this. The room was large but had no view of the ocean although you could see it from the lanai. We went back to the front desk and asked for a room that was in better shape or recently renovated and they gave us a couple options in the tower, but their definition of recent renovations must mean adding a new countertop in the bathroom at most or renovations that took place at least 10 years ago. Seriously. We didn't like these other rooms so they offered to show us a studio condo. We actually liked the one we were shown but didn't want to pay an extra $40/nt. So, we decided last minute to check out other properties nearby and were able to find a great unit at Kaanapali Shores for the same price as the Villas condo and actually was completely renovated, fresh & clean not to mention bug free! The Kaanapali Villas tries hard, has a nice beach and decent pool, but will probably appeal to the budget minded traveler only.

Reviews.Title: “Strong Concerns”
Reviews.Author: mdavis415
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice resort. Amazing views everywhere. Not impressed with the customer service at all. Will never stay here again. My room was charged with damage that we did not even do. This was charged a week after our return home. When we asked for proof of damage and we were denied any such proof by the resort. Our air condition was broken almost the entire trip and was never fixed by maintenance. Instead we were given a fan. The food was great, the views were amazing. The hidden costs and bad customer service will absolutely hinder me from ever staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved It!”
Reviews.Author: beachbum_40Burnaby
Reviews.Content: I absolutely loved this resort. Staff were helpful and friendly, the resort was very lush and beautiful. Our room was on the 2nd floor of the Aloha Tower and the rooms on this floor had a much bigger lanai than the other floors. The bathroom was huge and our "Garden View" had lit tiki torches to look at at night. The food at the Castaway Cafe was excellent and reasonably priced. The beach was absolutely beautiful with great snorkelling a few minutes' walk down the beach. No complaints at all and would return to this resort in a second (just need the money now!).

Reviews.Title: “Very short stay”
Reviews.Author: Bear61
Reviews.Content: I had booked this hotel in Nov. '07 for a 5/20 - 5/29/08 stay. I had booked an ocean view room. Upon arrival, we we given a room on the 6th floor on the highway side of the tower. It was extremely noisy with minimal ocean view (certainly not like the pictures advertised). We were willing to move to another room for the remainder of the stay, however, we could not ever talk to the manager to agree to move us. The front desk staff was sympathetic and tried their best, but every time we came back when the manager was supposed to be available, he had found other things to do and we'd be told to come back in another hour. After a full morning of this, the manager told one of the desk people to try their sister property down the road and see if they had an ocean view avail. - they did not. The best the hotel could offer was a move to another room in 4 days. We declined and the desk person told us that if we wanted to go elsewhere, they'd cancel the rest of our stay and refund the balance of our deposit. We jumped at the chance and found the Mahina Surf. I was not happy about the room after booking so far in advance and not happy with a manager who couldn't be bothered with our problem and hid behind a door while letting his staff deal with a customer who was wasting the first day of their vacation waiting for him in their lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Great place, reasonable prices”
Reviews.Author: clocksoup
Reviews.Content: Very comfortable studio condo accommodations with a large patio and kitchen. We were worried about staying here because you never really know what you are getting with a condo, but the unit was clean, spacious and comfortable and it was great to have a kitchen to save some $$ on food. New pools were great and a free shuttle stops right in front of the property. Castaways restaurant right next to the pool is awesome -- what a nice surprise and not overpriced. This is the best priced lodging on the beach in Maui.

Reviews.Title: “Direct from Owner - A wonderfun condo at a very wonderful Maui resort”
Reviews.Author: Chujo
Reviews.Content: This was our 2nd trip to Maui. The 1st time our daughter-in-law made all the arrangements. But because our Son and his wife asked us to accompany them we went with their selections. This trip we took our friemds with us and I did all the reservations and I could not have done better. I found Napil Bay #116 on The internet. I called the owner and she was very friendly and courteous. We rented Napil Bay #116 from April 5th to the 11th of April. What a wonderful unit to relax, and enjoy the wonderful scenery and surrounding of the Kaanapali area. We loved the unit and view. The unit had everything that a person needs to spend all the time they want in the unit or all the comfort needed just to sleep and shower there. We did both. we spent time lounging in the unit betweenour activities and it was just a wonderful peaceful unit to gather together and plan our next attack on the island. The layout of the unit with the sliding door to close the bedroom off to the rest of the unit was a plus, and the interior decorations were very comforting and made you wish you could stay forever. I would definitely rent Napil Bay #116 again and again if I could go to Maui as often as I would like. We definitely will be returning to this unit again. We may take our daughter and her husband as they will be celebrating their 25th anniversary later this year. The owners were a pleasure to work with and I almost feel like I have known them all my life after just this one experience. Keep up the good work Gail and Jim. We loved your place. The Warner's and the Frey's.

Reviews.Title: “Better than first impression”
Reviews.Author: bebender
Reviews.Content: I just want to say that my first impression of my condominium at KV was not great; however, my stay was fantastic. I don't think I could have had a better stay with my family (4) and my parents (elderly) than I did. The beach in front of the villas is beautiful and we got up every morning just to enjoy the early morning on the quiet beach. There is great snorkeling with just a walk into the beach. This was an incredible value - and I would definitely stay here again - don't expect perfection in the rooms - but they are definitely spacious and the grounds are spectacular. All of the activities of Lahaina and Kaanapali are nearby and my parents could enjoy themselves as well as my teenagers. If you are looking for a brand new room - don't go here - but if you are looking for a beautiful value - try it out.

Reviews.Title: “The BEST!”
Reviews.Author: ibelonginmaui
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Maui, though we went with other family members who had been before. All of us found nothing but perfection with the Kaanapali Villas. The rooms were huge, clean, and well cared for. The staff was excellent and the property was second to none for beauty, convenience, and location. Right on a gorgeous beach, yet well cared for grounds and a great pool. Castaways was a great place to eat - family friendly and good prices. The whale watching from Castaways, the grounds or the beach was incredible. We can't wait to go again next year!

Reviews.Title: “Best spot for under $350 / night in Lahainna”
Reviews.Author: ganooze
Reviews.Content: Heard from others that this is a great value, but it is more than that. Beautiful scenery and great rooms. Renovations havemade this place the best deal in Lahainna. highly recommend

Reviews.Title: “Good, but not for first timers”
Reviews.Author: conllee
Reviews.Content: I would not go here if it was your first trip to Maui or wanted to be pampered and were just using the room as a place to sleep. The outside of the buildings are very dated and kind of dingy. We went with a group, and the units do differ a lot. We were lucky to get a unit that the owner had done a fantastic job on and would go back again. Unit 230 in the Banyan building. Free trolly to Whalers village where you can catch a bus, #25 , to Lahaina for a buck. If you like walking, you can walk to Whalers village along the beach. Just follow to Black Rock and cut through the Shereton. Nice beach, great view of Lanai sunsets. If you've been to Maui before and done all the tourist stuff and just want to stretch out for a week and take it easy, this is the place (as long as you get a good unit). Our kitchen was fully equipped with plates, glasses, pots etc. All units and grounds are non-smoking, but they do have smoking areas were you meet and get to know the nicest people from all over.

Reviews.Title: “Great little place on perfect beach!!”
Reviews.Author: jesibel
Reviews.Content: I booked my condo through VRBO and was very happy with it. My room was Banyan 130 and it was very nice, clean, roomy and so easy to come and go from. It was a corner unit on the bottom and I never used my actual door, I just came and went through the sliding glass doors which made it feel like home. All units are decorated different so make sure you get some pics of your unit but all are roomy and seem to be nice. The beach in front of condo's is perfect, and I went all over the island, and it can't be beat. Make sure you go down towards to the new Westin to Snorkel, it was terrific and just off the beach! You can walk to the more well known Kaanapali beach with all the high rises. Great walk along our beach, go through the Sherton parking lot and there you are, so convienent and easy, loved it. I ate at Castaway twice, it was good but there are so many other places to eat like BJ's Pizza in Lahaina, YUM! Also Breakfast at Seahouse on Napili was nice. Gotta do lunch and dinner at Hula Grill and Lelani's everything is good and reasonably priced there. I drove around a lot and it a perfect locaiton from Napili/Kahana/Kapalula area as well as Lahaina. Make sure you take the great lower highway to Kahana, fun scenic drive. There is a wonderful farmer's market open each AM just before Kahana that has GREAT local fruit, bagels, breads, avacodo's etc, gotta check it out. I loved it so much I will be back for sure!! BTW, the new pool is done and it very nice but never used it b/c the beach is MUCH better.

Reviews.Title: “BEWARE! Not up to Maui standards”
Reviews.Author: ctripinfo
Reviews.Content: If you don't mind staying at a low end Hotel for the Money you could still probably find a better deal somewhere else. The rooms (or most to my knowledge) are privately owned. In most cases this is common in Maui. The problem is that each owner designs their condo to their own taste. In our case this meant everying including kitchen and bathroom fixtures. This is evident when you walk around the resort at night and can see inside some of the condos' from the outside; and there lies the reason why some reviews are favorable and some are not. Some rooms are good and in our case horrible. The outside of the resort, OUTDATED. Problems with our room- kitchen that was hip in the 80's, bathroom that Jack tripper would have loved, clogged tub, dirty tile floor, broken fixtures, scary smoke detector, insects (not the cute kind), dirty stains on carpet (which showed up in photos), television with bad reception, far North Kaanapali location (although they do have a bus that will take you to the main Kaanapali hotels so you can catch thier bus to Lahina). Get the picture, we only stayed one night. This is not what you pay for when you travel to Hawaii. On the plus side the beach is beautiful.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: zippycatArkansas
Reviews.Content: Maui Kaanapali Villas was awesome! Joe was the" best " @ the front desk. The location was perfect on Kaanapali Beach it was quite, yet close to plenty of activities. The resort was undergoing renovations on the grounds. Will stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Love Old Hawaiian Style”
Reviews.Author: mauimama07
Reviews.Content: Just returned (this evening) from the Kaanapali Villas. This was are third stay here in the last 4 years. We love the old Hawaiian feel of this place. It is very simple, with low rise buildings and very friendly staff. Because of the pool renovation they wanted to move us to their sister property "The Shores" up the road, but we insisted on staying at the Villas because of the proximity to the beach and to the main Kaanapali Beach Walk. I have to admit, the room (a one bedroom) is in dire need of updating. It had 1980's decor. It was comfortable with actually 1 and 1/2 baths. We were only in the room to sleep, so the decor was really no big deal. The beach access is fantastic and the Castaway Cafe is always a favorite (except this trip they had a problem with Pineapple bugs). The pool is almost ready, but we didn't miss it since the beach is where we hang out. We love the beach at MKV, although it is amazing how many more people are on it since now the Westin is next door. Four years ago there was no one on the beach when you looked north. But now with the Westin Villas there are huge crowds up that direction. The MKV seems to be immuned to it, since their property is about 1/10th the size as the Westin. This is one of the reasons why we love MKV so much. There are not hords of people. One disappointment was Christmas dinner, the Villas recommended the Royal Lahania next door. The service was the worst I've ever encountered and for a meal that cost $200 for 4 people, it should have been primo. I don't know if they were short staffed or what. Our server acted like he had never waited on a table in his life... it was pathetic. We should have left. All in all we had a wonderful time at the Villas ( and three days prior at Napili). We hope that with all the new building going on (the Westin Villas, Lahania Villas and another high-rise up toward Kahana) that MKV will not loose it's true Hawaiian spirit. We love MKV and hope to return soon.

Reviews.Title: “Not recommended”
Reviews.Author: Genesmasher
Reviews.Content: "Kaanapali Villas" is an old resort that is in bad need of renovation. If, in spite of this review, you do decide to rent one of the condos here, at least make sure to stay away from the ground-floor units. We had a misfortune to rent one of these (vrbo.com listing #114186, unit #109), and while the owner furnished it reasonably well, the lack of natural light, noticable "moldy" smell (one of us had a asthma flare up) and showers with major draining issues forced us to move to an adjacent hotel after only two nights. Our unit's lanai had a view of the main property driveway, and the entire hotel really has no grounds to speak of. The owner also failed to mention that the only large pool on the property was closed and being rebuilt. To make things worse, it is practically impossible to avoid the construction area on your way to the beach. All in all, this was not an experience we were looking for during our first ever trip to Hawaii. Fortunately, there were rooms available at the wonderful Sheraton resort just half-a-mile away, which proved to be a night-and-day improvement over Kaanapali Villas, at a slight premium in rate. Basically, the only advantage Kaanapali Villas has is a kitchen in the condo - you decide if this is the most important thing for you in Hawaii.

Reviews.Title: “We had a great honeymoon!”
Reviews.Author: robsons310
Reviews.Content: When booking our honeymoon, we knew we wanted a place with a private beach, and access to local activities/entertainment. We booked the Maui Kaanapali Villas based on internet reviews (and pictures) and it met--and exceeded--our expectations. We stayed in room 616 (in the Aloha Tower), which was a one-bedroom studio with a kitchen and ocean view. The kitchen and bathroom were nicely upgraded (new cabinetry, full-size refrigerator, new oven, stove, and dishwasher), but the bedroom area was a little more modest. Also, the lanai off the room was just big enough to stand on. I had envisioned a larger outdoor patio, which some units have, but ours was small. It really didn't matter, but if that matters to you, you might want to call and request a room with a larger patio. Everything was clean and the staff was wonderful (extremely friendly). The beach in front of the property is by far one of the high points of this hotel. It is gorgeous, and quiet, with some of the best snorkeling reefs in West Maui! They also have a restaurant on the property, "The Castaway Cafe" which is located right on the ocean, and was extremely convenient. We ate many meals there (in the restaurant overlooking the ocean, and to-go to our room)... the prices are low and the food was delicious (plus, happy hour $1.50 draft beer!). While we were there, the main pools (on the beach, next to the cafe) were being completely renovated. If we had kids, that would have been a disappointment, since the other pool is not overlooking the ocean (and it's smaller). But, when they are completed, they will be a huge asset to the property. A trolley runs (for free!) from the Villas to surrounding hotels and the nearby Whaler's Village. Lahaina is only a couple miles away, which we loved (took a sunset cruise from there). The hotel also has a travel corrdinator which was extremely helpful when booking activities. We received discounts at a local spa for 90 minute massages, tips on helicopter tours (which I HIGHLY recommend), and driving to Hana. We will definitely return to Maui Kaanapali Villas, it was great. If you really love having valet parking, a bellman, and an elaborate lobby, this hotel isn't for you. If you want a place on a beautiful beach, with local access to restaurants, shopping, golf, etc. for a lower price (less than the $500+ night nextdoor hotels), consider the Kaanapali Villas. We loved it there.

Reviews.Title: “We liked it, it was as expected”
Reviews.Author: ToandLo
Reviews.Content: After having a horrible trip 2 years ago on Oahu, Wakiki Beach, I have to say we were very pleased with our stay on Maui and our condo at the Villas. We were in condo 601, with a garden view and a partial view of the ocean. The condo was almost too big for us but the most important part, it was very, very clean. After reading the past three reviews, I have to say I did enough reasearch that I knew what to expect at the Kaanapali Villas. There are plenty of condos to choose from including some with a balconey and an ocean view. We also knew that the pools were under construction but we didn't need it with Kaanapali Beach a few steps away. Also, there is so much to do and see on Maui that we basically only showered and slept in the condo. We had a kitchen but I cook enough at home, I don't need to cook on vacation. However, for a family with children the kitchen is a great feature. They provided us with towels for the beach everyday. We just traded the wet ones for fresh ones in the lobby. Yes, the store is expensive as it is in any hotel. If you have a rental car just drive down the street to Longs Drugs or Safeway. We did have a few issues. There were no coffee filters or dishwashing soap so we had to request those items and they were promptly delivered. The restaurant (which is not owned by the same company that runs the complex) is not worth it. The food is "so-so" and the prices are too high for what they are serving. Again, we drove down the road and found some great places to eat. They did charge us a $10.00 a day resort fee (we have never paid before with any vacation) which I found to be ridiculous. That I was not aware of and as a result, I rated the Kaanapali Villas "average". Otherwise our stay was great. You get what you pay for. I am surprised at some of the requests of other guests. The Kaanapail Villas, are condos. Don't stay there if you want all the luxuries of a five star hotel. If you are people like us who are very active and rarely spend an entire day in the room, the Villas are a quiet, clean place to shower and sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Europeans watch out - Flats not villas”
Reviews.Author: davidfthorn
Reviews.Content: We made a big mistake in booking this location for a week in Maui. To English people a villa means " a detached or semi-detached small house", so we thought that we would be staying in a villa. Far from it these are condominium's (or as we know them in England - flats). The flat we had was well passed its "sell by date". Had a balcony 2 feet wide (seriously there was no way you could use it) and the view to the sea was obstructed by trees. Overall, very disappointing to travel half way around the world and to be deceived by this misnomer.

Reviews.Title: “Not my favorite Maui spot”
Reviews.Author: twocombs
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the villa's for 9 days....what a huge disappointment. we only found out that the pools would be under construction a few days before we arrived. We booked a studio garden view and the room was OK nothing special, we had no lanai just a 12 inch balcony. The front desk staff were very unfriendly rude at times. I will never stay there again we always felt uncomfortable when we were on the property. One good thing is the snorkling down the beach in front of the Westin it was the best. A from Fresno Ca

Reviews.Title: “Rip Off”
Reviews.Author: zxt
Reviews.Content: Rooms are average, service is so-so and a hidden 10 dollar/per day "facilities" fee is a joke. Internet connection is terrible if you have a wifi laptop. Gift store charges 10 dollars for a box of coco puffs. One day I cut my foot pretty bad on a reef near H-bay and asked for a band aid to cover the wound when I got back tot he hotel - they said they were all out and suggested I buy a box of them from their gift store instead. Classy.

Reviews.Title: “The seniors scene.......”
Reviews.Author: JDellson
Reviews.Content: We had visited this propery in the pass and was very pleased with all it had to offer. The property has since changed hands and while the grounds were only slightly below our expectations from previous visits, the owners/managers seem to be targeting their market to a much older set (think 60 yrs and above in speedo swimware and bikkinis). If that is what you are looking for,then this is the property for you. However, it you are looking for a bit more activity than basket weaving and like, you may want to look into another property. The condo was very nice; it appeared to have been recently rennovated. The Resort Quest instruction guide indicated all visitors must be quiet between the hours of 9pm and 9am. So if this is not quite the island excitement, adventure and night life you are seeking, please look elsewhere. Also note that the "free" internet service didn't work in the condos. You must be outside to get a weak signal. We stayed one night and even before our heads hit the pillow we had booked a room at the Westin Kaanapali Resort and Spa, were they catered to your every comfort and wish. It cost a little more, but it was worth every dime. Westin review to follow.

Reviews.Title: “great time at ResortQuest Kaanapali Villas”
Reviews.Author: jenmaren
Reviews.Content: We booked this resort through our travel agent for our honeymoon. When we went to check in, they brought our luggage to the room for us. They put us in a room on the far side of the resort as they would be redoing the larger pools near the beach later in the week (more later). We had a corner studio (Banyon 141) , which overlooked the smaller pool (which is great for evening swimming). Because it was a corner studio, we had sliding glass doors on 2 sides of the room which gave it a great outdoor feel. The room was nicely furnished and the grounds looked good. All of the staff that we encountered (hotel, spa and restaurant) were very friendly and helpful. While the pools weren't new and fancy like some other hotels, they looked fine to us. Later in the week they began construction on the larger pools, so it should be great for the next visit. As an appreciation to the customers for enduring the construction, they had a Mai Tai party on the Friday during our stay and planned other events which we didn't attend since they were after our departure. The beach access was just a short stroll across the property from our room. We took advantage of the lounge chairs on the grassy area above the beach for watching the sunset. We had a wonderful time here. All the buildings, but one, are only two stories so we felt a part of our surroundings. If you are looking for something totally fancy (and very expensive) with 24 hour room service, then this isn't the place for you. If you want friendly service, spacious rooms (they are privately owned so there will be differences between rooms), proximity to the beach and lush surroundings, then you'll be happy here. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Heaven on Earth”
Reviews.Author: tlm1125
Reviews.Content: Apon arrival we discouvered that our travel agent had only booked us one room. Needless to say we were very upset, but we had our doc's that showed we were to recieve 2 rooms. The staff were just the best about this little upset, us, not really sure who had made the mistake, hotel or travel agent, well we were quite worried to say the least. BUT..the staff set our minds at ease and offered us an up grade at no extra cost. We went to our rooms and found that we were in heaven on earth. The rooms they gave us were condo's, one bedroom with a kitchen. We were in room 322, on the 3rd floor, it was beautifully decorated and huge! We had originally booked a garden studio with a kitchenett, this was far from that, it was a place that we will return to for years to come. We will also request this same room. The staff were the best, and our view was to die for. I believe that anywhere you stay in this hotel you will be very happy with. The short walk to the beach(just accross the yard from the beautiful POOLS) was just awsome. The beach in its self was very picture perfect, be sure to catch a sunset, and sunrise. We recieved nothing but the best of first class treatment here. This is how they treated each and everyone of their guest's, i know...dosn't sound real hugh, but it is. Everything from the towels to the bar of soap was the best. Do not hesitate to check this property out, you will not regret a second here. We can not comment on the cafe that is by the pool as we loved our room so much we actually even chose to cook and eat in it, it was so comfortable. Do yourself and family a favor, book now. This is so perfect for a honeymoon, for anything!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Condo Hotel with a Fantastic Location”
Reviews.Author: IETraveler
Reviews.Content: Our family of 4 just returned from a week stay at this condominium hotel and thoroughly enjoyed it. We upgraded from the Freedom Rate Garden View Studio to a Oceanview studio that also overlooked the two main pools, The Castaway restaurant and well-maintained gardens. It was a great decision. The unit (#274 in the Dolphin building) was very clean with a very nice bathroom, kitchen and living room. There was a pull out sofa for our boys and a Murphy bed (queen size) for the two of us. Folding up the Murphy bed gave us extra space which was great. The view from the wrap-around lanai was spectacular. The staff at the hotel was friendly and efficient. The events coordinator was great. Parking was not an issue as stated in other posts. The pools were not in the best condition, but the water was clean and maintained daily. Besides, being situated on the most incredible beach, the pools are just a minor alternative. We would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Never again”
Reviews.Author: Rocklin3
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 2 week stay in Maui, however this Resort Quest property is one that I will never recommend to anyone. The first night we arrived we unpacked and stowed our belongings utilizing the very small safe for our valuables. We went to dinner on property and returned to our room that night. However while we were at dinner someone with access to a master key entered our room and stole our sons video games, and some of my lingerie. When we advised management about what had happened their reply was "You should have used the safe" I find it hard to belieive that I am expected to place all my bras and panties in the safe to keep them safe from the staff from pilfering my belongings. The staff was then very rude to us. Then we received a notice that they were going to be spraying insecticide in the main tower and if anyone was pregnant, had allergies or upper respitory problems call and let the front desk know and they would not spray the room. The notice also stated that if there were any birds, animals or food left out and uncovered they WOULD NOT spray. However, after advising the Homeowner office and the management that my son suffers from allergies and I from an upper respitory problem they assured us that they would not spray our room. We also called and confirmed they would not spray on the scheduled day. They stated no problem. Well, while we were at the beach they sprayed the room even though there was opened food out and we had requested and confirmed that they would not spray. The carpert in 416 was thoroughly soaked. We immediately removed us from the room and went down to the front desk. There we encountered such unorganized unsympathectic humans. We demanded a new room immediately and had to move all of our belongings out asap. Even though we received a new room that had not been sprayed my husband and I suffered from chemical burns to our feet in additon to dirreaha and headache that night due to exposure to the chemical spray in our room 416.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: kkic04
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here July 13-15. We wanted to spend a few nights in the Kaanapali area and decided this was a great alternative to the pricey resorts, especially considering the beaches in Hawaii are public. We booked our room through Orbitz and ended up with a spacious room - full kitchen, living room and a bedroom with king size bed that could be separated from the living room area with a folding partition. The bathroom was huge. Although the space with a bit outdated, we didn't mind. We came to Hawaii for the sun and beaches - not to spend time in a hotel room! Black Rock is a short walk along the beach and definitely provided the best snorkeling on our trip. A lot better than Molokini and completely free! Get out there early to avoid the crowds. The beach in front of Resortquest is really nice and not as crowded as the rest of Kaanapali Beach in front of the other huge resorts. We never used the pool, so we can't comment, although it looked to be of a decent size. At night, we watched the sunsets from the lounge chairs on the lawn, surrounded by flickering tiki torches. The on-site restaurant was nothing special, although we only ate lunch there one time. There is a grocery store down the street, so pack a cooler with a picnic lunch and spend the day on the beach. Overall, our experience was nice and we would probably stay here again. Great location, great beach, what more could you ask for?

Reviews.Title: “beautiful location great price”
Reviews.Author: rivika
Reviews.Content: We spent 2 nights at the maui kaanapali villas. I must say it was a pleasant surprise for us to stay at this neat,convenient property. The beach is awesome.We stayed at the Sheraton&the Htayy after that and we decided there is noo reeason to pay so much in Maui when you have the villas solution.They have a few pools,beautiful gardens,a decent cafe and a gret beach. Located 15 minutes walk from the Whaler's village so you have all shopping,restaurants&action whle you can enjoy tranquility on site. Even though most people prefer the Black rock area for snorkelling,husband&I loved the quiet sunset&sunrise by the villas. Two things we would chage are the uncomfortable bed and reserving an oceanview or oceanfront studio. The unit was big,clean,wide shower with a massage head,nice lanai,even though the entrance to the unit was close to the parking lot and main street,we didnt have any noise. Overall,loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Maui Kaanapali Villas”
Reviews.Author: back2home
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Kaanapali Villas for a week in June 07. I'd say this is a good hotel. If you are looking for a calm and quite place on the beach this is the place to stay. We stayed in studio with kitchen. The rooms are quite big, the largest in the area, I believe. But probably best thing about this hotel is its staff. I have stayed in 50 odd hotels in my life, but I think this is the best staff I have ever seen. Extremely responsive and efficient. Besides, there is a small store in this hotel, so if you need something quickly, you dont have to drive 3 miles to Safeway or Longs Drugs. Now the bad things. The hotels looks very old. The lobby looks like it is breaking down. The room was better although some stuffs were pretty old like microwave oven. They are also renovating the hotel, so construction work is going on and that's why it also looked even worse. Another thing with the renovation is that for some rooms it might be very noisy if construction work is going on nearby. Check with the front desk. One more thing: wireless internet connection was very weak, actually useless. They changed my room (and also put us in different building) for that, but it improved very little. Had to go down everytime in the library downstairs for internet connection, which was very inconvenient. Anyway, we enjoyed our stay here as the hotel was good enough to satisfy our basic needs. I think with this price it would be difficult to find anything better on Kaanapali beach.

Reviews.Title: “Loved everything about it!”
Reviews.Author: aaronmet
Reviews.Content: My husband, 5 yr old, 3 yr old & I spent 8 nights at this wonderful resort. We were in room # 260 Coconut building which was a 1 bedroom garden view suite. The extra bedroom was upstairs like a loft with a queen bed and own bathroom w/shower. Downstairs was a full kitchen with dishwasher, microwave, oven & full fridge, king size bed, pull out sofa and gorgeous bathroom. This unit had been remodeled in Nov. of 2006. It was gorgeous with all updated appliances and granite countertops. Our lanai looked over the smaller pool of the resort and 1 of 2 shuffleboards. The unit is about a 5 minute walk to the other 2 larger pools, restaurant & one of the most beautiful beaches in Maui. The beach was wonderful and about 200 yards down was great snorkelling. We took advantage of the free trolley into the Whaler's Village and other stops through Kaanapali. We ate dinner 1 night at the restaurant on site and all of us had a great meal - fish & chips were awesome. My parents had breakfast there and really enjoyed the huge pancakes! My parents stayed in room # 190 Banyan building - studio garden view suite overlooking the smaller pool. It had not been updated like ours. The rooms that have not been updated are the only reason why I think this resort doesn't get a higher rating on Expedia. We were completely satisfied with our stay. I would just make sure that when you book you request a room that has been recently renovated.

Reviews.Title: “Can be great - depends on unit...”
Reviews.Author: kermatlon
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Kaanapali Villas from May 11th - May 17th. This resort is beautiful and the grounds are well maintained. The proximity to the beach is unbeatable, the pools are great and swimming at the beach in not a problem for small children (waves are small and undertow is not an issue). Having said that, keep in mind that the units are individually owned and are all different. The first unit we were given was in the Aloha building and was not nice. No carpet, an old cracked plastic partition separating the living room from the bedroom and it smelled funky. I explained this to the front desk and was given another unit to look at. The second unit was in the Banyan building and while it was very nicely decorated, it had a loft bedroom with no privacy (I stayed there with my husband and 7 year old twins). When I booked on Travelocity the room description said that it was a 1,200 sq. ft. unit and the loft room was certainly not that. I went back to the front desk again and was given a third room. I also explained to the front desk that the description on Travelocity was different from what I was seeing. She said that the description is not guaranteed. The third unit we were given was also in the Aloha building (Unit #322) and it was beautiful. Nicely decorated, all updated. We were very happy with this unit. Another plus, the parking near our unit was never a problem. And it's close the the laundry. Be aware that even if it says there are a washer/dryer in the unit, they are not always available to the renter. In all three units I saw, they were not available. We ended up loving the Kaanapali Villas, but the first impression was not a good one. Keep this in mind when booking.

Reviews.Title: “Had an awesome time at resortquest”
Reviews.Author: mreen
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the resortquest kaanapali maui villas with my aunt and cousin from May 10 to the 16. It was a dream vacation for my aunt who turned 75 this year. We had a wonderful time on our first trip to Hawaii. We definitely will return. I think some of the reviewers were just too picky on this resort. Yes, this is an older facility, but the owners take care of the property. It's clean and well-kept. We stayed in a one-bedroom that could easily fit six people. It's right on the beach, close to whaler's village(loved the hula Grill). The staff is friendly, they go out of their way to help you. When my bags were delayed for a day, they helped me track it down by calling the airport. On Mother's Day, we spent the day at the spa. It was awesome. Don't waste your money on going to a spa at one of the big resorts. I think you can get the same kind of massage or facial for less money at Resortquest. The people who book activities are also helpful. Cast Away cafe, the onsite restaurant is a great place to dine for breakfast or dinner if you are tired. The prices are also reasonable. Thanks to all the staff for making this such a memorable vacation for us.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for us”
Reviews.Author: Lorind
Reviews.Content: Perfect spot for a relaxing, low-key family visit to Maui. Clean, well-appointed condo (#212, which I highly recommend). Very beautiful, quiet grounds - even though the place was sold out, we rarely saw more than a few people out on their balconies. Perfect sandy beach, nicely situated between two rockier beaches (Black Rock and the Kaanapali Westin beach, a 3-minute walk, and great for snorkeling). Helpful staff - particularly concierge and equipment rental folks. We ate lunch several times in the little restaurant by the pool, and had great burgers, salads, etc. Quick drive to markets, shopping, Lahaina...and I hear there are shuttles and busses, although we didn't use them. If I were to criticize, I'd say the poolscould use an update, but my kids had a fine time. This is NOT your destination if you're looking for 5-star cuisine, rocking nightlife on premises, massive pools with rockslides, or the singles scene. It was lovely.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for couples as well as families”
Reviews.Author: suzanners
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Villas for 5 days. First we got the towers section and found that the condo we got was a little dingy and without a lanai. So we asked for an upgrade and got room 173 in the Dolphin building which was perfect. By the way, this building is closest to the pool and beach. The place was clean, bright, on the ground level so very easy access to the pool and beach. Everyday was perfect. There is a small restaurant that the hotel owns which was also perfect if you wanted to get a bite to eat or have a drink by the pool. The service staff were pleasant and responded to our requests with a smile. The place is very quiet even with families around. Overall, I would highly recommend the Villas for anyone. The beach was nice but in the winter, the water was a little rough.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended especially on a budget”
Reviews.Author: Xiongx
Reviews.Content: Kaanapali Villas was a wonderful place to stay. It had great ammenitites without the price. If you are tight on budget, this is the place to stay. My husband and I spent our honeymoon there and it was the most beautiful 6 days that we had. The hotel staff were very friendly and helpful and our room was amazing. The service was great and the grounds of the hotel was kept cleaned. The rooms each had a full kitchen and was fully furnished. We felt like it was home. The location was right on the beach so it made it very convinient to get to. Kaanapali beach is truely one of the more beautiful beches on that side of the island and it has a great view of Lanai and Molakai. If you go during the winter season, you can even see whales form the beach, which was amazing. The general store was convinient because it was opened late; therefore if you needed something, you were able to get it. The hotel was located among all the resorts in that area so there was a lot things to do. You can also enjoy live music at other hotels that were near by such as the Hyatt and the Sheraton. Whaler's village is not too far from the hotel and is actually a nice walk to get to. I would definitely recommend renting a car so that you can really experience Maui, otherwise you will be stuck at your hotel most of the time. If you are looking for more of a laid back area, I would reccommend the Kapalua and Nipili area because there is less resorts in that area and it seems to be a little more secluded from the main tourist net, however, some places may not be directly on the beach; therefore you will have to drive to get to a beach. Also, I would recommend buying groceries from a nearby store and cook some of your meals. We found that saved us a lot of money. There is also a $10 day charge for mantience and groundkeeping fee, which you pay when you check out. Lastly, try to enjoy your time in Maui and take it all in, because it will go by fast and it will feel like it was just a dream.

Reviews.Title: “Great sisters vacation at great inexpensive place!”
Reviews.Author: Mauigirl36
Reviews.Content: Aloha! My sister and i stayed here last year with a package deal we got with American Airlines and were at first alarmed at some bad reviews. But when we got there, the staff was very friendly and accomodating and we felt like the 2 girls at the front desk were our hawaiian sisters- they were so nice, laid back and friendly and even offered to hold our bags when we left at the end of the week since we had a late flight. We ate breakfast at the Castaway cafe every morning and found that for under $10, we got a great breakfast with an incredible view of the beach and ocean- even saw some rainbows at breakfast! Try the Macademia nut pancakes! And we loved the "beach cats" that played near our table every morning! If you're looking for luxury accomodations with marble bathrooms and a "happening" pool bar, look elsewhere but if you want an inexpensive place with good customer service that still has a hawaiian feel on THE BEST BEACH, BOOK HERE! Our room had hawaiian artwork and bamboo furniture and had this sliding privacy door to the bedroom that you could close if up early watching tv in the living room or getting dressed. The bathroom was HUGE with a separate shower/toilet area and the vanity area was huge with a pull out wall mirror and cool window blinds that cranked open for fresh air while still being safe and secure. And the bathroom vanity area had a double wide closet with glass exterior for mirror purposes and a bureau... which may sound odd but it was perfect. Full kitchen which we made many lunches in...and the whole place was spacious enough for the 2 of us. AND EVERYTHING WAS CLEAN. The beach area was phenomenal, pool was ok but we used it the last day before leaving so we wouldn't be all sandy when we boarded the plane for our long flight back to Boston. There was a safeway up the road but we found the star market cheaper. Never heard a lot of noise, despite young excited kids down the hall. We are going to Maui again in May for our mom's 60th bday and begged her to switch her timesharing for the villas but to our dismay there were no rooms available so we are going to the Whaler this time. There is no way we want to go anywhere but Kaanapali Beach! Water is clear, not full of rocks and relatively shallow so you can walk out a bit- you will love it! make sure you make the time for the road trip to Hana... and enjoy Front St in Lahaina...we went to front st every nite we enjoed the vibe and shopping so much!

Reviews.Title: “Our True Home Away From Home”
Reviews.Author: MauiRon
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have made Maui Kaanapali Villas our vacation home every December for the last 9 years. We have stayed in the same lovely and extremely comfortable unit each year, giving ourselves a sense of having "our own place." The comfort and quiet surroundings makes our stay more enjoyable each year. We have always found the staff to be extremely friendly, helpful and responsive. The grounds are immaculately kept. The Castaways Restaurant is intimate, friendly and with consistently good meals. The addition of the exercize gym and wireless communications adds to the variety of offerings. The close proximity to Whaler's Village, Lahaina and Kapalua allows for nice walking and adventure. Maui is truly a paradise. Our annual visits to Kaanapali Villas provides everything to make paradise our heaven on earth. We intend to keep coming back as long as we possibly can.

Reviews.Title: “not bad”
Reviews.Author: Keoki
Reviews.Content: When I first went to hawaii my wife and I stayed at the Sheraton.Was Charged an arm an a leg for amenties and the room of course.I said when we go back all we need is a clean place and a comfortable bed.That's the Kaanapali Villas.We aren't resort people,we are out of the door by 6am and don't come back to evening. I have to say I knew this was not going to be a 5 star hotel or a 4 star either.When we fist got our room we were not happy w/ the location,the front door was facing a hwy.We walked in the room and it was outdated,not a surprise.The balcony had a slight ocean view and that put our minds to rest.The place is mostly made up of retires inwhich it was good for my wife and I cause we go to bed early.If your looking for a party hotel,this ain't it.If you want a comfortable bed and peace and quit than this is a good place.Five minute walk from the beach,$10.00 a day amenties charge.O.K pools(2 pools).We were in the Coconut section room 266 which was very roomy and had a kitchen.If your into sightseeing and not into hanging around the resort this is a good place.Plus is was a great deal on Priceline.

Reviews.Title: “Much better than expected!”
Reviews.Author: CheeryLynn
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a 5 night stay at the Maui Kaanapali Villas. The staff was great, we were upgraded from a studio to a huge one-bedroom unit, the grounds were immaculate, and the beach perfect. We were very pleased and believe this facility is underrated. The location could not have been better, just a short trolley ride to Whaler's Village. There is a real swimming beach here, not just rocks like many hotels. We would certainly return on our next Maui trip.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay! Unit 126 is beautiful.”
Reviews.Author: rockcreekbc
Reviews.Content: The Villas are spead out over a large area which include a number of 2 story self contained condo buildings and a hotel type unit with smaller rooms. We stayed in a studio condo (unit #126) in the Banyan building which had been all remodelled. It was really beautiful. The bathroom was huge with double sinks, lots of storage and a fantastic walk in shower. The new bed was perfect. The grounds are very nicely landscaped. The pools looked nice, but we never used them as we spent all of our time on the awesome beach in the front of the resort. It took a couple of minutes to walk to the beach, but we enjoyed strolling through the grounds. There is a restaurant on site by the beach called Castaways which has very good food at reasonable prices. We sat on the patio for dinner and watched the gorgeous sunset. All in all, we thought this was a great place for the money. It was a very quiet place which we liked. We also stayed at the Whaler for a week, which was a bit more expensive, but the view from the 9th floor there was awesome. The room was much smaller and had older decore, but still very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed 2 of 11 nights, then moved onto another ResortQuest Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MBWinemaker
Reviews.Content: My family and I previously had stayed at this resort in 1998 when it was still operated by Aston. We had good memories of the place and booked another "budget" vacation stay there. I spent extra for an upgraded room which was tolerable but sorely in need of a bit of updating. The AC was not working at all when we arrived; After alerting hotel they repaired, but it barely worked and was noisy. My family and I enjoy swimming and time by pool and beach. Their pool was not warm and in such terrible condition that we didn't use it. After two days we decided that we could no longer stay at Kaanapali Villas, especially having been placed in a room near an area of wall sanding and painting. We had to cross through the area of remodel anytime we left the room and had to breath the dust. The elevator also was out of operation on our second day making the six floor climb, with our groceries and beach gear, an extra pain. We moved the remainder of our stay to another ResortQuest Hotel at Kaanapali Shores where we found a much cleaner, updated, and finer looking property.

Reviews.Title: “Great time to go to Maui!”
Reviews.Author: Lorikat
Reviews.Content: My sister and I go to Maui every year and this year we booked a cheap package just to get away at Christmas time. We upgraded our package, but first asked the hotel reception if we could check out our room that came with the deal and then a few other Condo rooms. I have read the reviews here and took notes on those rooms that people were pleased with. The room in the hotel portion is what came with the deal...It was a small room , clean and not too bad, but the bed was very uncomfortable and we thought it might get a bit tight with two of us, so we looked at the next room...a wonderful studio condo in the Banyon building room 224. We upgraded for $40 a night but it was so much nicer and wonderfully decorated. Huge bathroom, huge Lanai, full kitchen, comfy bed and pullout sofa. Although there was no ocean view it was very nice and quiet. We looked at a few other rooms and it really is the luck of the draw here. I've posted some pics of the room. We were in Maui from Dec. 13th through the 20th and it was such a great time to go. Highs about 82 degrees but none of the humidity that you get at other times of the year. We both came home with dark tans for Christmas! Hardly anyone in Lahaina...never had to pay for parking once....most of the time we found parking on Front St...very rare. Went to Warren and Annabelle's on Front Street for the 5th time....best show anywhere and you get about 4 to 5 hours worth of entertainment for under $50....you gotta go! The restaurant was closed for the majority of the week when we were there...but the Royal Lahaina next door has a great Eggs Benedict. Try the $1.99 breakfast at Moose McGilicuddy's in Lahaina!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and Accomodating!!”
Reviews.Author: LilLover
Reviews.Content: My experience with this resort is within driving distance of places you want to visit such as Lahina and Napilli or down to Wailea but Maui is pretty small so really anywhere would be nice however we spent alot of of time at night in Lahina it had all the places to eat and shop and is soo cute right on the Harbor. The room we had was a one bed suite. There was a full kitchen with breakfast bar, living room, dining room, seperate bedroom and huge bathroom with walk in closets and dressing area. We arrived at night and was pleasently surprised by all the tiki torches lite thru out the grounds, it was soo romantic. Location is right on the beach which was amazing as well on the other side of black rock a popular snorkling location. There is a nice restaurant on grounds but again we went to Lahina alot but we do know there are killer Macadam. nut banana pancakes you have to try. If you are going to rent a car parking is free and we were able to get a decent spot every night around 11pm. Most likely if you the economy car you will get a Caliber because everybody had one and couple times we didn't know which one was our silver one:) Know your license plate! On your to do list should be: snorkling in Napili Bay a must! Road to Hana but not with small children its a really long and windy very dangerous at times road there. It was great to see everything and I am glad I did but there really are alot of risks you take driving along the cliffs on a one way road people:) Luckly I was able to buy a shirt that said I survived the road to Hana, you can buy them in Lahaina! Halealalikea *spelling is totally off but the big mt there to see the sunrise aka house of sun!! Maui ocean center, 20 bucks a couple hours there you can see some cool things! Maui's Northshore had some huge waves with some daring surfers Pick up some info at the airport when you get there and you will be set! The hotel even provides alot of good info too! Weather in Oct was 83 average the whole time, it was pretty hot! From here we set of to Waikiki for another 6 nights of fun. Comparing the two, we wish we did Oahu first then Maui. It s nice to be at the busy place first then relax before you go home! ALOHA!

Reviews.Title: “Does it get any better”
Reviews.Author: cloes
Reviews.Content: First time at the Villas - I am a recent widow and went with my daughter, her husband and the grandchildren. We had two garden studios. My daughter stayed in Banyan #126. What a lovely condo and if any one reading this wants to take note, then I would encourage choosing 126. All refurbished - many upgrades; however, I stayed in Banyan #127 and it could not have been worse. It is in terrible need of refurbishment. The housekeeping staff were incredible ~ most definitely the friendliest of all the staff. The gardens are lovely ~ the beaches do not get much better. What a wonderful experience. We would definitely come back to MKV. Carolyn and family ~ Ventura, CA October 21 - October 28, 2006

Reviews.Title: “Love the Villas”
Reviews.Author: Tinafri
Reviews.Content: We just got back from Maui. We stayed 10/13 thru 10/20 at the Villas for the 3rd time. We love it. The location is great. The beach is wonderful at the hotel. Great swimming beach. And if you like to snorkel like us theres a great snorkeling beach just north of the hotel walking on the beach from the hotel. We love black rock also to lay on the beach and snorkel and we take the trolley from the hotel to whalers village, its great. We always eat lunch in the Cannery mall as they have a great food court. And shopping on front street is a lot of fun too. Don't miss Bubba Gumps and Cheeseburger in Paradise there also on front street. This is our 5th time to Maui, We really love it. It's fun, relaxing and just beautiful always. We will continue to stay at the villas and have never had any problems there at all.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it here!”
Reviews.Author: UWECSARAH
Reviews.Content: We knew we wanted to be on Kaanapali Beach -- but didn't really care which hotel/condo we ended up in -- so we decided to book thru Hotwire. The ResortQuest Kaanapali Villas was a wonderful place. Our room (on the ground floor of the Banyan bldg) couldn't have been better. The owners REALLY kept it nice. The bed was confortable and they had recently installed a stone inlayed walk-in shower with a rainforrest showerhead. We did have dinner one night at the Castaway Cafe. The food was reasonably priced. I had seafood alfredo and my husband had a burger. Our favorite place to go on Kaanapali Beach for food is the Hula Grill in Whaler's Village. GO THERE! The fish & chips are awesome!! Plus the Blue Hawaii's are yummy. You can walk to Whaler's Village from the hotel/condo -- but it'll take you 30 min. There's a free trolly/shuttle that you can take (but be forewarned that it's on "island time"). Snorkeling by Black Rock is awesome. We'd previously stayed at the Sheraton, so we decided to snorkel on that side. We saw a ton of fish, a turtle, and even a sting ray! I have nothing bad to say about the ResortQuest Kaanapali Villas! Hopefully we'll get to stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “I was very pleasantly suprised!!!”
Reviews.Author: solomon11
Reviews.Content: I was very pleasantly suprised when I stepped into our lovely studio at the Kaanapali Villas! After reading the reviews I was expecting a very shabby outdated room. When I stepped in our studio I was very pleased with our newly remodeled kitchen and bathroom. Our room was very spacious and clean with plenty of windows and light. The kitchen had granite counter tops and new cabinetry. Eventhough the Villas did not have the true resort feel like the Hyatt, it was very mellow and down to earth. It does look older, but the lush grass, palm trees, flowers, and tiki torches really makes up for it. Best of all this hotel is prime location! We had great beaches just footsteps from our door. If you want to stay at a nice place at an affordable deal, than I would highly recommend this hotel. You can't get much better than here with the price you pay!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: 39mac
Reviews.Content: Our family just had 10 days in Hawaii. Most of the stay was on Oahu, which was great, lots to see & do with kids 11 & 13. I did my research before travelling, and used the great resources of Tripadviser, so I thought accommodation wise we'd be spot on. For the first hotel, Hilton Hawaiian Village, we did very well. Unfortunately our second choice of the ResortQuest Kaanapali Villas once we 'd moved to Maui, was a bit of a disappointment. We did arrive early, so they found us a room, although we would have been quite happy to wait. It had just been cleaned, we think that about 5 minutes previously they had cleaned up the vomit on the loungeroom floor, (it was all wet & smelly). Also, it was a smoking room and the stench was awful. We booked our accommodation 9 months previously, so it wasn't like they didn't know we were coming! We decided to ask for another room. I was very polite and said that we were not smokers and could we have a non smoking room. Yes they said we'll move you to another for another USD$50.00 a night, this was a discounted rate! It should have been free! But we're too nice to complain. We took it of course, but it really wasn't good enough. Also the lady in the grocery shop there was busy cutting her toenails - ON THE COUNTER - when we went in for supplies. So don't say you haven't been warned! For the most part the place was in a good spot, but it was old, a bit tired, and the restaurant was very, very average, and none of it was extremely cheap.

Reviews.Title: “Nice value”
Reviews.Author: aewarfield
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel overall. Pros: very friendly and helpful staff, well-kept condo units (at least our garden view unit was), very beautiful grounds with views of both the ocean and mountains, nice beach area for adults and children alike, easy access to the pools and beach, nice ocean view restaurant, close proximity to Kaanapali and Lahaina shopping, restaurants, and (Lahaina) marina. Cons: on north end of black rock where resorts are right next to the main road (pretty views, but can be a little noisy depending on room location... we had no desire to use the lanai... Kaanapali area south of the black rock is set away more from the main road... fewer sirens and truck noise); no complimentary beach chairs on beach (although you can rent chairs); a few too many rules for the kids in and around the pool (no Marco Polo, loud play, ball, etc.) Despite this, our kids did have fun and so did we. Nice value overall.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: socalworldtrvler
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a five day stay at the Maui Kaanapali Villas. We rented an Ocean View studio from a private owner. Got a pretty good deal, and thought it was a great value. The beach in front of the property is really the best in the area. Much less crowded than on the Sheraton side, but still within walking distance (which we did twice- took about 20 mins) if you want to go over to the where the shops and restaurants are. We hung out at the beach in front of the Sheraton one day, to go snorkeling at Black Rock, but it was very crowded and busy. Definately preferred our beach. This is not the place to go if you are wanting something fancy, but it is great if you are on a budget and want a good location. We weren't impressed with the restaurant, but we only ate breakfast there, so maybe lunch and dinner is better. Much better to use the kitchen for light meals anyway, and maybe go out to Lahina for a few nice dinners. The staff we encountered were friendly enough, one of the maintence crew even went to the lobby to get matches for us so we could light our candles. Overall it was a great experience and I would recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “A peaceful retreat”
Reviews.Author: teheteha
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I visited Maui for the first time during December 2005 and booked the Maui Kaanapali Villas through Expedia. When we checked in, we were given a first-floor room that was very cute. After seeing the room, we asked about trading for a room on the second floor for more privacy and so we could leave the sliding doors open at night. The staff happily gave us a key to another room, but it was a smoking room and wasn't as nicely decorated, so we stuck with the first option. We lucked out with a great condo, and the other one we saw was fine, just not as charming. Hotel staff were always helpful and friendly. We were able to trade in beach towels as often as we liked. We used the concierge service to book a snorkeling trip and a luau. The woman was very helpful and we enjoyed both events (especially the Old Lahaina Luau). We didn't use the pools at all, but swam and walked along the great beach just a minute walk from our room. We were there during December, and the hotel staff added Christmas lights and decorations to the palm trees, making the property even more festive, especially with the tiki lights glowing every night. Walking by some of the other condos, some decor looked more outdated than others, but all looked clean.

Reviews.Title: “have realistic expectations and you will enjoy yourself”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: so, i have read through many of the comments about this property and am rather surprised at the breadth of positive to negative views of this property. i like it here and have been here a number of times and think that the quality of the beach, the ocean, the views, the openness of the property and the beauty of the grounds themselves are what makes this place special. perhaps what some people are not realizing is that this is an all condo property with each unit privately owned by an individual owner(rather than a time share resort or a regular hotel). that means you will be occupying the unit of an owner who is not there at that time or perhaps just owns the unit as an investment. with this situation though, there can be variables such as decor and upkeep that could make or break the stay of some people. on my recent stay i had a nice room with a good view and easy access to the beach. the kitchen was adequately stocked with pots, pans, plates, glasses, stove, microwave, fridge, and dishwasher. the room was clean and received daily towels and twice a week bed change. this seemed reasonable to me. for some it may not be enough. one poster's problem with the internet surprises me as there is free internet wireless service on the property. i had no significant problems nor did i incur any cost for usage. by the way, the wifi works on the beach or under the trees out front also. parking spaces are always available in back if not out the front of the hotel and i admit some prime spaces are taken by owners but then again they live here. it also seems that a number of the residents are seniors so that may be why there is a situation with the parking spots. doesn't seem like a big enough thing to worry about while on vacation. the castaway cafe is simple but good. no problems there. i would have liked to have taken my drink away from the cafe to the beach but the hawaiian law doesn't allow for this. i can't say i am a fan of the gate around the pool but my understanding is that it is there for liability issues and to protect the children, so what are you going to do? in the end it think this is a nice resort that may not have all the bells and whistles but it is lovely, calm, safe and half the price of a full service hotel. i would sure choose it over any of the timeshare places as well. stayed at the westin ocean resort last year and left after two days. but that's a different story!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay at Kaanapali Villas”
Reviews.Author: suzze
Reviews.Content: Our family just returned yesterday morning after 8 great nights at the Resortquest Maui Kaanapali Villas. We had a one bedroom garden view room. I had requested two queen size beds along with a pull out sofa bed. We have two young adult children, 19 22 yrs. old. The condo was large, bathroom had a large dressing area, nice kitchen, comfortable beds, furniture. The staff at the front desk was always nice, cheerful, the maintaince workers outside even said 'good morning' to us. The maid was a lovely lady by the name of Loetta, she always made sure we had extra towels, lots of shampoo, etc. Beach and pool area wonderful! OH< I miss it! I would highly recommend this property. Suzze

Reviews.Title: “Nice Condo, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: ctjwa
Reviews.Content: MKV is a great condo/hotel on THE BEST beach in Maui. The studio condo room we had was simple but sufficient. Our room (#144 in Banyon) had a full size fridge, stove, microwave, and coffee pot. There was a king size bed, wicker sofa, coffee table, and round "dining room" table useful for writing postcards or eating meals. The staff was efficient and friendly. They don't go out of their way to make you feel like a celebrity, but they all do their jobs very well to ensure you enjoy your vacation. There are two swimming pools, one close to the bar/resteraunt and beach, and one further back near the rear condo rooms. We used neither -- you're in Maui, on Ka'anapali Beach, ENJOY IT!!! The beach was suprisingly not crowded at all. I'd say on average it was one blanket of people every 50 feet or so. On the other side of Black Rock where the Sheraton is, it is WAY more crowded and noisy. We were very thankful the MKV was on the other side! But if you want more action, a little shopping, any watersports, or maybe just some more sightseeing, take a walk over to the Sheraton side. The grounds are very well maintained, everything is very clean (albeit a bit old, the resort was built in the 70's), and the resteraunt did just fine with its breakfast. I marked the lobby with a red dot and the resteraunt with a green dot on the attached map. Parking was all around the resort, and we never had a problem with that, although our room was toward the back of the resort so we took advantage of the further away spots anyway. Also, parking technically is free. It's included in that $9 per day resort fee along with the telephone and whatever else. Even if you have no car, and dont use the phone, you WILL be charged that. The only thing you can knock off is the safe for an extra $2 or so, but you will pay the $9 for sure. The rooms and resort are nice and quiet, we never heard anything through the walls (although it was our honeymoon, so maybe they heard us?!). The previous poster was right about the headboard being noisy if the bed moves a bit, but just jam a towel or shirt behind it and that'll fix the problem. But we were very close to the street and never heard any cars. In fact, we slept great every single night. There has been some conflicting reports about the internet. The real info is this: They have FREE wireless internet which supposedly spans the entire resort. We ran into a little trouble connecting in our room, but were able to use it fine (on the laptop we brought with us) in the lobby and other areas. The fee based internet some people mention is if you use their computers in the library. We obviously didn't do that. On a related note, I HIGHLY recommend bringing a laptop with you. It allows you to plan out some of your trip while you're there, look for resteraunt reviews before going out to eat, and download your digital pictures to the computer every night to clear room for more! The MKV has a free trolly that brings you to Whaler's Village - a great little shopping area.
