It seems like all of the Ka'anapali Beach area resorts are umbrella'd together with similar signs, trolly service, and roads. MKV is only a 2 minute drive down to Lahaina, a great area for dinners, shows, and shopping. If you drive into there, and dont want to pay for parking, there is a fairly unknown lot that allows free unlimited parking on a small one way street parallel to front st, behind the Lahina Store Grill. It's listed in Maui Revealed, but it's still not as popular as it should be. We only ate in the resteraunt for breakfast once, but it was very nice. The view is pretty terriffic right on the beach, and the food was typical of breakfast anywhere else. We usually ate breakfast in our room, which saved about $25 a day. Overall, I give this place a HUGE recommendation for a relaxing, price effective, convenient stay. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Overall a good value.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a hotel room at MKV from May 10-25, 2006. Our room was fairly nice, with 2 sliding-glass doors, one on each side of the room, creating a great cross-breeze. The air conditioning was very noisy, but cooled nicely. Our room (#523) was very close to the highway, and there was a lot of traffic noise. Earplugs are a definite recommendation if you want to get some good sleep. The room was nicely sized, with a big dressing area and 2 closets. The headboard was not attached to the bed or the wall, and would constantly bang against the wall. I put a towel behind it to prevent it banging, and had to keep pushing the bed against it to secure it. I found the staff friendly and helpful. Beach towels require a $20 deposit each, but this is returned upon return of the towel. Parking is a definite problem here. There is an almost $10 per night charge for parking, but finding a space close to the hotel is a challenge if you are trying to park after 3 p.m. It is required to have your parking permit in your front window, and even on doing this, we received a written warning from the security guard because he didn't see it! (It was not hanging from the mirror, but off to the side of the front window). Many nights we ended up parking in a back parking lot quite a distance from the room. Parking was such a problem we considered just parking the car in the morning and taking the trolley shuttle to shopping facilities in Lahaina. On-site laundry facilities and gym are nice. The Castaway cafe on the premises is nice, and the staff friendly. Dinner was overpriced and just average quality, but breakfast was a good value. I found the $15 per hour charge for use of the computer/Internet to be ridiculous! Many hotels offer this service for free. The beach is very nice with a nice paved path. There was a refrigerator and coffee maker in the room, as well as an iron and ironing board. Maid service was very good. I may stay here again, but would probably opt for a condo instead of a hotel room, just for the convenience of being able to cook. I would definitely shop around and compare prices, but overall MKV is not a bad value.

Reviews.Title: “Wedding in Maui”
Reviews.Author: poofie26
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just got back from our first time in Hawaii. We absolutely loved it. We stayed in Maui from the 12th-20th then Kauai from the 20th-26th. Our stay at the Kaanapali Villas was a very good experience. Upon check in I asked if there were any upgrades available for us and the gave us an ocean view condo. Like many reviews before just because it says ocean view it doesn't mean the waves will be crashing into the beach right in front of you. We stayed in room 517 and the room had no lanai. We would have like to have one but we dealt perfectly fine without it. The room itself was in perfect condition. King size bed, couch, dining room table, 2 sinks in the bathroom, large closet and a spacious shower. We even had a full kitchen with a microwave, big refrigerator, oven, coffee maker etc.. Our TV came with a VCR and a DVD player. Maybe we got lucky compared to other people but it seems like your best bet is to get a condo instead of the hotel room itself. Most of the complaints I read were from people staying in the hotel room instead of the condos. We also did not have any problem with the front desk people. When we asked for towels, soap, directions whatever they were always willing to help us. Never did we get a nasty look or no help from anyone. Even the maid service people were nice. But be careful when staying here in a condo. You will not get the normal treatment like you would at a hotel room. They will make your bed, vacuum your room and throw out the trash. They will not change your sheets, and give you extra coffee and toiletries. We had to ask for them and when we did we got them. Parking was also never a problem for us. Most of the time we got one of the prime spots right near the back entrance by the elevators. And if we didn't get one we never had to park in the street or very far from where we went in. We also had wireless internet in our room. We never had to pay for the internet on our laptop. This was very helpful in looking up directions, excursions and checking the weather. If your use to staying in 5 star resorts and expecting world class resort activities then this isn't the place for you. If your looking for something affordable, nice and clean this place is perfect for you. The beach area was right near the hotel itself. The beach was nice and it definitely wasn't as crowded as you will find near the Sheraton and Black Rock. But if you wanna snorkel definitely go to Black Rock. All kinds of fish to see there and it's a nice walk from the hotel to that area. We had more fun there then we did at Molakini. Maybe we went on a bad day but Molakini wasn't worth the money. We saw 3 times more fish at black rock then Molakini. Only saw 1 turtle at turtle town. The castaway cafe had very good food and the service was excellent. We loved being able to eat outside right by the ocean. Of the 6 meals we ate there in a week we never had a bad meal. My wife and I don't really drink so we can't help with the happy hour bar thing. The one complaint that I did have about the hotel would definitely be the resort fee. We paid $9.37 a day for this. They also charged us $2.60 a day for the safe but we didn't use it and they took the charge off for us. We ended up paying $75 in resort fees for 8 nights. They should just include this but they don't. We knew about this charge before we booked it so we can't really complain. Oh, the other thing we would have liked to see would be grills on the premises. A lot of the other resorts had grills that people could use to cook stuff on their own. They have plans to add grills and BBQ areas but it's not done yet. Make sure you return your towels to the front desk. They will charge you $20 per towel if you don't return it. And yes Maui is a tourist island. But we liked the fact we could sit on the beach near our hotel and relax or walk to the Whaler's village or drive to front street to shop and hang out. If your looking for a less tourist place go to Kauai instead. Make sure when reading these reviews you take the good and the bad and equal them out. Some people had good experiences and some have bad ones. I personally would recommend this hotel. Even though we had a very nice room we also didn't spend much time in it. We were in Hawaii to have fun and experience everything we could. The last thing I wanted to do was spend more time in my room then I had to. Why would I spend all that money to stay in the Sheraton or some other really nice hotel when I was never in the room or at the pool? Doesn't make much sense. If you want to stay at your hotel the whole time in Maui then stay at the Sheraton. They had a beautiful pool area and bar right by the beach. But we would rather save money and use that for other tours and meals. We also traveled to Wailea to check that out. I played at the gold course and it was beautiful. I played Kapalua plantation and Kannapali south as well and I thought Wailea was better then both. Kapalua was nice but the weather is not very good and it's very windy. It rains like 240 inches a year in Kapaula and it was always cloudy there. The area of Wailea is gorgeous. If money is no object then stay there. Plenty of expensive shops and very nice beaches. If you can afford the Grand Wailea and you don't mind staying in the resort area the whole time stay there. We plan on going back to Hawaii in a couple of years. Coming from Pennsylvania it would be tough to get there every year. 12 hours in a plane is a long time for us. Plus we want to try the caribbean since we heard nice things about it and the plane ride for us is a lot shorter. When we do go back we will definitely stay at the Kaanapali Villas again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location, quality of room poor”
Reviews.Author: Chicagotravel2010
Reviews.Content: The MKV resort is located in on the northern half of kaanapali beach which is much quieter than the southern side. (The Southern side is where all the big-name resorts/hotels are such as the Sheraton, Hyatt, etc and also where Whalers Village is). The location is great since the beach is less crowded. The grounds of the resort are nicely kept. The Castaway Cafe on the property is delightful with a great location on the beach. However, skip the happy hours..the drinks are only a $1 less and watered down. Better to hit happy hour at Aloha Mixed plate on Front Street. Remember to reserve the cabana on the beach as soon as you get there...they get booked quickly and are almost impossible to get on the day that you want to spend at the beach. The room that we stayed in - one of the condo villa rooms - was a complete disappointment. The carpet was old and stained. The bed seemed old and the mattress was uncomfortable. We also believe that the bed had bed bugs. The daily maid service does not include doing the dishes and does not replenish the coffee/sugar etc. Our room did have a lanai leading into the garden and a pool which was great. Also, this resort charges almost $10/day in resort fee apart from the room charges. What a rip-off...why not just include this in the room charge? Overall, we probably won't go back there because of the room quality.

Reviews.Title: “nice location”
Reviews.Author: Skamom
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from 5 days in Maui. We loved the location of this property and the beach was beautiful-just a few steps from the pool area. There is a great restaurant on the property as well-the Castaway-the staff is very friendly and the food is good. Our only gripe is that we made the mistake of getting a hotel room instead of a condo. This was the first time we stayed in Hawaii and did not have a lanai!! We were disappointed and tried to change rooms, but none were available. The room was OK, but nothing wonderful. The hotel has a nice lobby and a large room to read and use the computer, as well as a small "general store" for snacks and small items. When we discovered that our shower wasn't working well, the staff had it repaired within no time! We were impressed with that! Overall, we liked the property, the location, and the staff-but would not recommend a hotel room unless you can get a lanai!

Reviews.Title: “Nickled & Dimed But Otherwise Fiine.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Located on a great, uncrowded swimming beach and near a surprisingly good and what appeared to be an unknown snorkeling beach, this property proved a great place to stay for my first visit to Maui last April. The privately owned condo we stayed in was immaculate and featured a full well stocked kitchen. The maid service (sparked by a little first day gratuity) was very good. The beach in front of the resort was coral free and was excellent for swimming, sunbathing and relaxing. A couple hundred yards south lies the famous Black Rock snorkeling area but just 50 or so yards to the north is some coral formations that provide a very easy snorkeling sight that's home to more than a few sea turtles and a wide variety of fish. The on-site restaurant "Castaway Cafe" had good food at a little above average prices but truly excellent service. Try sitting at it's poolside bar (full menu) at sunset for some great views while eating. Make friends with the bartender and then count on good service at each visit. Other eating out options can be found at Whaler's Village about a 5 minute drive south. Another 10 minutes down is Front Street. Both locations are full of shops, restaurants and tourists. The only drawbacks to our stay were the "nickel & dime" fees ($100.00 + in phone fees, parking and in-room safe access for a 7 day stay) and a typically overpiced gift/sundry shop. Also the landscaping was somewhat less spectacular than I saw at pricier resorts. The resort itself sits in midst of a seemingly endless string of other resorts, hotels and retail establishments. You'll need to drive bit to see the true Maui. Also, don't assume ocean side or ocean view means you'll have the waves lapping at your lanai. Count on just a glimpse of the ocean from most of the units. But these were minor flaws in an otherwise wonderful week. Also, don't count

Reviews.Title: “Excellent beach and condo resort!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just returned from Maui. The weather turned around for the better and we had a fantastic time on the Island and at the resort. It suited our needs - the condo was well equipped and a perfect size. The location cannot be beat, this is the best beach on the Island by far! When the sun hits the water it is a beauiful aquamarine color and crystal clear and warm. It is very difficult to leave the water. The staff and Manager were very friendly and the Castaway Cafe had awesome meals for a reasonable price. We are very happy we chose this resort for our first trip to Maui and we will be back. By the way, we have been to many different five star resorts in Mexico and all over the Caribbean - Maui had something none of these places had. It was the most beautiful place we have ever been. Enjoy every minute of it!!!

Reviews.Title: “Two beds”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a week long vacation at Kaanapali Villas in Maui. We planned this vacation in celebration of our 17 year anniversary. I was not sure what to expect at the Kaanapali Villas. All I knew was that KV had a great beach and was close to The Whalers Village. After checking in on a Saturday, we realized our 1 bedroom unit had two beds. We had requested a 1 bedroom with one King size bed, since my husband is so tall (6'4). We quickly brought it to the front desks attention. They told us that they had nothing availabe for a few days. We got the feeling that they were not too concerned and they never apologized or tried to do anything to make things better for us. On Monday, they called us back and said they would have a room for us on Tuesday. So we waited to hear from them... they never called!! After several more calls back and forth, Thursday came around and we were offered yet another room. At that point, it really didn't matter, we were so used to sleeping like Lucy and Desie! Poor Customer service, I will never go back.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT VALUE”
Reviews.Author: SEEKER1966
Reviews.Content: Nice clean hotel in excellent location. In room kitchen. Recommend a stop at Walmart on drive from airport and stocking up on sodas and snacks. Onsite restaurant nice way to start each morning with a full hot breakfast, reading the complimentary newspaper, next to the beautiful beach. My husband and I stayed here in Nov 05 and are returning March 06. Close to Lahaina (where lots of stuff is happening) Stayed at Grand Wailea in 04 and found ourselves always driving up to Lahaina. Coral out front and slightly to the right as you are facing the ocean is great for snorkeling or walk to nearby Black Rock. Rented scuba gear at Sheraton right at the beach in front of Black Rock for a nice shore dive.

Reviews.Title: “Beyond our expectations.....”
Reviews.Author: Travellyn
Reviews.Content: We have just come home after 6 glorious days spent in one of these delightful Villas. We booked late and was not expecting much but our Villa was fantastic. It had been newly refurbished and had everything that we needed for a vacation 'home away from home'. Our room was serviced daily with clean bed linen and towels which also was a very pleasant surprise. The condos are conveniently located with a free trolley into Whalers Village for shopping. The Castaways restaurant on site was terrific, serving a good range of well priced meals to suit most with very good service. It was located right on the beach so just great for watching the sunset while dining. I would happily go back to this resort. It is approximately 37 years old, the gardens are beautiful and each unit is owned privately and is furnished by the owner, and ours (236) was wonderful. I read a few negative reports before we went so went feeling a little apprehensive, but these disappeared on our arrival. If you are looking for glitz and glamour then this is not for you but if you want a very good value resort for a wonderful vacation then these villas will suit your needs and I hope you are as pleasantly surprised as we were. What I loved about the position of these Villas, you could sit on the beach soaking up the sunshine and watch whales off shore, just unbelieveable. Thank you Maui Ka'anapali Villas for making our vacation as wonderful as it was.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Villas”
Reviews.Author: pwillmon7
Reviews.Content: This was our first visit to Maui and I must say that the Island lived up to it's name and reputation.. We stayed in the villas and I was very concerned about the location and what to expected. We decided not to pay attention and continue out trip.. We were overwhelmed at the facility. The room was much more than we could have ever hoped for. We reserved a garden view, got the road instead but that was okay. The studio was clean and well decorated. We NEVER saw bugs and anything. Having someone come and clean up after me daily was fabo!!!We really liked the idea of coming back to the room and not having to worry about loud neighbors. Very quiet and well landscaped grounds. We will be back again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice quiet location, good beach, watch for bug bites...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We booked an ocean view room, and when we checked in, we were upgraded to an "oceanside" room (rm 171)...a nice surprise. It was a good location (Dolphin bldg) next to the pool, and close to the beach. Room was standard, no frills. We found the service to be responsive, but not very friendly. Loved the beach, and saw whales breaching while reading a book from the shore! One bummer: My wife and I were bitten by something on our ankles, while sleeping in our bed the last few nights...not good. I'd stay there again, because it was a great value, and the location is very nice (and quiet!) - except for the seniors cheering the daily shuffleboard games :)

Reviews.Title: “The Villas were O.K.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the villas for 10 nights. We reserved a studio oceanview room and was booked into the main building. There are no lanais, and the ocean view was over trees and quite some distance. We had placed some candy and cookies on the counter in the kitchen, and were infested with tiny bugs after leaving them over night. After the 4th night, I asked to be downgraded to a gardenview so that my husband and I could sit ouside and enjoy the warmth, which we do not get in North Dakota. The gentleman I asked said they were booked and couldn't help. The next day, I asked a nice young lady, and she arranged to move us and our luggage to an updated room facing the pool with a large lanae. My husband was turned off by a big cockroach in the restaurant and we didn't return after that. They did have good macnut pancakes. I would stay here again if I could get a garden view room.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Buckeye12
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a one week stay in Maui. We were sorry to leave. The ResortQuest Maui is in a great location. It sits on Kaanapali Beach which is BEAUTIFUL and is just a couple miles north of downtown Lahaina. The people at the front desk were VERY friendly, polite and helpful. Our room was a condo with kitchen and partial ocean view. The room could use a little updating, but when you go to Maui, you're there for the views!! We were on the 3rd floor in 317 which looked out to a garden below. There is no balcony, there are sliding doors that open to let in the sun. The Castaway Cafe is great! You can sit next to the beach, watch the waves and wales and eat your meal. The staff there was great and so was the food! We would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “bad service”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband is disabled, arthitis and fused spine. Our bed was very hard so asked for a thick, soft cushion mattress pad. The resort had placed a thin mattress pad on our bed. That didn't work so asked again but was told the manager was gone for the day and nothing could be done about it until tomorrow. My husband was upset and demanded something better. So not until we had told them we were leaving, did they place a memory foam on our bed. The parking is very limited with all of the pull thrus reserved for the owners. They only had 2 disabled spots in front with one being reserved for an owner. We were forced to parallel park on the street. My husband's neck is fused and cannot turn his head. The parking was very difficult for him to do. After a week of parking on the street, the resort gave us a parking violation because we did not have our resort parking placard displayed. Didn't know about this and refused to pay, if any, fees. After arguing about their parking, they did provide a spot for us that was easy for my husband to park, but this came after 1 week of being there. It seems the only way to get some service was to demand and argue for it. Their Hawaiian attitude was too casual and didn't seem to want to please their customers. With the numerous places to stay, we will pick somewhere else. The beach was beautiful and the room was nice. Some small bugs.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable,casual, Beautiful location!”
Reviews.Author: msstinkerbell
Reviews.Content: My parents chose this resort off of Expedia.An excellent choice! You are right on the beach so you can enjoy beautiful sunsets from your room or from the resorts cafe!The Cafe is great , it is right on the beach and they have great Macadamia Nut Pancakes! The rooms are good size and comfortable. No they are not super fancy, but how much time are you going to spend in your room? My parents did not like their first room, no problem, just ask to be moved! They state that because these rooms are individually owned , the decor is different from room to room, and they were right! Our room was beautiful , but some others are a little blah.Be assured that this is a great resort in a great location. Very Hawaian at night with the lit Tiki Torches and beautiful grounds! The people who may have complained in other reviews, are probably never happy!!! The average joe will absolutely love their stay.It was my dream to see Hawaii and I was NOT dissapointed!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome beach but no frills accommodations”
Reviews.Author: denny_d08
Reviews.Content: My wife, two teenage daughters, and I stayed here from 12/27/05 â€“ 1/05/06. MKV is a condominium hotel, so donâ€™t expect bells and whistles here. This is an older property and need some updating. Most of the units are privately owned so each is furnished differently and some are definitely nicer than the others. I had reserved a one bedroom condo but received two studio units when they could not accommodate my bedding request. That worked for us because of the extra bathroom for my daughters. The lobby is some what dark and gloomy which does not make for a good first impression, however, the grounds are very well kept. The staff was always pleasant and helpful. The Castaway CafÃ© and Bar provides good food for a fairly reasonable price. Happy Hour prices were $1.50 beers, $3.00 well drinks, $4.75 for Mai Taiâ€™s and Lava Flows. The best feature (trump card) that this property offers is its location and the BEACH. Just north of the black rock, flanked by the Royal Lahaina Resort and the Westin Kaanapali Villas. Itâ€™s pretty close to everything. North Kaanapali Beach is by far nicer than the one over by the Whalerâ€™s village (which I call Waikiki Beach II because it was so crowded there). There is great snorkeling reef just 50 yards to the right of the property. I didnâ€™t like the pool area too much because of the no alcoholic beverages by the pool rule and the iron fence that surrounds the two small pools (too motelish). Daily maid service was no more than exchanging the used towels, dumping the garbage, and making the bed. I did see the landscape renovation plans that suppose to start this year. The plans have two new spas by the pool area, possibly converting the two small pools into one large pool, and adding two BBQ areas. That would be a definite improvement. All in all, if you looking for a good value, a great beach, and a laid back atmosphere, donâ€™t mind the basic accommodations, and donâ€™t need the upscale resort amenities then I would recommend the Maui Kaanapali Villas. If you are used to staying at the upscale resorts then this is not the place for you. Try the Westin Kaanapali Villas or Embassy Suites further down.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in Maui!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We loved staying here for several reasons: 1. The room was clean and comfortable with a built-in kitchen and dishwasher. 2. There were multiple closets and the bathroom was spacious. 3. It was right next to the beautiful Kaanapali beach. 4. We could get a virtually unlimited supply of Beach Towels everyday. 5. It was within driving distance to the downtown and other attractions. It was a bit far from Hana, but that's to be expected. 6. It was not very far (~25mi) from the Maui Airport (OGG).

Reviews.Title: “Thought it was great”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: It was an excellent stay, stayed in an oceanside and garden studio one of which was perfect and the other just a little dated. It's a quiet and calm place compared to the Kaanapali area south of Black Rock, yet close enough to take advantage of it when we wanted. The staff were always friendly and cooperative, we would definitely stay there again. Castaways cafe was definitely a bonus! Decent food when you just wanted something quick to eat.

Reviews.Title: “Great place!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We recently came back from Maui. We had a wonderful stay at the Kanapali Villas. We were on the 6th floor ocean view studio. It had a great view. The studio was clean and was furnished well. The kitchen was equipped well. Customer Service was pretty good. It has a great beach, just north of the black rock area. The waves were pretty impressive. We could see folks surfing right next to the beach. We had dinner at the beach front Castaway Cafe and it was excellent and included good vegeterian food. We asked them to make vegetarian cassedias and they were really delicious. They had a good Kid's menu as well. The only con is the $5/day parking fee and $1.60/day charge for phone. One other warning about Resortquest: we had booked through their 800 number and we had a reservation at their Papakea resort. But, when we arrived there, they said they didn't have rooms and hence they asked us to go to Kanapali Villas. It wasted quite some time during checkin.

Reviews.Title: “Great Time”
Reviews.Author: mintrav
Reviews.Content: When we (spouse & kids)arrived we were pleasently surprise at the surrounding grounds, everything look clean and well kept. The room we stayed in had a full kitchen and was reasonalbly spacious and clean. But if you are expecting perfection, it was not, small ants on the counter and slight mold in B-room corners. Daily maid service was mostly surface cleaning and sheet changing, as with most hotels. The exterior was clean and nice. The pool was okay, but it need repainting and it was small, but we didn't come to Maui to stay in the pool. The Castaway restaurant was a disappointment, it was closed for the week, but that was a blessing in disguised, brought our own food, probabaly saved $100's. We were right on the beach which was great for viewing, snorkling, and the kids loved playing in the waves. Beach note: the wave are typically too rough for small kids to swim in, try Baby beach as we did, much better for kids and non swimmers. Hotel notes: There were fees, parking/phone/safe that screamed Why bother, but they were not unexpected and other places didn't charge, because they were hidden in the daily room charge. Overall everybody enjoyed the week at the hotel everything was as expected or better (except castaways) and Maui and we would stay here again. PS: if you are travelin during the off season, expect hotel repairs and renovations, since this is their slow down time.

Reviews.Title: “Very happy with the room and great service”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were looking for a hotel in Maui that would be nice, comfortable, and not break the bank. We stayed at the Maui Kaanapali Villas in April 2005 and had a great experience! The room was really nice, and we had very good experiences with the staff. The only negative was that there was a day when we had to leave the room all day because they were spraying (we didn't know until the day before it happened). We were a little put-off by it, but then, we were planning on being outside anyway! We purchased a package deal which included airfare, car rental, and the hotel for a week. Overall, we were very pleased with the experience.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid at all costs!”
Reviews.Author: azaccone
Reviews.Content: Made reservations over 6 months in advance and advised that we were coming for our honeymoon. We booked an ocean sideview room with a king sized bed in the Dolphin Building and requested a second floor unit if possible. Upon arriving, we were informed that the owners of these units were occupying them and that all that was available were first story units further back from the ocean. When we requested something a little closer to the ocean we were essentially advised that this was the best they had. After reluctantly accepting the keys, we were apprised of the various fees for use of the safe, phone and parking lot and a fire and brimstone speech about the perils of losing the rationed out beach towels. Upon entering the very small, narrow and dated unit that resembled a college dorm room, my wife was startled by a colony of ants parading around the counter top and the overpowering stench of animals in what was apparently a pet friendly unit. I was additionally bowled over by the intense heat and the fact that our "king sized" bed was a queen sized Murphy bed that you had to pull out of the wall. To the front desk's credit, after calling the front desk regarding the non functioning air conditioning and insect problem,they sent staff quite quickly to remedy the problem. The gentleman who fixed the A/C problem advised that the A/C mechanism connected to the lanai sliding doors had been disconnected (no doubt by the greedy and lazy owners)and proceeded to fix it. The staff who came to remedy the bug problem merely sprayed the entire counter surface (where we would presumably cook our meals) with Raid and left without cleaning the dead ants off the counter. Although, a non smoking room I found it ironic that the owners would be so intolerant of tobacco smoke and yet allow the stench of animal urine and fur to permeate their "home". I would not have minded the non functioning A/C as I realize this is the tropics, however, my wife and I are both allergic and asthmatic and required some ventilation and relief from the animal smells. Regarding the ants, sorry folks. There's no excuse for this in light of the money we paid for the room. If I didn't mind bugs, I'd go camping. I've spent many vacations in the tropics and have never had to contend with bugs. Also, upon examining the bottoms of our bare feet, we observed them to be black with filth and whatever dirt had been left by housekeeping. After calling the desk again to please assist us with finding a cleaner unit for us, they advised that they "may have another similar unit tomorrow" but could not make any promises. This was not what we wanted to hear. The following day, after a sleepless night in the small uncomfortable bed, sub par breakfast at that glorified greasy spoon Castaways and a dip in the paint chipped swimming pool, we decided to call our travel agent to clarify the terms of our booking agreement. Mercifully, the agent advised us that we were only paid up for one of the 7 nights at this place. Looking at the clock, we saw that we had only a half hour to gather our luggage and check out of this God forsaken place. Prior to doing so, I consulted the Maui Revealed book (the Blue Bible) and decided to call Kahana Village a mile up the road (see my review for this "Real Gem"). Manager Vicki Betts was an absoute angel of mercy and offered us a beautiful two bedroom condo on the beach for approximately $20 less per night than MKV. Do yourselves a favor folks, stay away from this persnickety, flea bitten nickel and dime flop house and don't listen to the hype which is probably written by MKV condo owners. If it were possible to give a 0, I would.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Place”
Reviews.Author: SusieFormager
Reviews.Content: The first problem we had with this place was the unfriendly staff, which we encountered for the first time upon check-in. We were also a little nonplussed to be slapped with a variety of fees which they had failed to apprise us of when we booked our stay with them (parking, phone {whether you use it or not}, safe, etc...). When we got to our room, we found it dingy and run-down. There were live spiders and a dead roach, an uncomfortable bed, and visible dirt in the living area, kitchen, and bathroom. We also found that they had not given us the honeymoon upgrade that we had been promised when we booked the trip. To make matters worse, the room had a window that was open to the outdoors and only covered by some wooden slats which were broken in places, allowing anyone from the outside to see and hear what was going on inside. We called the front desk to report all of this and were told unsympathetically that nothing could be done and we'd have to stay where we were. Nothing was done to try and resolve any of our issues. Trying to make the best of the situation, we carefully rearranged the furniture and hung a blanket over the window the allow ourselves a little more privacy. The next day when the maid came by, she told us we weren't allowed to have the blanket over the window, despite the fact that the wooden slats were broken. We continued to encounter unfriendly staff for the duration of our stay, with the exception of the guy who worked at the rental shack on the beach. Whenever we needed beach towels or other service, we frequently had to wait for extended periods of time and finally wave down someone to help us out. At check-out, we were given a "scrapbook" and a dvd. The "scrapbook" was a Barbie pamphlet complete with mazes and cut-out postcard ("kids, be sure and get an adult to help you with this!"). The dvd didn't work. This place is a joke. Please don't stay here. There are many wonderful places on Maui to stay, but this isn't one of them! I'd recommend checking out the Embassy Resort.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Resort!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Maui. The first room we stayed in was a bit run down and not very clean. We spoke to the staff, they upgraded our room to a little more updated room. The room still could of used a few more updates. Anyway, as for the staff, they are awesome. They were very friendly and accomodating! Also, the grounds are kept very clean and are just beautiful. The location of the hotel was also great. You can do some great snorkeling just off the shoreline just to the north of the hotel! We had a great time, and would probably choose this hotel again because of location and staff. Also, the restaurant had great food at a reasonable price!

Reviews.Title: “When You Go, Drink Lava Flow”
Reviews.Author: swoopus
Reviews.Content: I donâ€™t know how much I spent on Lava-Flows during my week stay, but it wasnâ€™t enough. Loved the drink. Loved the property. There was a reef about 70 yards to the north which was great for snorkeling. I found the staff to be friendly, as well as the guests. The kitchens saved me a bundle, vs. dining out every night. We used the on-site laundry facilities, which we found very convenient. If you want to check your email, they have 2 computers on site. You will have to buy online time in the form of an access card. They have a mini-mart on site, which my daughter frequented often. They offered scuba lessons in the pool area, but we did not sign up for them. The bed in our unit was a little uncomfortable, so my wife had maintenance deliver a roll-away on day #2, and she slept well for the remainder. The property is close to Lahaina, and we drove there every day. Just to the south is the Royal Lahina Luau. If you walk the beach after dark, you can sneak up the path and enjoy the show. Make sure to bring a couple of drinks with you. There are tennis courts on the Royal Lahaina property. We were quoted $40 for a dayâ€™s pass, which included equipment.

Reviews.Title: “Good Choice”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: If you must stay in West Maui. This is a good choice. Quieter and cheaper than the other Kaanapali resourts. The north side of Black Rock has a nice beach with good snorklling. Much quiter at night. Nice Pool, Resturant. Well cared for grounds. Not the newest or sexyist place. But great deal for the money.

Reviews.Title: “We will Definitely return to this”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This was our 3rd trip to Maui and our first stay at the Aston Maui Kaanapali Villas. We booked our trip through Expedia and reserved a Deluxe Garden View room. The grounds are quite lovely and well maintained. The staff was very friendly and helpful. Our condo was located in the Banyon building. This building overlooks the long drivewayand other buildings. It was not a bad view. Our lanai was not large but it was more than adequate and had a table with 4 chairs. A strip of lawn and pretty hedges act as a buffer between the road and our room. We stayed in room 126 (a deluxe studio garden view room) and found it to be very clean and spacious. I loved the bathroom area. The large dressing area contains a roomy closet with mirrored doors and has a spacious counter and sink area. The toilet and shower are separate which is great--while one showers the other(s) can dress, style their hair, iron, or whatever. The kitchen area was adequately equipped and the main living area was roomy. It contained a queen size bed (the mattress was okay...not the best and not the worst); a large sofa bed (we didn't sleep on it but it was comfortable to sit on), a dresser, a hutch with a large t.v., a nice dining set, and a coffee table. The carpeting was in good condition, and the walls look like they'd been recently painted. We slept well each night and the 10:00 quiet rule is definitely enforced. We were not able to hear our neighbors next door, although, you can hear people talking outside as they walk by the rooms due to a screened window vent near the door. It's a great place for families, those who are looking for peace and relaxation, retirees, or those who are simply looking for a clean, quiet, and affordable condo. The beach in front of the villas is one of the best on the island. It has a great snorkeling area too. We booked a snoreling tour to Molokini and Lanai and weren't too impressed...in fact, we saw more fish, turtles, and coral in the reef area in front of this lovely and uncrowded beach. The restaurant overlooks beach and ocean and we found the food to be quite good. The pool areas are very nice (they even offer free scuba lessons) and the pool near our building was rarely used so we enjoyed having it all to ourselves most of the time. These condos are privately owned so each one is decorated and equipped differently. We were happy with ours and we were very impressed with how thorough the housekeeping service is. We can't wait to return to the Kaanapali Villas. Our only complaints would be the $5.00 per day parking fee (we never had a problem finding parking) and the daily phone charge of $1.56 regardless of whether or not you use the phone (which we never did). Also, the air conditioning is centrally located which isn't necessarily a bad thing, however, everytime we turned it to high, our non-smoking condo smelled STRONGLY of cigarette smoke. Otherwise, it was fine. Our favorite places to eat: Canoe's, Cheesburger in Paradise, & the Lahaina Fish Company. Favorite alternate beach: Makena Beach. Word of advice: Some of the Condo's are close to the busy highway. If you don't wish to be close to road noise then request a room away from the highway.

Reviews.Title: “Great Honeymoon!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We spent our 8 day honeymoon at the Maui Kaanapali Villas and just loved it! I had been to Maui once before, and stayed in a more exclusive resort in Wailea, and loved the Kaanapali Villas just as much. They are in Lahina, so right near lots of activity, but they also offer a peaceful resort, on what we found to be one of the best and most beautiful beaches in Maui. We spent the first three days of our trip in just a "pool view" room, and then decided it would be worth the cost to upgrade to an oceanview. We loved that room! It was on the 6th floor of the tower and offered beautiful views of the ocean and the well-manicured grounds. All of the staff was very friendly and helpful. We would definitely recommend the Villas and will surely plan on staying there upon returning to Maui.

Reviews.Title: “Good value - but a little too peaceful!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a 1 bedroom condo at the Aston Villas for one week in July 2005. The condo was very spacious and comfortable. It has a full sized kitchen, a large sitting room and a separate bedroom with 2 double beds. There is no gym on site. Our view was of the garden, rather than the ocean, but was still nice. The staff was very friendly and courteous. The maid service was minimal - fresh towels every day, but very little cleaning was going on. Parking near your condo can be a challenge. The hotel offers beach towels for use, so dont bother packing your own. Snorkeling near the hotel (North about 500 yards) was great! The beach directly in front of the hotel is very nice and the water was calm. There are 3 pools on site, however, 2 of them are literally right next to each other enclosed in the same fence, so i'd call it just one large pool. The other pool is quite small. The onsite restaurant, Castaway Cafe, was great for breakfast, but dinner was severely lacking the night we tried it. I went with a friend of mine - we're both single males. We were surprised at how few single women were on Maui. Maui is all about honeymoons, anniversaries and family vacations. We like the condo complex, but wished it was a little closer to the activity in Kaanapali. If you want peace and relaxation, this place was great..... if you want a little more action and people around, stay in one of the resorts in South Kaanapali near Whaler's Village (stores, restaurants, etc). There is a trolley that runs between the complex and Whaler's Village - we never took advantage of it, but it seemed like a good idea if you were planning to just visit the village and go back to the condo. Overall, we were very satisfied with the Aston Villas. The location had a lot of families and couples and was very, very quiet. You'll get good sleep here!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the condo..Beautiful Beach Location!”
Reviews.Author: On-the-Go-Girl37
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the 1 BR Gardenview villa for 10 nights. We liked the condo, very quiet. The furnishings were nice, and the beach location was fantastic! The beach in front of the condo was our favorite on the island. The food at the Castaways Cafe was good and more reasonable than most other dining places. The only drawback was the Cafe closed at 9pm sharp! So if you think you are going to be hungry later in the evening, go get the food early. The bar closes at 9pm as well. It made it hard to have a cocktail later in the evening in the room when the kids were asleep. Overall, great place for the money, and a lot less crowded.

Reviews.Title: “Great but very different room to room”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I arrived late into Maui and drove in the dark to the hotel. Upon check in we were disappointed. The lobby was not as nice as pictured and the resort of not lit very well. We got to our room which was a Studio and it smelled like an 80 year old man (nothing wrong with them) and the carpet was straight out of the 1970's (nothing wrong with that time period). My wife and I were not happy at all with the room. Our view was looking at a fire escape and it just was not good at all. We called the front desk to complain and he gave us key to 4 other rooms to see if we liked them. We found on that was better. We went to bed a 2 am, just not looking forward to the trip. When we woke up the next morning, what a difference the sun makes. This resort of very well taken care of, the grass is green, the tree are perfect and the beach was the best. We had the best vacation of our lives. I have been to Maui before and for the money - this resort is great. I stayed at the Westin before and it was very nice but for the money this was perfect. I recommend this resort but one word of warning and of advise. If you don;t like your room, ask for another.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful spot, highly recommended!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 10 day stay at the villas. Overall we had an excellent time. However, when we arrived we were told that our room had been double booked and we had been checked into another hotel in Lahaina town for 2 nights- the compensation was an upgraded room, a free Luau and free champagne. Although the 2 night move was inconvenient we still had a wonderful time. The hotel staff were very helpful and full of aloha spirit! The suite was absolutely huge, clean and everything worked perfectly. The location of the villas is superb - right on Kaanapali beach, away from the busy town but with the option of catching a trolly outside the hotel to take you to all the action. We didnt have a car and found that the trolley service was ample and FREE! We had a wonderful time here and would definitely return. The only warning i have is they do seem to tend to overbook rooms (i dont know if this has anything to do with the fact they are time share), if you do get double booked make a fuss and make it work to your advantage.

Reviews.Title: “"The Villas Were Maravillas"”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I took our very first Hawaii trip and we loved it. The hotel staff were helpful and the studio we stayed in was pleasant. I felt safe and my little girl felt it too. Thanks for the wonderful memories my daughter and I will have. Hopefully we can come back soon. Thanks again Kaanapali.

Reviews.Title: “Great family spot”
Reviews.Author: loriglover
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed here with my family. It was nice to have a very large room (1BR, Kitchen, livingroom/dining area, dressing area and bathroom) over a typical hotel room. The pools were great and clean (and a 5 year old can stand in the shallow end !). The beach was Wonderful!. Long strip of sand with gentle rolling waves and good snorkle spots a little way out. There is a restaurant right on the property offering great oceanviews at breakfast. The free trolley even stops here to take you to the shops and restaurants at Whaler's Village so you don't have to drive. We will go back to Maui and probably stay here. Its not 5 star but it was clean, the service was good and it was fantastic for the kids.

Reviews.Title: “Got More Than Expected”
Reviews.Author: LeonaSantaRosa
Reviews.Content: We expected to get an average discounted room. Our room was great. We had a room on the 4th floor over looking the pools and the ocean beyond. What a way to wake up. The condo was well kept and comfortable. The only bummer with the kitchen was that there was only one cooking pan. Other than that we we're set. Love the beach. It's very serene and uncrowded. The atmosphere was very laid back. When we wanted more activity, we went to Lahina or Whaler's Village. The Castaway Cafe is wonderful and all of the staff was very helpful. You never know what you'll get when you rent privately owned condo's through a service, but we were pleasantly surprised and very happy. It was the best vacation we've had and we'll definitely go back. LP, From Santa Rosa, CA.

Reviews.Title: “great location, decent property”
Reviews.Author: calinative
Reviews.Content: This was my 5th time to maui, we had a wonderful trip, the beach at the AKV is beautiful but can be too rough at times for children, we were travelling with a 1 yr. old and 3 yr. old. As with most Aston properties, they seem to be stuck in somewhat of a 70's timewarp, for example the balconies are unsafe/not updated to what would be considered to safety code. All in all though the place was fine, staff friendly, pool was a nice size yet unheated. My one regret is that I booked through Aloha Air who uses Expedia, which rents Aston ResortQuest units ONLY. That means that all rooms whether "ocean view" or "ocean front" are all located in the Aloha Tower. If you want a unit in the best bulidings, the Dolphin or Emerald, you need to book through a private owner. Probably would not stay here again, for the price we could do have done better, the "Ocean View" room was not worth the extra $$$ as the ocean was behind a screen of palm trees and a couple hundred yards from the room. Oh, and you can really hear all of the traffic rumbling by since there are no windows (only vents with screens) on the side of the room that faces the road, very noisey on weekday mornings.

Reviews.Title: “Serene, scenic, super”
Reviews.Author: prpro55
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had the pleasure of staying in a garden view room from April 21 to May 1, and could not have been more satisified. Unlike some others (perhaps) who've posted reviews about the Maui Ka'anapali Villas we did our research and knew what to expect when we checked in. Sure, we had to pay for a parking stall for 10 nights. Sure, we had to pay to use the in-room safe for 10 days. So? Like everywhere else on Maui, one needs to go there (Maui) understanding that it's going to be nickel and dime time. On to more positive notes, though - first and foremost, the beach at Ka'anapali is magnificent. Hardly another soul on it, at times. Quiet, obviously. Warm Pacific waters. Couldn't ask for much more than that. If you've ever been one of the 10,000 individuals on Waikiki Beach you know what I mean. Our room was terrific. Clean. Well-stocked with dishes and utensils. Coffee maker, a blender to make smoothies, a microwave, all the amenities. The few times we did go out for a meal we ate at The Castaway Cafe, which was outstanding - service, food, prices. If you want to take in a luau, try the Old Lahaina Luau. Excellent food, terrific entertainment relating the history of the Islands. We'd return to the Maui Ka'anapali Villas without hesitation. Just right for a young family, just right for a middle-aged couple, just right for those past middle age. We didn't want to leave!

Reviews.Title: “Loved Kaanapali Villas”
Reviews.Author: tagent
Reviews.Content: We just came back from staying at the Kaanapali Villas & loved it. We had a hotel room & it was enough for us. We stayed there for a week and would stay there again. Loved the location, great beach & had no problems. The room was large & roomy, VERY clean and the king bed was so comfortable. We are the type who are on the go all the time & as long as the room is clean we are happy. Ate at Castaway Cafe two times. Once for lunch, we had a burger & fries and once for breakfast. The breakfast was REALLY good. Easy in & out location and nice & quiet. Could walk to the Black Rock at the Sheraton for snorkeling. If you are wanting a nice relaxing vacation with clean rooms this one is it. For the price it can't be beat!

Reviews.Title: “A good value, relaxing family spot”
Reviews.Author: cmfyrman
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Kaanapali Villas 3 times. If you are expecting 5 star try another place, however, if you want a resort that is relaxing , a good value and a good place for kids, I recommend it. We stay in the condos that offer a 1 bedroom, full bath, washer/dryer, frontroom, dining room and full kitchen. We then take advantage of the kitchen to dine-in with the family. The Restaurant called Castaways is a pretty good place if you don't feel like driving. Also, just to the east of the beach is a pretty good snorkeling spot that doesn't require a drive. I believe it's called the old airport. One downfall is you will need to drive to get to Whalers Village or downtown Lahaina. So if youre looking for a good/safe family spot that wont blast apart your bank account, this is a good resort. Chris Northern CA

Reviews.Title: “great for family”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 3 day stay at the Aston Kaanapali Villas. I was a little leery of staying there but got a good rate on a one bedroom condo. As I had read in previous reviews the property is a little dated but still in good condition,( the grounds are beautiful!) we did not see any cockroaches at all. Our condo had newer carpet and furniture and was very spacious. The beach was very close and even though the staff warned us several times to be careful swimming. I felt very safe. There is a nice area just north of the villas in front of the Westin where I saw a turtle and lots of other fish, very clear and the waters not too rough. The staff leaves something to be desired and were not overly friendly but I didn't let it ruin my trip. This is a very relaxing property to just go and relax, not alot of excitement but it was just what we needed! Note this is not an upscale condo property but it was well worth what we paid.

Reviews.Title: “I would never go back”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were sent here on our honeymoon. This is a place to go only if you choose to basically have nothing special. There is no room service no special amenities other then a full kitchen, if you want to cook. Which of course on your Honeymoon who wants to cook! You have to drive to do anything! Next time if ever I go to Hawaii I will stay at a resort to enjoy the Hawaiian experience!

Reviews.Title: “Very relaxing place”
Reviews.Author: Gilliganuk
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a garden view hotel room. King sized bed and sofa bed for the children (aged 7 & 11; boy & girl - I guess they won't be sharing for much longer...). Having just stayed at the Waikiki Circle, this room seemed huge! Liked having a little kitchenette, not that we cooked there, but we often had breakfast in our room. The garden view was gorgeous - and we could just see the ocean in the distance. Housekeeping was very good - the sofa bed was always put away each day. The castaway cafe and the shop were a little pricey, but the food was good. Buy your breakfast cereals elsewhere though! Hadn't realised the Royal Lahaina Luau was right next door, but that was a plus, as we had booked our luau there, and could walk to it, and drink mai tais all evening. The children (and I) had fun on the beach, renting the hotel's boogie boards, although I'd recommend caution with the beach as it drops quite suddenly from being shallow to deep-ish. Other nice touches - internet access in the lobby, and a library ("take a book and leave a book"). I'd go back to this place in an instant.

Reviews.Title: “Not happy with the Aston Maui Kaanapali Villas”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our visit at these villas. We booked and pre-paid for a one-bedroom garden-view condo. The room description says that the one-bedroom condo is over 1000 square feet. Our room was barely 650 square feet. Since we have 2 children--a 13 year old boy and 9 year old girl-- we had requested two beds. Upon arrival we were informed our request was denied and we were charged $20 a day for a small extra roll-away. The kitchen equipment was very, very limited. The Aston meets requests for anything with extra charges. To rent a beach lounge costs $20 a day. We paid over $340 a day for a mediocre place. For that amount we would definitely NOT reccommend this place.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: A beautiful place. Great beach, great villas, fantastic and low key restaurant. Good place to stay put for a while.

Reviews.Title: “Best vacation ever”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: When we arrived at the door, we opened it up to be amazed that it was an actual condo, not a hotel room that we were staying at. The staff was all courteous, prompt and more helpful that I would have imagined. Hoping to go back to Maui next year and will definitely be staying at the same place once more. We were less than a five minute walk from our door to the golden sand beach. We were about a one minute walk from one of the three pools on the property. The Castaway Cafe located on the property (overlooking the beach) was fantastic as well. Our room was a studio garden view which included a kitchen, dining area, living room, baclony, bedroom and 1/2 bath (upstairs) and a full bath downstairs.

Reviews.Title: “A nice quiet place”
Reviews.Author: Medium-Roller
Reviews.Content: We just got back from our stay at the AMKV and found it very relaxing there.The place consists mostly of senior condo owners who rent them out when they are not there,hence the quietness of the area.We had a garden view overlooking the pool which was nice.My favourite part of the trip was the quiet breakfast on our lanai each morning while I read the paper.The resort area of the Hyatt etc. is definitely newer and certainly busier.Most people visiting Maui rent vehicles anyway,so the short drive to there was no big deal.After spending time in the resort area and lining up for restaurants etc., it really was nice to come back to the AMKV.The key to an enjoyable stay there is in getting a good condo;if you don't like the first offering then demand a new one.We did this and ended up with room 236 which was a nice second floor studio garden view.Remember these are people's homes and similarly the homes in your neighbourhood are not all in the same condition nor are they decorated exactly the same.The onsite Castaway Cafe had great food and reasonable prices versus other areas we ate at.I remember a past reviewer complaining about their prices and laughed when I got there because to find cheaper basically means TacoBell etc....mmmmmm...enjoy.We found beaches throughout the island were rough and not really conducive to swimming.That is what you get in January and other winter months.Some brave souls and perhaps stronger swimmers were not deterred by this and swam anyway.The island has many other things to see and do and if you have a decent pool,then you are getting a chance to take a dip.If you like the condo type vacation then book this place,shop at the local Safeway (you'll drive by it on the way to AMKV) and stock up.It is clean,affordable, and QUIET. We have not stayed at fine hotels in Maui but have done so in Las Vegas on a number of occasions,so we know what a nicer hotel is like.The AMKV is certainly less fancy but represents fair value at decent accommodations.It's a great palce for a family to save a bit of dough.If you're staying at the Hyatt etc. then you can't care about saving a buck.Enjoy your stay in Maui.

Reviews.Title: “M”
Reviews.Author: sactrip
Reviews.Content: We just got back after a week long stay at this resort. We stayed in a condo which was very clean. Everything about the condo was great including clean beds, bathrooms, towels, walkways, 32" TV, DVD, music system. The only downside is you will have to drive a couple of miles to eating places, grocery stores etc. if you don't want to pay big bucks at the Castaway restaurant. But the beach is right there - love the showers on the beach. We have no info abt the hotel that is part of the same property but we will not hesitate a bit to return to the condo.

Reviews.Title: “Great vacation”
Reviews.Author: AnnaA
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Coconut Building for a week in January 2002. Nice room decoration, comfortable room and kitchen, clean bathroom. On our trip to Hana (A MUST) we bought fruits and were making fresh smoothies in our kitchen each morning. There were all little utensils you can think of in that kitchen (like ice-cream scoop etc). Area is very quiet, but close to all sights - you can use trolley to get everywhere in Kaanapali Beach. We also rented a car (any convertible is the best) - very much needed since there is so much to see around. I thought Castaway Cafe food was average, drinks were awesome though. My best choice for dinner/lunch would be Barefoot Bar and Grill. Great experience dining outside - tables are standing in a sand. Watching whales jumping. Maui is the best!

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, would return next time”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: What a great way to spend Thanksgiving, in the sun and at the beach! The Kaanapali villas is a nice, convenient place to stay for families. The walk out to the beach is pleasant and close, and if you're adventurous, you can walk up the entire 3 miles and back with plenty of sites to see. The clean sand makes it a nice place for kids ti dig and folks who like to walk barefoot. The showers off the beach make it easy to rinse off before going back to the pool or your room. The staff was always friendly and helpful. They also have a security guard to check on guests and keep an eye on visitors. There is wireless connection in the library which is a nice open place to read and check email. The grounds are well kept and provide a nice walk. The rooms and grounds are very clean, and the housekeepers vacuum every day! We must have had a recently updated condo, as there were new appliances, glasses and silverware. It was right across the street from the train stop, a couple lights down from the Star market, and the golf course. Our family with kids really enjoyed the cleanliness and large rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Make Sure you Know What You're Getting!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently returned from our stay at the the Kaanapali Villas. The beach that the hotel sits on is the best feature of the facility. The resort grounds were above average and the pool area was clean. As several other people have mentioned, ALL ROOMS ARE NOT THE SAME! We were in a hotel room, not a condo. The room was very dingy, there were rust stains in the tiny bathroom, and the carpet was stained. We were able to see into some of the condos on other parts of the property, and they looked much nicer. The staff was adequate, but not super friendly. We booked through Priceline, so I'm not surprised that we got a lower quality room because it was a very low price. However, a facility that bills itself as a resort should at least make sure that ALL rooms meet a certain minimum standard.

Reviews.Title: “If this is heaven I'm glad I came”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Needed to find a super place for our 53rd Wedding Anniversary and found it staying at the Astton Kanapali Villas Folks treated us like royalty Spoiled us rotten The beach is out of fairy land The food was first quality at the Castaway Cafe The weather perfect And now we are back in snow country freezin'our butts But happy as all get out with our week in Hawaii

Reviews.Title: “Awesome!”
Reviews.Author: OrangeCountyRebecca
Reviews.Content: My husband took me to the Villas for our honeymoon 3 years ago. They upgraded our 1 bedroom to a 2 story condo! It was incredible. Ocean view! There are nice pools, beach is close, staff is very friendly! I totally recommend staying here!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: Nanajwp
Reviews.Content: We just returned yesterday (Oct. 10, 2004) from a week at the MKV. I can't imagine how they could ever get a poor review! We had a studio condo with a "garden view", although you could see the ocean from our lanai. They didn't have a room available for upgrade to what they considered ocean view, but they let us look at a couple of rooms and choose which one we wanted. We chose the one that hadn't been quite so newly decorated but had a better view. Since the room was ready, they let us check in early (about 1:00 pm instead of 3:00 pm). We had a large room with full kitchen (stove, refrigerator, dishwasher, microwave). They even start you out with a supply of dishwashing soap, dishwasher detergent, paper towels, coffee, tea, sugar, creamer, etc. I have to agree with some that the water pressure in the shower wasn't the greatest, but I've had worse at 4 star hotels. We didn't try the Castaway Restaurant so can't comment on that. We did take advantage of the 2 for 1 luau coupon they offered which was held at the Hyatt and found it to be very good and well worth the price. With the coupon from MKV we got 2 tickets for about $82 which included food, drinks and entertainment. You can take a shuttle to the Hyatt so you don't need drive there. There's also a luau next door at the Royal Lahaina that you can just walk to. We didn't have a problem with late housekeeping as someone else mentioned. The first morning we went out for breakfast at 7:30 and when we returned before 10:00 the room had been made up. I agree with the person who says a tip helps. We were always left plenty of bath towels, pool towels, etc. The snorkling was great just a very short walk up the beach. You can rent snorkle gear right there, but it is more expensive. I'd recommend renting elsewhere, especially if you are going to use it all week (which you'll want to do after you try it!). Many place have weekly rentals and Maui Divers even offers a free snorkle cruise if you rent the equipment for a week for about $35. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The only complaint I have is that we didn't make our reservation for 2 weeks so we could stay longer! We are already planning our next trip to Maui and will definitely stay at MKV!

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I just returned last week from a visit to Maui where my husband and I stayed at the MKV. We really liked this place. Our room was very large and very clean. We found the hotel staff to be very helpful. I asked where to find the laundry room and our housekeeper walked me to it rather than just tell me. The grounds were beautiful and worked on each day. The beach in front was great, not very many people at all. We walked several times to go snorkling towards Black Rock. We ate at the Castaway Cafe and while the food was good our waiter was not that personable however the other waitress seem to be very nice. I agree with the person who said there was no pressure in the showers and our mattress was somewhat hard. It is geared toward adults which we enjoyed we are in our 20's and loved the place. If/when I return to Maui I will stay at the MKV, I got a great rate and the place was clean and wonderful. Very quite and relaxing!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent a week at the MKV (Sept 16 - 23rd, 2004). We were in room 259 in the Coconut Building. This was a studio with a king bed. We had a full kitchen and a nice sized double sink bathroom. The room was decorated very cute and the bed was very comfortable. The carpet appeared to be new. We did not have a view of the ocean but we had a gorgeous view of the pool and grounds! We had easy beach access. The beach was gorgeous and less crowded compared to the opposite side of black rock. Also, there is the best coral reef for snorkeling about 50 feet north of the KPV. We saw gorgeous fish, huge sea turtles and even one octopus! I preferred the snorkeling at this location better than black rock as I found black rock much too crowded! We had friends staying at The Whaler and if we wanted to visit them we could easily walk to their place or take the open air trolley that was free! My only 2 complaints about my room as the water pressure was very weak and the temperture was hard to controll. Also we never had maid service before 4pm. This wasn't a huge deal but I thought I would mention it. Overall we LOVED the MKV and would return in a heart beat.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it - Great Place, Relaxing, Economical, GO!”
Reviews.Author: jeopardy
Reviews.Content: We stayed 6 nights at the Maui Kaanapali Villas in late September and had a great time. Our room was in the hotel portion (not a condo unit) and while it was nothing absurdly fancy it was more than enough for a place to rest your head and shower - You're in Maui why do you want to be in a hotel room all day anyway? The beach was relatively crowded but absolutely beautiful - some of the nicest waters and sands I have seen. Snorkeling is pretty good too, especially if you walk northwards on the beach to the public beach access area, or in front of the westin - go out about 50 yards and you'll have a hard time NOT seeing a couple sea turtles, tropical fish, and beautiful coral formations. If you're up for something more adventerous, set aside a couple hundred bucks and call up PonyExpress and book a Haleakala O Pele Crater Ride - you take a 4-5 hour horseback ride into the crater, which is more like being on Mars or another planet then anything earthly. It is absolutely amazing and you certainly won't forget the experience of being on top of clouds and riding around in an extinct volcano. A helpful note if you're traveling on a tighter budget - You can save 10% if you book online through them - search the web for 'Pony Express Haleakala' and it should turn right up. It's also worthwhile to grab a good guidebook (Maui Revealed was our choice) and take the road to Hana - its beautiful as well. Be aware - the road FROM Hana traveling the south side of the island is much more insane then the road to Hana - however we saw many people successfully navigating the roads in every imaginable rental car so pack a lunch and some snacks and set aside a full day (10-12 hours) for a remarkable experience. Wear hiking shoes and perhaps bring a pair of flipflops and swimsuit just in case - many waterfalls, pools, and scenic points are a small hike away. You'll trek through lush tropical jungles, bamboo forests, etc. It is a rainforest so don't be surprised if it rains on you, we got about 45 minutes of rain and its more like taking a shower, the weather is still hot (80+ degrees) and the rain falling is warm. Back to the hotel... If I was to complain about anything it would have to primarily be the construction going on next door, but realize this is hard to avoid anywhere you stay. Maui is a booming island and every imaginable beachfront parcel of land is being developed. Fortunately you can't hear the construction from the beach and most of the hotels property. Also, the food at the Castaway Cafe was mediocre considering the prices, and there is no room service which can be annoying. All in all I'd say Maui Kaanapali Villas is a great place to stay, especially if you're traveling on a tighter budget. It's very quiet and relaxing. If you have young kid's they might be bored stiff however, theres no super crazy waterfall pool slides or whatnot like some of the mega-resorts. The Kaanapali Villas are more geared towards adults, but I'd consider that a very good thing, its much more quiet that way. I think the reviewers who are complaining about things must be uptight and very difficult to please in general - yes theres a few geckos and frogs on the property running around, a gecko ended up in our room - welcome to Hawaii, theyre cute anyway and certainly nothing to ruin a vacation over. A great place with a fantastic beach - I'd go back in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Peace and Quiet”
Reviews.Author: mahalonuiloa8
Reviews.Content: Just returned from Maui (Sept. 7-21, 2004). Stayed one week at MKV and one week at the Hyatt Regency. For total relaxation, peace and quiet choose a Resort/condo on the North Kaanapali area. MKV is on North Kaanapali beach, it was serene, peaceful and down right pleasant. The staff was very friendly and seemed to be smiling all the time which put me in a good mood. The beach is excellent, the pool clean and nicely kept. Castaways restaurant was excellent but a bit pricey for me. My condo was nothing fancy but very clean. My condo was a split level. The bedroom was upstairs and the kitchen, living and dining rooms were at the first level. One slight and very minor problem, the AC did not function on the first floor. The bedroom AC was in very good operating condition. The trades were blowing nicely my entire two weeks so this presented no major problem. If you are into lots of crowds and activities, you are a mere car drive from Lahaina and South Kaanapali area. My second week was at the Hyatt and although a beautiful resort, it also attracts many tourists. Which for me is not ideal. I would return to MKV . This was my fifth visit to Maui. I usually stay in the Weilea area but I am glad I discovered this codo. For total peace and relaxation give this condo a try.

Reviews.Title: “great stay at MKV”
Reviews.Author: howietrout
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a week at MKV. Really enjoyed our stay. We were in a studio, I think the smallest room, and it was great. Full kitchen, seating area and queen size bed. Large double sink bathroom. What more could you need, your in MAUI!! This trip was great for us and I need to sing praises for Apple Vacations and there trip insurance. We were supposed to be in Punta Cana D.R. and changed our trip the day before we left due to hurricane Ivan. They had us on a flight 3days later to Maui, it cost more but it was well worth it. MKV was a great location to be at, just far enough away from the crowded Whalers Village and close enough to take a 5 min. free trolly ride to get there. We went to happy hour at the hula hut (in Whalers Village) a few times and really enjoyed the live music and drinks. I read many negitive comments about this place before we left and was worried, DON'T! It's a great place in a great location and remember, your in MAUI, how bad can it be!
